sourceString: Pharmaceutical companies are racing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.
targetString: ፋርማሲዩቲካል ኩባንያዎች ለቫይረሱ የሚሆኑ አንቲቦዲስ እነና ክትባቶችን ለማምረት ጥድፊያ ላይ ናቸው።
en-mt: Pharmaceutical companies are rushing to develop antibodies and vaccines against the virus.

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 mainly attacks the lungs in the beginning and probably also attacks, to a lesser degree, other organs that express ACE2, such as the gastrointestinal system and the kidneys.
targetString: ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 በመጀመሪያ አካባቢ በዋነኛነት የሚያጠቃው ሳምባዎችን ሲሆን፣ ACE2 የሚያመነጩ እንደ የምግብ መፍጫ ስርዓትና ኩላሊትን የመሳሰሉ ሌሎች የሰውነት ክፍሎችን ደግሞ በአነስተኛ መጠን ያጠቃል።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 primarily attacks the lungs in the first place, and other parts of the body that produce ACE2, such as the digestive system and kidneys, to a lesser extent.

sourceString: Nevertheless, respiratory dysfunction and failure are the major threat to the patients and the major cause of death.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ የመተንፈሻ አካል መታወክና ስራ ማቆም የታማሚዎች ዋነኛ ስጋትና ዋነኛ የሞት መንስኤዎች ናቸው።
en-mt: However, respiratory failure and cessation are the main risk factors for patients and the leading cause of death.

sourceString: Thus, respiratory support is critical to relieve the symptoms and save lives and includes general oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, and invasive mechanical ventilation depending on the severity of the disease.
targetString: በመሆኑም፣ ምልክቶቹን ለማቃለልና ሕይወት ለማዳን የመተንፈሻ አካል ድጋፍ በጣም ወሳኝ ነው፤ አጠቃላይ የኦክስጂን ቴራፒ፣ ከፍተኛ ፍሰት ያለው ኦክስጂን፣ ወደ ሰውነት የማይገባ ቬንቲሌሽንና የሚገባ ቬንቲሌሽን እና ሜካኒካል ቬንቲሌሽን እንደ በሸታው ክብደት ይካተታል።
en-mt: Therefore, respiratory support is critical to relieve symptoms and save lives. Total oxygen therapy, high-flow oxygen, noninvasive and invasive ventilation, and mechanical ventilation are included depending on the severity of the disease.

sourceString: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms have to be supported by extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), a modified cardiopulmonary bypass technique used for the treatment of life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.
targetString: ከባድ የመተንፈሻ አካል ሕመም ምልክት ያለባቸው ታማሚዎች በኤክስትራኮርፖሪያል ሕብረ ሕዋስ ኦክስጂኔሽን (ECMO) መታገዝ አለባቸው፤ ይህም ለሕይወት አስጊ የሆነ የልብ ወይም የመተንፈሻ አካል ስራ ማቆምን ለማከም የሚያገለግል የተሻሻለ የልብና ሳምባ ማለፊያ ቴክኒክ ነው።
en-mt: Patients with severe respiratory symptoms should be assisted with extracorporeal tissue oxygenation (ECMO); This is an advanced cardiopulmonary bypass technique used to treat life-threatening cardiac or respiratory failure.

sourceString: In addition, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, the prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and the protection of the functions of the vital organs are also essential for SARS-CoV-2 patients.
targetString: በተጨማሪም፣ የኤሌክትሮላይት ሚዛን መጠበቅ፣ ሁለተኛ ደረጃ ኢንፌክሽን እና ሴፕቲክ ሾክ መከላከልና ሕክምና እና የወሳኝ የሰውነት ክፍሎች ተግባራትን መጠበቅ ለ ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 ታማሚዎች ወሳኝ ናቸው።
en-mt: In addition, maintenance of electrolyte balance, prevention and treatment of secondary infection and septic shock, and maintenance of vital organ function are critical for SARS-CoV-2 patients.

sourceString: It has been known that a cytokine storm results from an overreaction of the immune system in SARS and MERS patients.
targetString: የሳይቶኪን ስቶርም መንስኤ በ ሳርስ እና ሜርስ ታማሚዎች ውስጥ ያለው በሽታ መከላከያ ስርዓት ከመጠን ያለፈ እርምጃ መውሰዱ እንደሆነ ይታወቃል።
en-mt: Cytokine storms are known to be caused by an overactive immune system in SARS and MERS patients.

sourceString: Cytokine storm is a form of systemic inflammatory response featured by the release of a series of cytokines including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.
targetString: ሳይቶኪን ስቶርም ስልታዊ የሆነ የሰውነት ማበጥን ለመከላከል የሚሰጥ ምላሽ ሆኖ መገለጫውም TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, እና MCP-1 ጨምሮ ተከታታይ ሳይቶኪንስ መልቀቅ ነው።
en-mt: The cytokine storm is a systemic inflammatory response characterized by the release of a series of cytokines, including TNFα, IL-1β, IL-2, IL-6, IFNα, IFNβ, IFNγ, and MCP-1.

sourceString: These cytokines induce immune cells to release a vast number of free radicals which are the major cause of ARDS and multiple organ failure.
targetString: እነዚህ ሳይቶክሲንስ በሽታ ተካላካይ ሕዋሳት ከፍተኛ ቁጥር ያላቸው ነጻ ራዲካልስ እንዲለቅቁ ያደርጋሉ፤ እነዚህም የ ARDS እና የተለያዩ የሰውነት ክፍሎች ስራ ማቆምን የሚያስከትሉ ናቸው።
en-mt: These cytokines cause immune cells to release large amounts of free radicals; These cause ARDS and various organ failure.

sourceString: Immunosuppression is essential in the treatment of cytokine storms, especially in severe patients.
targetString: ኢሚዩኖሰፕሬሽን ሳይቶኪን ስቶርምስ በተለይም ለጽኑ ሕሙማን ሕክምና ወሳኝ ነው።
en-mt: Immunosuppression is critical to the treatment of cytokine storms, particularly in the critically ill.

sourceString: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytokine storm.
targetString: ጸረIL6 ሞኖክሎናል አንቲቦዲ የሆኑት ኮርቲስቴሮይድስ እና ቶሲሊዙማብ የሳይቶን ስቶርምን ለማከም ጥቅም ላይ ውለዋል።
en-mt: Corticosteroids and tocilizumab, an anti-IL6 monoclonal antibody, have been used to treat cytomegalovirus.

sourceString: Other immunosuppression treatments for cytokine storm include the modulation of T cell-directed immune response; the blockade of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; blinatumomab; suppressor of cytokine signaling 4; and HDAC inhibitors.
targetString: ለሳይቶኪን ስቶርም ከሚሰጡ ሌሎች ሕክምናዎች መካከል ወደ T ሕዋስ ያነጣጠረ የበሽታ መከላከያ ምላሽ ማነሳሳት፤ የ IFN-γ፣ IL-1፣ እና TNF መታገድ፤ የ JAK መደናቀፍ፤ ብላይናቱሞማብ፤ የሳይቶኪን ምልክት አጋጅ 4፤ እና የ HDAC አደናቃፊዎች ይገኙበታል።
en-mt: Other treatments for cytokine storm include inducing a T cell-targeted immune response; inhibition of IFN-γ, IL-1, and TNF; JAK inhibition; Blinatumomab; Cytokine signaling inhibitor 4; and HDAC inhibitors.

sourceString: Steroids, as immunosuppressants, were widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: ስቴሮይድስ የሰዎችን በሽታ የመከላከል አቅም የሚጫኑ የሚደርስ ጉዳትን ለመቀነስ ሲባል ለሳርስ ሕክምና በስፋት ጥቅም ላይ ይውላሉ።
en-mt: Steroids are widely used in the treatment of SARS to reduce damage to the immune system.

sourceString: However, steroids at high dosages were not beneficial to severe lung injury in SARS and COVID-19 patients.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ በከፍተኛ መጠን የሚሰጡ ስቴሮይዶች በ ሳርስ እና COVID-19 ታማሚዎች ውስጥ ከባድ የሳምባ ጉዳትን ለማቃለል እምብዛም እገዛ የላቸውም።
en-mt: However, high-dose steroids are rarely helpful in mitigating severe lung damage in SARS and COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Instead, they may cause severe side effects, especially avascular osteonecrosis, dramatically affecting the prognosis.
targetString: ከዚህ ይልቅ፣ ከባድ የሆኑ ተጓዳኝ ውጤቶችን በተለይም የአጥንት ሕብረ ሕዋሳት ሞትን በማስከተል የበሽታው ዕድገት ትንበያ ላይ ከባድ ተጽእኖ ሊያሳድር ይችላል።
en-mt: Instead, it can have serious side effects, especially bone tissue death, and have a serious impact on the prognosis of disease progression.

sourceString: Nevertheless, short courses of corticosteroids at low-to-moderate doses have been recommended to be used prudently for critically ill COVID-19 patients.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ ከዝቅተኛ እስከ መካከለኛ መጠን ለአጭር ጊዜ የሚሰጥ ኮርቲኮስቴሮይድ ለ COVID-19 ጽኑ ሕሙማን በአግባቡ እንዲሰጡ ምክረ ሃሳብ ተሰጥቷል።
en-mt: However, short-term, low- to moderate-dose corticosteroids are recommended for appropriate use in patients with stable COVID-19.

sourceString: At the time of writing, no effective antiviral therapy has been confirmed.
targetString: ይህ ጽሑፍ በሚጻፍበት ወቅት ውጤታማ የሆነ ጸረ ቫይረስ ቴራፒ መኖሩ ገና አልተረጋገጠም።
en-mt: At the time of writing, effective antiviral therapy has not yet been proven.

sourceString: However, intravenous administration with remdesivir, a nucleotide analog, has been found to be efficacious in an American patient with COVID-19.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ ኒውክሎታይድ አናሎግ የሆነው ሬምዴሲቪር በደም ስር አማካይነት የተሰጠው አንድ አሜሪካዊ የ COVID-19 ታማሚ ላይ ውጤት አሳይቷል።
en-mt: However, the nucleotide analogue remdesivir, given intravenously, has shown results in an American patient with COVID-19.

sourceString: Remdesivir is a novel antiviral drug developed by Gilead initially for the treatment of diseases caused by Ebola and Marlburg viruses.
targetString: ሬምዴሲቪር በ Gilead የተዘጋጀ አዲስ ጸረ ቫይረስ መድሃኒት ሲሆን፣ በመጀመሪያ በኢቦላና ማርበርግ ቫይረሶች የተከሰቱ በሽታዎችን ለማከም የታሰበ ነበር።
en-mt: Remdesivir is a new antiviral drug developed by Gilead, originally intended to treat diseases caused by the Ebola and Marburg viruses.

sourceString: Later, remdesivir also demonstrated possible inhibition of other single stranded RNA viruses including MERS and SARS viruses.
targetString: በኋላ ላይ፣ ሬምዴሲቪር የ ሜርስ እና ሳርስ ቫይረሶችን ጨምሮ ባለነጠላ RNA ቫይረሶችን እንቅስቃሴ ማደናቀፉን አሳይቷል።
en-mt: Later, remdesivir was shown to inhibit the activity of single-stranded RNA viruses, including the MERS and SARS viruses.

sourceString: Based on these, Gilead has provided the compound to China to conduct a pair of trials on SARS-CoV-2-infected individuals, and the results are highly anticipated.
targetString: በዚህ መሰረት፣ Gilead ውህድ ንጥረ ነገሩን ለቻይና ያስረከበ ሲሆን በ ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 የተጠቁ ግለሰቦች ላይ ጥምር ሙከራዎችን ለማድረግ እንድትችል ነበር፤ ውጤቶቹም በከፍተኛ ጉጉት ይጠበቃሉ።
en-mt: Accordingly, Gilead submitted the compound to China so that it could conduct trials of the combination on individuals infected with SARS-CoV-2; The results are eagerly awaited.

sourceString: In addition, baricitinb, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested as potential therapies for patients with acute respiratory symptoms.
targetString: በተጨማሪም፣ ባሪሲቲንብ፣ ኢንተርፌሮን-α፣ ሎፒናቪር/ሪቶናቪር እና ሪባቪሪን ከባድ የመተንፈሻ አካል ሕመም ምልክት ላለባቸው ታማሚዎች በቴራፒነት እንዲያገለግሉ ሃሳበ ቀርቦ ነበር።
en-mt: In addition, baricitinib, interferon-α, lopinavir/ritonavir, and ribavirin have been suggested for therapeutic use in patients with symptomatic severe respiratory disease.

sourceString: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions can occur following combined therapy with lopinavir/ritonavir.
targetString: ተቅማጥ፣ ማቅለሽለሽ፣ ትውከት፣ የጉበት መጎዳትና ሌሎች አሉታዊ አጸፋዊ ምላሾች በሎፒናቪር/ሪቶናቪር ጥምር ቴራፒ ምክንያት ሊከሰቱ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, liver damage, and other adverse reactions may occur as a result of lopinavir/ritonavir combination therapy.

sourceString: The interaction of these treatments with other drugs used in the patients should be monitored carefully.
targetString: በእነዚህ ሕክምናዎችና በታካሚዎች ላይ ጥቅም ላይ በሚውሉ ሌሎች መድሃኒቶች መካከል ያለው ትስስር በጥንቃቄ ክትትል ሊደረግበት ይገባል።
en-mt: Interactions between these treatments and other medications used in patients should be carefully monitored.

sourceString: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation
targetString: ካገገሙ ታካሚዎች የተወሰደ ፕላዝማ እና አንቲቦዲ ማመንጨት
en-mt: Plasma from recovered patients and antibody generation

sourceString: The collection of the blood from patients who recovered from a contagious disease to treat other patients suffering from the same disease or to protect healthy individuals from catching the disease has a long history.
targetString: በተመሳሳይ በሽታ የተያዙ ሰዎችን ለማከም ወይም ጤናማ ግለሰቦች በበሽታው እንዳይያዙ ለመከላከል ሲባል ከተላላፊ በሽታ ካገገሙ ሰዎች ደም የመውሰድ ልምድ ረዥም ታሪክ አለው።
en-mt: The practice of taking blood from people who have recovered from an infectious disease has a long history, either to treat people with the same disease or to prevent healthy individuals from contracting the disease.

sourceString: Indeed, recovered patients often have a relatively high level of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.
targetString: እርግጥ ነው፣ ከበሽታው ያገገሙ ታማሚዎች በደማቸው ውስጥ ካለው ፓቶጂን አንጻር ከፍተኛ የሆነ የአንቲቦዲስ መጠን አላቸው።
en-mt: Of course, recovered patients have high levels of antibodies against the pathogen in their blood.

sourceString: Antibodies are an immunoglobulin (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes to fight pathogens and other foreign objects and they recognize unique molecules in the pathogens and neutralize them directly.
targetString: አንቦዲስ በ B ሊምፎሳይትስ የሚመረቱ ኢሚዩኖግሎቡሊን (Ig) ሲሆኑ ፓቶጂንስ እና ሌሎች ባዕድ ነገሮችን የሚዋጉ፣ እንደዚሁም በፓቶጂንስ ውስጥ ያሉ ለየት ያሉ ሞለኪዩሎችን በመለየት በቀጥታ ከጥቅም ውጭ ያደርጋሉ።
en-mt: Enbodies are immunoglobulins (Ig) produced by B lymphocytes that fight pathogens and other foreign substances, as well as recognize specific molecules present in pathogens and directly neutralize them.

sourceString: Based on this, plasma was collected from the blood of a group of patients who recovered from COVID-19 and was injected into 10 seriously ill patients.
targetString: በዚህ መሰረት፣ ከ COVID-19 ካገገሙ ታማሚዎች ደም ላይ ፕላዝማ ተወስዶ በጠና ለታመሙ 10 ታማሚዎች በመርፌ ተሰጣቸው።
en-mt: Accordingly, plasma was taken from the blood of patients who had recovered from COVID-19 and injected into 10 critically ill patients.

sourceString: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, accompanied by reduced inflammation and viral loads and improved oxygen saturation in the blood.
targetString: የሕመም ምልከቶቻቸው በ 24 ሰዓት ውስጥ የተሻሻሉ ሲሆን፣ የእብጠትና የቫይረስ ጫና መቀነስ እንደዚሁም በደም ውስጥ የኦክስጂን መብላላት ተሻሽሎ ነበር።
en-mt: Their symptoms improved within 24 hours, and there was a reduction in inflammation and viral load, as well as improved blood oxygen uptake.

sourceString: However, verification and clarification are necessary to propose the method for large-scale use before specific therapies are not yet developed.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ የተወሰኑ ቴራፒዎች እስከሚዘጋጁ ድረስ መጠነ ሰፊ ለሆነ አገልግሎት የሚሆን ዘዴ ለመጠቆም ማረጋገጫና ማበራሪያ አስፈላጊ ናቸው።
en-mt: However, until specific therapies are developed, validation and validation are necessary to suggest a mechanism for large-scale use.

sourceString: In addition, given the therapeutic effects, some disadvantages associated with the plasma should be considered carefully.
targetString: በተጨማሪም፣ የሕመም ማቃለያ ውጤቶቹን ታሳቢ በማድረግ፣ ከፕላዝማ ጋር የተያያዙ አንዳንድ ጉዳቶች በጥንቃቄ መታየት አለባቸው።
en-mt: Additionally, given its pain-relieving effects, some plasma-related side effects should be carefully considered.

sourceString: For example, antibodies can overstimulate the immune response and cause cytokine release syndrome, which is potentially a life-threatening toxicity.
targetString: ለምሳሌ፣ አንቲቦዲስ የበሽታ መከላከያ ምላሽን አግዝፎ በማየት ለሕይወት አስጊ የሆነውን መርዛማነት ያዘለ የሳይቶኪን ለቃቂ ሲንድረም ሊያስከትል ይችላል።
en-mt: For example, antibodies can overwhelm the immune response and cause life-threatening toxic cytokines for inflammatory syndrome.

sourceString: The concentration of antibodies in the blood is usually low, and the demand for the plasma is large to treat critically ill patients.
targetString: በደም ውስጥ ያለው የአንቲቦዲስ ክምችት ብዙውን ጊዜ ዝቅተኛ ሲሆን፣ ጽኑ ታማሚዎችን ለማከም የፕላዝማ ፍላጎት ደግሞ ከፍተኛ ነው።
en-mt: While the concentration of antibodies in the blood is often low, the need for plasma to treat stable patients is high.

sourceString: It is difficult to develop and produce specific antibodies rapidly enough to fight against a global epidemic.
targetString: ዓለም አቀፍ ወረርሽኝን ለመዋጋት አቅም ያላቸው የተወሰኑ አንቲቦዲስ በፍጥነት ማዘጋጀትና ማምረት አስቸጋሪ ነው።
en-mt: It is difficult to rapidly develop and produce specific antibodies capable of fighting a global pandemic.

sourceString: Thus, it is more critical and practical to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes encoding effective antibodies or screen for effective antibodies against essential proteins of the virus.
targetString: በመሆኑም፣ ካገገሙ ታማሚዎች ላይ የቢ ሕዋሳትን መነጠልና ውጤታማ አንቲቦዲስ ለማምረት የሚያስፈልጉ የዘረ መል ኮዶችን መለየት ወይም ወሳኝ የሆኑ የቫይረሱን ፕሮቲኖች ለውጤታማ አንቲቦዲስ እንዲሆኑ ማጣራት ያስፈልጋል።
en-mt: Therefore, it is necessary to isolate B cells from recovered patients and identify the genetic codes required to produce effective antibodies or to screen for important viral proteins to produce effective antibodies.

sourceString: This way, we can readily scale up the production of the antibodies.
targetString: በዚህ መንገድ፣ የአንቲቦዲስ ምርትን በቀላሉ ማሳደግ እንችላለን።
en-mt: In this way, we can easily increase the production of antibodies.

sourceString: TCM has been used to treat a variety of diseases in China for thousands of years.
targetString: TCM ቻይና ውስጥ የተለያዩ ዓይነት በሽታዎችን ለማከም በሺህ ለሚቆጠሩ ዓመታት ጥቅም ላይ ውሏል።
en-mt: TCM has been used in China for thousands of years to treat a variety of ailments.

sourceString: However, its effects largely rely on a combination of multiple components in a formula that varies depending on the diagnosis of a disease based on the theories of TCM.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ የሚያስከትላቸው ውጤቶች በዋነኛነት የሚመሰረቱት በአንድ ቀመር ውስጥ ባሉ የተለያዩ ክፍሎች ውህደት ነው፤ ይህም ቀመር TCM ሕልዮት መሰረት እንደ በሽታው ልዬታ የሚለያይ ነው።
en-mt: However, the resulting results are mainly determined by the combination of different components in a formula; According to TCM, this formula varies according to the type of disease.

sourceString: Most of the effective components remain unknown or are vague as it is difficult to extract and verify such components or their optimal combinations.
targetString: አብዛኞቹን ውጤታማ ክፍሎች የማይታወቁ ወይም አሻሚ መሆናቸው የቀጠለ ነበር፣ ምክንያቱም እንደዚህ ዓይነት ክፍሎችን ወይም ውህደታቸውን ለይቶ ለማውጣትና ለማረጋገጥ አስቸጋሪ ስለነበረ ነው።
en-mt: Most of the effective components remained unknown or ambiguous, because it was difficult to identify and verify such components or their combinations.

sourceString: Currently, due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19, TCM has become one of the major alternative treatments for patients with light to moderate symptoms or for those who have recovered from severe stages.
targetString: በአሁኑ ጊዜ፣ ለ COVID-19 የሚሆን ውጤታማ እና የተወሰነ ቴራፒ ባለመኖሩ ምክንያት ከቀላል እስከ መካከለኛ ደረጃ የሕመም ምልክት ላላቸው ወይም ከሕመሙ የጸና ደረጃ ላገገሙ ታማሚዎች ካሉ ዋነኛ አማራጭ ሕክምናዎች መካከል አንዱ TCM ሆኗል።
en-mt: Currently, TCM has become one of the main alternative treatments for patients with mild to moderate symptoms or those who have recovered from the disease due to the lack of effective and specific therapy for COVID-19.

sourceString: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du capsules and Lian Hua Qing Wen capsules were found to be effective for COVID-19 treatment.
targetString: ለምሳሌ፣ የ Shu Feng Jie Du ክኒኖችና Lian Hua Qing Wen ክኒኖች ለ COVID-19 ሕክምና ውጤታማ ሆነው ተገኝተዋል።
en-mt: For example, Shu Feng Jie Du Pills and Lian Hua Qing Wen Pills have been found to be effective in the treatment of COVID-19.

sourceString: Top cure rates in the treatment of COVID-19 patients were observed in several provinces in China that used TCM in 87% of their patients, including Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%), whereas Hubei province, which used TCM in only approximately 30% of its COVID-19 patients, had the lowest cure rate (13%).
targetString: ቻይና ውስጥ በሚገኙና 87% በሚሆኑት ታማሚዎቻቸው ላይ TCM የተጠቀሙ በርካታ ግዛቶች ውስጥ የ COVID-19 ታማሚዎች ላይ የተሰጠው ሕክምና የማዳን መጠኑ ከፍተኛ ነበር፤ ከእነዚህ ግዛቶች መካከል፣ ጋንሱ (63.7%)፣ ኒንዚያ (50%)፣ እና ሁናን (50%) ይገኙበታል። ወደ 30% በሚሆኑት የ COVID-19 ታማሚዎቹ ላይ ብቻ TCM የተጠቀመው የሁቤይ ግዛት ደግሞ ዝቅተኛ የማዳን መጠን (13%) አስመዝግቧል።
en-mt: In several provinces in China, which used TCM for 87% of their patients, the cure rate for COVID-19 patients was high; Among these provinces, there are Gansu (63.7%), Ningxia (50%), and Hunan (50%). Hubei province, which used TCM in only about 30% of its COVID-19 patients, recorded the lowest cure rate (13%).

sourceString: However, this is quite a rough comparison as many other impact factors such as the number and severity of the patients should be included in the evaluation.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ የታማሚዎች ብዛትና የሕመም ደረጃን የመሳሰሉ ሌሎች በርካታ ተጽእኖ ፈጣሪ ጉዳዮች በምዘናው ውስጥ መካከት ስላለባቸው ይህ ንጽጽር ጥልቀት የለሽ ነው።
en-mt: However, this comparison is shallow because many other influencing factors such as patient population and level of illness are included in the assessment.

sourceString: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and coworkers published a study to compare western medicine (WM) treatment alone with combined treatment of WM and TCM.
targetString: ፌብሩዋሪ 18/2020 ላይ፣ Boli Zhang እና የስራ ባለደረቦቹ የምዕራባውያን መድሃኒት (WM) ሕክምና ብቻውን ከ WM እና TCM ጥምር ሕክምና ጋር የሚያነጻጽር ጥናት አሳትመዋል።
en-mt: On February 18, 2020, Boli Zhang and colleagues published a study comparing Western medicine (WM) therapy alone to a combination therapy of WM and TCM.

sourceString: They found that the times needed for body temperature recovery, symptom disappearance, and hospitalization were remarkably shorter in the WM+TCM group than in the WM only group.
targetString: የሰውነት ሙቀት መጠን ለማገገም የሚፈልገው ጊዜ፣ ምልክቱ የሚጠፋበት ጊዜና በሆስፒታል ተኝቶ የመታከሚያ ጊዜ በ WM ብቻ ከነበረው ቡድን ይልቅ በ WM+TCM ቡድን ውስጥ ከፍተኛ መቀነስ እንደነበረባቸው አረጋግጠዋል።
en-mt: They found that the time required for body temperature to recover, time to symptom resolution, and length of hospital stay were significantly reduced in the WM+TCM group compared to the WM alone group.

sourceString: Most impressively, the rate for symptomatic worsening (from light to severe) was remarkably lower for the WM+TCM group than for the WM only group (7.4% versus 46.2%) and the mortality was lower in the WM+TCM group than WM only group (8.8% versus 39%).
targetString: በጣም አስገራሚው ነገር፣ የሕመም ምልከቶች የመባባስ መጠን (ከቀላል ወደ ከባድ) ከ WM ብቻ ቡድን ይልቅ በ WM+TCM ቡድን ላይ ከፍተኛ መቀነስ አሳይቶ ነበር (7.4% ከ 46.2% አንጻር)፤ የሞት መጠንም ከ WM ብቻ ቡድን በበለጠ የቀነሰው በ WM+TCM ቡድን ላይ ነው (8.8% ከ 39% አንጻር)።
en-mt: Interestingly, the rate of worsening of pain symptoms (from mild to severe) showed a greater reduction in the WM+TCM group than in the WM alone group (7.4% vs. 46.2%); Mortality was also significantly lower in the WM+TCM group than in the WM alone group (8.8% vs. 39%).

sourceString: Nevertheless, the efficacy and safety of TCM still await more well-controlled trials at larger scales and in more centers.
targetString: ነገር ግን፣ TCM ውጤታማነትና ደህንነት ሰፋፊ በሆነ መጠንና በብዙ ማዕከላት ይበልጥ ቁጥጥር የሚደረግባቸው ሙከራዎችን ውጤት የሚጠባበቅ ይሆናል።
en-mt: However, the efficacy and safety of TCM will await the results of more controlled trials on a larger scale and in more centers.

sourceString: It would also be intriguing to characterize the mechanism of actions and clarify the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible.
targetString: የእርምጃዎችን አወሳሰድ መግለጽና የ TCM ሕክምናዎችን ውጤታማ ክፍሎች ወይም ከተቻለ ውህደታቸውን ማብራራትም ከፍተኛ ትኩረት ሳቢ ሊሆን ይችላል።
en-mt: Describing the actions and explaining the effective components of TCM treatments or their combinations if possible can also be of great interest.

sourceString: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 mostly experience great fear of the highly contagious and even fatal disease, and quarantined people also experience boredom, loneliness, and anger.
targetString: ተጠርጣሪ ወይም የተረጋገጠ COVID-19 ያለባቸው ታማሚዎች እጅግ ተላላፊና ምናልባትም ገዳይ የሆነው በሽታ እጅግ ያስፈራቸዋል፤ ለይቶ ማቆያ ውስጥ ያሉ ሰዎችም የመሰላቸት፣ የብቸኝነትና የቁጣ ስሜት ይሰማቸዋል።
en-mt: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 fear the highly contagious and potentially fatal disease; People in quarantine also feel bored, lonely and angry.

sourceString: Furthermore, symptoms of the infection such as fever, hypoxia, and cough as well as adverse effects of the treatments such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more anxiety and mental distress.
targetString: በተጨማሪም፣ እንደ ትኩሳት፣ የትንፋሽ ማጠርና ሳል የመሳሰሉ የኢንፌክሽን ምልከቶችና ሕክምናዎች የሚያስከትሉት አሉታዊ ውጤት ለምሳሌ በካርቲኮስቴሮይዶች ምክንያት የሚከሰት የእንቅልፍ ማጣት ችግር ለበለጠ የአእምሮ መረበሽና የአእምሮ ጭንቀት ሊዳርጉ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: In addition, symptoms of infection such as fever, shortness of breath, and cough, and adverse effects of treatment such as insomnia caused by corticosteroids can lead to more mental disturbances and depression.

sourceString: In the early phase of the SARS outbreak, a range of psychiatric morbidities including persistent depression, anxiety, panic attacks, psychomotor excitement, psychotic symptoms, delirium, and even suicidality were reported.
targetString: የ ሳርስ ወረርሽኝ በተከሰተበት የመጀመሪያዎቹ ደረጃዎች ላይ፣ ቀጣይነት ያለው ድብታ፣ መረበሽ፣ የድንጋጤ ጥቃቶች፣ የአእምሮ ፍንጠዛ፣ የስነ አእምሮ ሕመም ምልክቶች፣ መቅበዝበዝና ራስን የማጥፋት ሃሳብ የመሳሰሉት ጨምሮ የተለያዩ የስነ አእምሮ ጤና መቃወሶች ሪፖርት ተደርገው ነበር።
en-mt: In the early stages of the SARS outbreak, a variety of mental health disorders were reported, including persistent drowsiness, agitation, panic attacks, hallucinations, psychotic symptoms, wandering, and suicidal ideation.

sourceString: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, as a part of the public health responses to the COVID-19 outbreak, can make people more anxious and guilty about the effects of the contagion, quarantine, and stigma on their families and friends.
targetString: የ COVID-19 ወረርሽኝን ከመከላከል አንጻር ከሚወሰዱ የማሕበረሰብ ጤና ምላሾች አንዱ የሆነው አስገዳጅ የንክኪ ክትትልና ለይቶ ማቆያ ሰዎች የወረርሽኙ፣ የለይቶ ማቆያው ውጤቶችና በቤተሰባቸውና ጓደኞቻቸው ላየ የሚደርስ ማግለል የመረበሽና የጥፋተኝነት ስሜት ሊፈጥርባቸው ይችላል።
en-mt: Mandatory contact tracing and quarantine, one of the public health responses to the COVID-19 pandemic, can leave people feeling anxious and guilty about the effects of the outbreak, quarantine, and isolation from family and friends.

sourceString: Thus, mental health care should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspected individuals, and people in contact with them as well as the general public who are in need.
targetString: በመሆኑም፣ ለ COVID-19 ታማሚዎች፣ ለተጠርጣሪ ግለሰቦችና ከእነርሱ ጋር ንክኪ ላላቸውና ባጠቃላይ ለሚፈልጉ ሰዎች የአእምሮ ጤና እንክብካቤ መሰጠት አለበት።
en-mt: As such, mental health care should be provided to COVID-19 patients, suspected individuals, and those in contact with them and those in need.

sourceString: The psychological support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, clear communications with regular and accurate updates about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and treatment plans and the use of professional electronic devices and applications to avoid close contact with each other.
targetString: የሚሰጠው ስነ-ልቡናዊ ድጋፍ ማካተት ያለበት ዘርፈ ብዙ የአእምሮ ጤና ቡድኖችን ማቋቋም፣ ስለ ሳርስ-CoV-2 ወረርሽኝ እና ስለ ሕክምና ዕቅዶች መደበኛና ትክክለኛ ወቅታዊ መረጃዎችን በግልጽ ማስተላለፍና እርስ በርስ የሚፈጠር ንክኪን ለማስቀረት ፕሮፌሽናል ኤሌክትሮኒክ መሳሪያዎችና መተግበሪያዎችን መጠቀም ናቸው።
en-mt: Psychosocial support should include the establishment of multidisciplinary mental health teams, the clear communication of regular and accurate information about the SARS-CoV-2 outbreak and treatment plans, and the use of professional electronic tools and applications to avoid interpersonal contact.

sourceString: Effective vaccines are essential for interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts and are often complementary to antiviral treatment in the control of epidemics caused by emerging viruses.
targetString: ከእንስሳት ማጠራቀሚያዎችና ከተያዙ ሰዎች ወደ ተጋላጭ አስተናጋጆች የሚኖርን የስርጭት ሰንሰለት ለማቋረጥ ውጤታማ ክትባቶች ወሳኝ ከመሆናቸው በተጨማሪ፣ በአዳዲስ ቫይረሶች ምክንያት የሚከሰቱ ወረርሽኞችን ለመቆጣጠር የሚሰጥ የፀረ ቫይረስ ሕክምና አጋዥ ናቸው።
en-mt: In addition to being critical to interrupting the chain of transmission from animal reservoirs and infected humans to susceptible hosts, effective vaccines are also helpful in controlling outbreaks caused by new viruses.

sourceString: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines to generate long-term and potent neutralizing antibodies and/or protective immunity against SARS-CoV.
targetString: ከ ሳርስ-CoV አንጻር አንቲቦዲስ እና/ወይም በሽታ ተከላካይ ክፍልን ዘላቂ በሆነ መንገድ ለማጠናከር የሚያስችሉ S ፕሮቲን ተኮር ክትባቶችን ለማምረት ጥረቶች ተደርገዋል።
en-mt: Efforts have been made to develop S protein-based vaccines that can elicit antibodies and/or durably strengthen the immune system against SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Live-attenuated vaccines have been evaluated in animal models for SARS.
targetString: ከበሽታ አመንጪ ቫይረሶች የሚመረቱ ክትባቶች ለ ሳርስ በእንስሳት ሞዴሎች ውስጥ ተሞክረዋል።
en-mt: Vaccines made from pathogenic viruses have been tested in animal models for SARS.

sourceString: However, the in vivo efficacy of these vaccine candidates in elderly individuals and lethal-challenge models and their protection against zoonotic virus infection have yet to be determined before a clinical study is initiated.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ እነዚህ እጩ ክትባቶች በአረጋውያን ላይ ያላቸው ውጤትና ገዳይነትን የሚቀንሱ ሞዴሎችና በእንስሳ የሚተላለፍ ቫይረስን ከመካለከለ አንጻር ያላችው ብቃተ ክሊኒካዊ ጥናት ከመጀመሩ በፊት መወሰን አለበት።
en-mt: However, the efficacy of these candidate vaccines in the elderly and their efficacy in reducing mortality in models and neutralizing animal-borne viruses must be determined before clinical trials begin.

sourceString: This is probably because SARS died down 17 years ago and no new case has been reported since.
targetString: የዚህ ምክንያት ሊሆን የሚችለው ሳርስ ከ 17 ዓመት በፊት መጠኑ የቀነሰ በመሆኑና ከዚያ ጊዜ ጀምሮ አዲስ ኬዝ አልተመዘገበም።
en-mt: This may be due to the fact that SARS declined 17 years ago and no new cases have been reported since then.

sourceString: In contrast, sporadic cases and clusters of MERS continue to occur in the Middle East and spread to other regions owing to the persistence of zoonotic sources in endemic areas.
targetString: በተቃራኒው፣ በመካከለኛው ምስራቅ አካባቢ ሜርስ ኬዝና ስርጭት መጠን በከፍተኛ ሁኔታ መስፋፋቱን የቀጠለ ሲሆን፣ በነባር አካባቢዎች ከእንስሳት ወደ ሰዎች የሚተላለፍ በመሆኑም ወደ ሌሎች ክልሎች ተሰራጭቷል።
en-mt: Conversely, MERS cases and transmission rates continue to increase significantly in the Middle East, and in existing areas of animal-to-human transmission, it has spread to other regions.

sourceString: Vaccination strategies have been developed for MERS by using inactivated virus, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like particles and recombinant protein subunits and some have been evaluated in animal models.
targetString: እንቅስቃሴ አልባ ቫይረሶች፣ DNA ፕላዝሚድስ፣ ቫይራል ቬክተርስ፣ ናኖፓርቲክልስ፣ ቫይረስ መሰል ነገሮችና ላብራቶሪ ወለድ የፕሮቲን ንኡስ ክፍሎችን በመጠቀም ለሜርስ የክትባት ስትራቴጂዎች የተዘጋጁ ሲሆን አንዳንዶቹም በእንስሳ ሞዴሎች ላይ ተሞክረዋል።
en-mt: Vaccine strategies for MERS using inactivated viruses, DNA plasmids, viral vectors, nanoparticles, virus-like substances and laboratory-derived protein substrates have been developed, some of which have been tested in animal models.

sourceString: The development of a safe and effective vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 for non-immune individuals is an urgent and critical task for controlling the ongoing epidemic.
targetString: የበሽታ መከላከያ አቅም ለሌላቸው ግለሰቦች ለ ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 መከላከያ የሚሆን አስተማማኝና ውጤታማ ክትባት ማዘጋጀት በሂደት ላይ ያለውን ወረርሽኝ ለመቆጣጠር አጣዳፊና ወሳኝ ተግባር ነው።
en-mt: Developing a safe and effective vaccine for SARS-CoV-2 protection in immunocompromised individuals is an urgent and critical task to control the ongoing epidemic.

sourceString: However, it is challenging to overcome the difficulty because of the long period of time (averaged 18 months) needed for vaccine development and the dynamic variations of CoVs.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ ክትባት ለማምረት በሚያስፈልገው ረዥም ጊዜ (በአማካይ 18 ወራት) እና በ CoVs ተለዋዋጭነ ባህርይ ምክንያት ችግሩን መቋቋም ፈታኝ ነው።
en-mt: However, due to the long time required to develop a vaccine (18 months on average) and the dynamic nature of CoVs, tackling the problem is challenging.

sourceString: As a novel disease, COVID-19 has just started to manifest its full clinical course throughout thousands of patients.
targetString: COVID-19 አዲስ በሽታ በመሆኑ፣ በሺህ በሚቆጠሩ ታማሚዎች ላይ ሙሉ ክሊኒካዊ ሂደቱን ማሳየት ገና መጀመሩ ነው።
en-mt: As COVID-19 is a new disease, the full clinical process is yet to be demonstrated in thousands of patients.

sourceString: In most cases, patients can recover gradually without sequelae.
targetString: በአብዛኛዎቹ ሁኔታዎች፣ ታማሚዎች የጤና ሁኔታቸው ሳይጎዳ ቀስ በቀስ ማገገም ይችላሉ።
en-mt: In most cases, patients can gradually recover without their health condition being compromised.

sourceString: However, similar to SARS and MERS, COVID-19 is also associated with high morbidity and mortality in patients with severe cases.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ እንደ ሳርስ እና ሜርስ ሁሉ፣ COVID-19 በጠና የታመሙ ሰዎች ላይ ከፍተኛ የሕመም እና የሞት ጉዳቶችን ያስከትላል።
en-mt: However, as with SARS and MERS, COVID-19 causes significant morbidity and mortality in severely ill people.

sourceString: Therefore, building a prognosis model for the disease is essential for health-care agencies to prioritize their services, especially in resource-constrained areas.
targetString: ስለዚህ፣ የጤና እንክብካቤ ሰጪ ኤጄንሲዎች በተለይ የሐብት እጥረት ባለባቸው አካባቢዎች አገልግሎታቸውን ቅደም ተከተል ለማስቀመጥ እንዲችሉ ለዚህ በሽታ የዕድገት ትንበያ ሞዴል መገንባት ወሳኝ ነው።
en-mt: Therefore, it is critical to develop a predictive model for this disease so that health care agencies can prioritize their services, especially in resource-poor areas.

sourceString: Based on clinical studies reported thus far, the following factors may affect or be associated with the prognosis of COVID-19 patients (Table ​(Table33):
targetString: እስካሁን ሪፖርት በተደረጉ ክሊኒካዊ ጥናቶች መሰረት፣ የሚከተሉተ ጉዳዮች የ COVID-19 ታማሚዎችን የሕመም ታሪክ የሚነኩ ወይም የተያያዙ ሊሆኑ ይችላሉ (ሰንጠረዥ (ሰንጠረዥ33):
en-mt: Based on the clinical studies reported so far, the following factors may influence or be associated with the disease history of patients with COVID-19 (Table ​ (Table33):

sourceString: Age: Age was the most important factor for the prognosis of SARS, which is also true for COVID-19.
targetString: ዕድሜ፡ ሳርስ የበሽታ ታሪክን በማወቅ ረገድ ዕድሜ በጣም ወሳኝ የነበረ ሲሆን ይህ ነገር ለ COVID-19 እንደዚሁ ይሰራል።
en-mt: Age: Age was critical in determining SARS disease history, and the same holds true for COVID-19.

sourceString: COVID-19 mainly happened at the age of 30-65 with 47.7% of those patients being over 50 in a study of 8,866 cases as described above.
targetString: ከላይ እንደተገለው፣ በ 8,866 ኬዞች ላይ በተደረገ ጥናት መሰረት ዕድሜያቸው ከ 50 ዓመት በላይ ከሆኑት ታማሚዎች መካከል 47.7% የሚሆኑት ላይ COVID-19 በዋነኛነት የተከሰተው ከ 30-65 ዓመት ባለው ዕድሜ ውስጥ ነው።
en-mt: As stated above, according to a study of 8,866 cases, 47.7% of patients over the age of 50 were diagnosed with COVID-19, mainly in the age group of 30-65 years.

sourceString: Patients who required intensive care were more likely to have underlying comorbidities and complications and were significantly older than those who did not (at the median age of 66 versus 51), suggesting age as a prognostic factor for the outcome of COVID-19 patients.
targetString: ከፍተኛ የሕክምና ክትትል የሚያስፈልጋቸው ታማሚዎች ነባር በሽታዎችና የጤና ችግሮች የነበሩባቸውና ነባር የጤና ችግር ከሌለባቸው ሰዎች የበለጠ ዕድሜ ያላቸው (አማካይ የዕድሜ መጠን 66 ከ 51 አንጻር) መሆኑ ዕድሜ ለ COVID-19 ታማሚዎች ከበሽታው የማገገም ዕድላቸውን ለመገመት የሚያስችል ባህርይ መሆኑን ይጠቁማል።
en-mt: The fact that patients requiring intensive care were older (mean age 66 vs. 51) than those without pre-existing conditions and co-morbidities suggests that age is a predictor of recovery in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: Sex: SARS-CoV-2 has infected more men than women (0.31/100,000 versus 0.27/100,000), as described above.
targetString: ጾታ፡ ከላይ እንደተገለው፣ ሳርስ-CoV-2 ከሴቶች ይበልጥ ያጠቃው ወንዶችን ነው (0.31/100,000 ወንዶች፣ 0.27/100,000 ሴቶች)።
en-mt: Gender: As noted above, SARS-CoV-2 affects men more than women (0.31/100,000 men, 0.27/100,000 women).

sourceString: Comorbidities and complications: Patients with COVID-19 who require intensive care are more likely to suffer from acute cardiac injury and arrhythmia.
targetString: ተደጋጋፊ የጤና ችግሮችና ሕመሞች፡ ከፍተኛ የሕክምና ክትትል የሚያስፈልጋቸው የ COVID-19 ታማሚዎች በከባድ የልብ በሽታና የአተነፋፈስ ችግር የመጠቃት ዕድላቸው የበለጠ ነው።
en-mt: Co-morbidities and illnesses: COVID-19 patients who require intensive care are more likely to develop serious heart disease and respiratory problems.

sourceString: Cardiac events were also the main reason for death in SARS patients.
targetString: ከልብ ህመም ጋር የተያያዙ ችግሮች በ ሳርስ ታካሚዎች ላይ ለተከሰተው ሞት ዋነኛ መንስኤዎች ናቸው።
en-mt: Cardiovascular complications are the leading cause of death in SARS patients.

sourceString: It has been reported that SARS-CoV-2 can also bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, which might lead to liver dysfunctions in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: ሳርስ-CoV-2 ከ ACE2-ፖዘቲቭ ኮላንጂዮሳይትስ ጋር የተሳሰረ እንደሚሆን ሪፖርት በመደረጉ በ COVID-19 ታማሚዎች ላይ የጉበት ጤና ችግሮችን ሊያስከትል ይችላል።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 has been reported to bind to ACE2-positive cholangiocytes, potentially causing liver health problems in COVID-19 patients.

sourceString: It is worth noting that age and underlying disease are strongly correlated and might interfere with each other.
targetString: ዕድሜ እና ነባር በሽታ ከፍተኛ ቁርኝት እንዳላቸውና አንዱ በሌላው ላይ ጣልቃ ሊገባ እንደሚችል ማስተዋል ያስፈልጋል።
en-mt: It is important to note that age and existing disease are highly correlated and may interfere with each other.

sourceString: Abnormal laboratory findings: The C-reactive protein (CRP) level in blood reflects the severity of inflammation or tissue injury and has been proposed to be a potential prognostic factor for disease, response to therapy, and ultimate recovery.
targetString: ጤናማ ያልሆኑ የላብራቶሪ ግኝቶች፡ በደም ውስጥ የሚታየው የ C-ሪአክቲቭ ፕሮቲን (CRP) መጠን የእብጠት ወይም የስስ ሕዋስ ጉዳትን መጠን የሚያንጸባርቅ ሲሆን፣ የበሽታን ተፈጥሯዊ ታሪክ ለማወቅ፣ ለቴራፒ ምላሽ እና ለመጨረሻ ማገገም ሂደት እንዲውል ሃሳብ ቀርቦ ነበር።
en-mt: Abnormal laboratory findings: C-reactive protein (CRP) levels in the blood reflect the extent of inflammation or tissue damage and have been suggested to help determine the natural history of disease, response to therapy, and eventual recovery.

sourceString: The correlation of CRP level to the severity and prognosis of COVID-19 has also been proposed.
targetString: በ CRP መጠን እና በ COVID-19 ክብደትና የዕድገት ሁኔታ ትንበያ መካከል ያለው የእርስ በርስ ግንኙነትም እንደ ሃሳብ ቀርቧል።
en-mt: A correlation between CRP levels and prediction of the severity and progression of COVID-19 has also been suggested.

sourceString: In addition, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may also help predict the outcome.
targetString: በተጨማሪም፣ elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), እና creatine kinase (CK) ውጤቱን ለመተንበይ ሊያግዙ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Additionally, elevated lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine aminotransferase (ALT), and creatine kinase (CK) may help predict outcome.

sourceString: These enzymes are expressed extensively in multiple organs, especially in the heart and liver, and are released during tissue damage.
targetString: እነዚህ ኢንዛይሞች በተለያዩ የሰውነት ክፍሎች ውስጥ በተለይም በልብና በጉበት ውስጥ በከፍተኛ ሁኔታ የሚታዩ ሲሆን የሕብረ ሕዋስ ጉዳት ሲኖር ይለቀቃሉ።
en-mt: These enzymes are highly expressed in various parts of the body, especially in the heart and liver, and are released when there is tissue damage.

sourceString: Thus, they are traditional markers for heart or liver dysfunctions.
targetString: በመሆኑም፣ የልብ ወይም የጉበት ጤና መታወኮች ልማዳዊ አመላካቾች ናቸው።
en-mt: As such, heart or liver health disorders are common indicators.

sourceString: Major clinical symptoms: Chest radiography and temporal progression of clinical symptoms should be considered together with the other issues for the prediction of outcomes and complications of COVID-19.
targetString: ዋናዎቹ ክሊኒካዊ የሕመም ምልክቶች፡ የደረት ራዲዮግራፊ እና የክሊኒካዊ ምልክቶች የጊዜ መራዘም ከሌሎች ጉዳዮች ጋር አብሮ ታይቶ የ COVID-19 ውጤቶችና የጤና ችግሮችን ለመተንበይ መዋል አለበት።
en-mt: The main clinical signs: Chest radiography and prolongation of clinical signs should be considered in conjunction with other factors to predict the outcome and health complications of COVID-19.

sourceString: Use of steroids: As described above, steroids are immunosuppressant commonly used as an adjunctive therapy for infectious diseases to reduce the severity of inflammatory damage.
targetString: የስቴሮይድስ አጠቃቀም፡ ከላይ እንደተገለጸው፣ ስቴሮይድስ የሰዎችን በሽታ የመከላከል አቅም የሚጫኑና በመተንፈሻ አካል ላይ የሚደርስ ጉዳትን ለመቀነስ ሲባል በተላላፊ በሽታዎች ላይ በተለምዶ እንደ አጋዥ ቴራፒ የሚሰጡ ናቸው።
en-mt: Use of Steroids: As mentioned above, steroids are commonly given as adjunctive therapy in infectious diseases to suppress the immune system and reduce damage to the respiratory system.

sourceString: Since a high dosage of corticosteroids was widely used in severe SARS patients, many survivors suffered from avascular osteonecrosis with life-long disability and poor life quality.
targetString: በጠና የታመሙ ሳርስ በሽተኞች ላይ ከፍተኛ መጠን ያለው ኮርቲኮስቴሮይድ በሰፊው ጥቅም ላይ በመዋሉ፣ በርካታ ከሕመሙ የዳኑ ሰዎች የአጥንት ሕዋስ መሞትና ዘላቂ የአካል ጉዳትና ዝቅተኛ የኑሮ ደረጃ አጋጥሟቸው ነበር።
en-mt: Because of the widespread use of high-dose corticosteroids in severely ill SARS patients, many survivors suffered bone death, permanent disability, and a reduced quality of life.

sourceString: Thus, if needed, steroids should be used at low dosage and for a short time in COVID-19 patients.
targetString: በመሆኑም፣ አስፈላጊ ከሆነ ስቴርይዶች በአነስተኛ መጠንና ለአጭር ጊዜ በ COVID-19 ታማሚዎች ላይ ጥቅም ላይ መዋል አለባቸው።
en-mt: Therefore, if necessary, steroids should be used in small doses and for a short period of time in patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: Mental stress: As described above, during the COVID-19 outbreak many patients have suffered from extraordinary stress as they often endured long periods of quarantine and extreme uncertainty and witnessed the death of close family members and fellow patients.
targetString: የአእምሮ ጭንቀት፡ ከላይ እንደተገለጸው፣ በ COVID-19 ወረርሽኝ ወቅት በርካታ ታካሚዎች ረዥም ጊዜ ለይቶ ማቆያ ውስጥ በመሆናቸው ምክንያት፣ የቅርብ ቤተሰባቸውን አባልና ሌሎች ታማሚዎች ሲሞቱ በማየታቸው ምክንያት ከፍተኛ የጭንቀትና እርግጠኛ ያለመሆን ችግር ያጋጥማቸዋል።
en-mt: Mental stress: As mentioned above, many patients during the COVID-19 pandemic are experiencing high levels of stress and uncertainty due to prolonged isolation, close family members and other patients dying.

sourceString: It is imperative to provide psychological counseling and long-term support to help these patients recover from the stress and return to normal life.
targetString: እነዚህ ታማሚዎች ከጭንቀት አገግመው ወደ መደበኛ ሕይወት እንዲመለሱ ለማገዝ ስነ-ልቡናዊ ምክርና ዘላቂ ድጋፍ መስጠት ወሳኝ ነው።
en-mt: Psychological counseling and ongoing support are critical to helping these patients recover from stress and return to normal life.

sourceString: According to demographic studies so far, COVID-19 seems to have different epidemiological features from SARS.
targetString: እስካሁነ በተደረጉ ስነ ህዝባዊ ጥናቶች መሰረት፣ COVID-19 ከ ሳርስ የተለየ የስርጭት ሁኔታ ባህርያት አሉት።
en-mt: Based on demographic studies conducted so far, COVID-19 has different epidemiology characteristics than SARS.

sourceString: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 can efficiently replicate in the upper respiratory tract and causes mild or no symptoms in the early phase of infection, similar to other CoVs that cause common colds.
targetString: በታችኛው የመተንፈሻ መስመር ላይ ራሱን ለማባዛቱም በተጨማሪ፣ ሳርስ-CoV-2 በላይኛው የመተንፈሻ መስመር ላይም ራሱን በማባዛት በኢንፌክሽኑ የመጀመሪያ ምዕራፍ ላይ ቀለል ወይም ምንም ምልክት አያሳይም፤ ይህም ጉንፋን ከሚያስከትሉ ሌሎች CoVs ጋር ተመሳሳይ ነው።
en-mt: In addition to replicating in the lower respiratory tract, SARS-CoV-2 also replicates in the upper respiratory tract and shows mild or no symptoms in the early stages of infection; This is similar to other CoVs that cause the flu.

sourceString: Therefore, infected patients at the early phase or incubation period can produce a large amount of virus during daily activities, causing great difficulty for the control of the epidemic.
targetString: ስለዚህ፣ በቫይረሱ የተያዙ ሰዎች በመጀመሪያው ምዕራፍ ወይም በመፈልፈያ ወቅት ላይ በዕለት ተዕለት ስራቸው ምክንያት ከፍተኛ መጠን ያለው ቫይረስ ሊያመነጩ ስለሚችሉ ወረርሽኙን ለመቆጣጠር እጅግ አስቸጋሪ ያደርገዋል።
en-mt: Therefore, during the first phase or incubation period, infected individuals may produce large amounts of virus due to their daily activities, making outbreaks extremely difficult to control.

sourceString: However, the transmission of SARS-CoV was considered to occur when the patients are severely ill, while most transmission did not happen at the early phase.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ ሳርስ-CoV የሚተላለፈው ታማሚዎች በከፋ ሁኔታ ሲታመሙ እንደሆነ እና በበሽታው የመጀመሪያ ደረጃዎች ላይ አብዛኛው ስርጭት እንዳልተከሰተ ታይቷል።
en-mt: However, it has been shown that SARS-CoV is transmitted when patients are critically ill and that most transmission does not occur in the early stages of the disease.

sourceString: Thus, the current outbreak of COVID-19 is much more severe and difficult to control than the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: በመሆኑም፣ አሁን ያለው የ COVID-19 ወረርሽኝ ከ ሳርስ ወረርሽኝ የበለጠ ከባድና ለመቆጣጠርም አስቸጋሪ ነው።
en-mt: As such, the current COVID-19 outbreak is more severe and difficult to control than the SARS outbreak.

sourceString: Great efforts are currently underway in China including the lockdown of Wuhan and surrounding cities and continuous quarantine of almost the entire population in hopes of interrupting the transmission of SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: በውሃን እና በዙሪያዋ ባሉ ከተሞች እንቅስቃሴን ሙሉ በሙሉ መገደብና አጠቃላይ ሕዝቡን በለይቶ ማቆየት ሁኔታ ውስጥ ማስገባትን ጨምሮ፣ ቻይና ውስጥ የ ሳርስ-CoV-2 ስርጭትን ለማስቆም የታሰቡ አበይት ጥረቶች እየተደረጉ ነው።
en-mt: Major efforts are being made to stop the spread of SARS-CoV-2 in China, including completely restricting movement by water and surrounding cities and placing the entire population under quarantine.

sourceString: Although these actions have been dramatically damaging the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new patients is declining, indicating the slowdown of the epidemic.
targetString: እነዚህ እርምጃዎች ኢኮኖሚውንና ሌሎች የሃገሪቱን ዘርፎች በከፍተኛ ሁኔታ እየጎዱ ቢሆኑም፣ የአዳዲስ ታማሚዎች ቁጥር እየቀነሰ መሆኑ የወረርሽኙን መቀዛቀዝ የሚያመለክት ነው።
en-mt: Although these measures are severely affecting the economy and other sectors of the country, the number of new cases is decreasing, indicating that the epidemic is slowing down.

sourceString: The most optimistic estimate is that the outbreak will end by March and the downswing phase will last for 3-4 months.
targetString: በጣም ተስፈኛ የሆነው ግምት፣ ወረርሽኙ በማርች ወር ላይ እንደሚያበቃና የስርጭት መጠኑም ከ 3-4 ወራት ውስጥ እንደሚቀንስ ነው።
en-mt: The most optimistic estimate is that the epidemic will end in March and the rate of transmission will decrease in 3-4 months.

sourceString: However, some other experts are not that optimistic.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ አንዳንድ ሌሎች ኤክስፐርቶች ይህን ያህል ተስፈኞች አይደሉም።
en-mt: However, some other experts are not so optimistic.

sourceString: Paul Hunter, et al., estimated that COVID-19, which seems substantially more infectious than SARS, will not end in 2020.
targetString: በእነ ፖል ሃንተር ግምት መሰረት፣ ከሳርስ በበለጠ ሁኔታ ተላላፊ የሚመስለው COVID-19 በ 2020 አያበቃም።
en-mt: According to Paul Hunter's estimates, COVID-19, which appears to be more contagious than SARS, will not end in 2020.

sourceString: Ira Longini, et al., established a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic and suggested that SARS-CoV-2 could infect two-thirds of the global population.
targetString: እና አይራ ሎንጊኒ የወረርሽኙን ውጤት ለመተንበይ የሚያስችል ሞዴል ያዘጋጁ ሲሆን፣ ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 ከዓለም ሕዝብ መካከል ሁለት ሶስተኛ የሚሆነውን ሊያጠቃ እንደሚችል ጠቁመዋል።
en-mt: And Ira Longhini developed a model to predict the outcome of the epidemic, and pointed out that SARS-CoV-2 could affect two-thirds of the world's population.

sourceString: A Canadian group reported that SARS-CoV-2 was detected in both mid-turbinate and throat swabs of patients who recovered and left the hospital 2 weeks earlier, which indicates that the newly identified virus could become a cyclical episode similar to influenza.
targetString: አንድ ካናዳዊ ቡድን ሪፖርት እንዳደረገው፣ ከ 2 ሳምንታት በፊት አገግመው ከሆስፒታል በወጡ ታማሚዎች የአፍንጫ ቀዳዳ እና ጉሮሮ ላይ የተወሰዱ ናሙናዎች ላይ ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 ተገኝቷል፤ ይህ የሚያመለክተው ደግሞ በቅርቡ የታወቀው ቫይረስ ልክ እንደ ኢንፍሉዌንዛ በተደጋጋሚ ሊከሰት እንደሚችል ነው።
en-mt: A Canadian team reported that SARS-Cov-2 was detected in nasal and throat samples of patients who had recovered 2 weeks earlier and had been discharged from the hospital; This also suggests that the newly identified virus may become more frequent, like influenza.

sourceString: However, promising signs have occurred in China based on the declining number of new cases, indicating the current strategies might have been working.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ የአዳዲስ ኬዞች ቁጥር እየቀነሰ በመምጣቱ ምክንያት ቻይና ውስጥ ተስፋ ሰጪ ምልክቶች የታዩ ሲሆን፣ ይህም የሚያሳየው አሁን ያሉት ስትራቴጂዎች ውጤታማ ሳይሆኑ እንዳልቀሩ ነው።
en-mt: However, there are promising signs in China as the number of new cases continues to decline, suggesting that current strategies may not be effective.

sourceString: Ebola was originally predicted to cause up to a million cases with half a million deaths.
targetString: ኢቦላ በመጀመሪያ እስከ አንድ ሚሊዮን የሚደርሱ ኬዞችን በማስመዝገብ ግማሽ ሚሊዮነ ሞት እንደሚያስከትል ተገምቶ ነበር።
en-mt: Ebola was originally estimated to cause up to a million cases and half a million deaths.

sourceString: However, via strict quarantine and isolation, the disease has eventually been put under control.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ ጥብቅ በሆነ ውሸባ እና አግልሎ ማቆየት ምክንያት በሽታው በሂደት በቁጥጥር ስር ውሏል።
en-mt: However, due to strict quarantine and isolation, the disease was gradually brought under control.

sourceString: It is possible, similar to SARS-CoV, that SARS-CoV-2 might become weaker in infectivity and eventually die down or become a less pathogenic virus co-existent with humans.
targetString: ልክ እንደ ሳርስ-CoV ሁሉ፣ ሳርስ-CoV-2 ጥንካሬው ሊዳከምና በሂደትም ሊሞት ወይም ከሰዎች ጋር አብሮ የሚኖርና በሽታ የማስከተል አቅሙ ደካማ ቫይረስ ሊሆን ይችላል።
en-mt: Like SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2 can weaken and eventually die or become a weakened virus that can coexist with humans and cause disease.

sourceString: A comparison of the epidemic of COVID-19 with that of SARS and MERS is provided below (Fig. ​(Fig.55).
targetString: በ COVID-19 ወረርሽኝ እና ሳርስ እና ሜርስ መካከል የተደረገ ንጽጽር ከታች ቀርቧል (ምስል (ምስል.55)።
en-mt: A comparison between the COVID-19 pandemic and SARS and MERS is presented below (Figure 55).

sourceString: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmittable through coughing or sneezing, and possibly also through direct contact with materials contaminated by the virus.
targetString: ሳርስ-CoV-2 በሳል ወይም በማስነጠስ አማካይነት፣ እንደዚሁም በቫይረሱ የተበከሉ ቁሳቁሶች ጋር ቀጥተኛ ንክኪ በማድረግ በማድረግም በከፍተኛ ሁኔታ ይተላለፋል።
en-mt: SARS-CoV-2 is highly transmitted through coughing or sneezing, as well as through direct contact with contaminated materials.

sourceString: The virus was also found in feces, which raises a new possibility of feces-to-mouth transmission.
targetString: ቫይረሱ በሰገራ ላይም የተገኘ በመሆኑ ከሰገራ ወደ አፍ የመተላለፍ ዕድል እንዳለው የሚጠቁም ሆኗል።
en-mt: Since the virus was also found in feces, it has been suggested that there is a possibility of transmission from feces to mouth.

sourceString: A recent study on 138 cases reported that 41% of the cases were possibly caused by nosocomial infections, including 17 patients with other prior diseases and 40 health-care providers.
targetString: በ 138 ኬዞች ላይ በቅርቡ የተደረገ ጥናት እንዳሳየው፣ 41% የሚሆኑ ኬዞች ምናልባትም በአንድ ቦታ በነበረ ኢንፌክሽን ምክንያተ የተከሰቱ ናቸው፤ ነባር በሽታ ያለባቸው 17 ታማሚዎችና 40 የጤና እንክብካቤ ሰጪዎችም በዚህ ውስጥ ይካተታሉ።
en-mt: A recent study of 138 cases showed that 41% of cases were probably due to a single site infection; 17 patients with existing disease and 40 health care providers are also included.

sourceString: Thus, great precaution should be used to protect humans, especially health-care providers, social workers, family members, colleagues, and even bystanders in contact with patients or infected people.
targetString: በመሆኑም፣ ሰዎችን በተለይም የጤና እንክብካቤ ሰጪዎች፣ የማህበራዊ አገልግሎት ሰራተኞች፣ የቤተሰብ አባላት፣ የስራ ባልደረቦችና ከታማሚዎች ወይም በበሽታው ከተጠቁ ሰዎች ጋር ንክኪ ያላቸውን ሰዎችን መጠበቅ እንዲቻል ከፍተኛ ቅድመ ጥንቃቄ መወሰድ አለበት።
en-mt: Therefore, extreme precautions must be taken to protect people, especially health care providers, social service workers, family members, co-workers, and those in contact with sick or infected people.

sourceString: The first line of defense that could be used to lower the risk of infection is through wearing face masks; both the use of surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (series # 1860s) helps control the spread of viruses.
targetString: በኢንፌክሽን የመጠቃት ስጋትን ለመቀነስ ልንጠቀመው የምንችል የመጀመሪያው የመከላከያ መስመር የፊት ማስኮችን ማድረግ ነው፤ የቀዶ ጥገና ማስኮችና የ N95 ሪስፓይሬተር ማስኮች (የምርት ቁጥር 1860s) ማድረግ የቫይረሱን ስርጭት ለመቆጣጠር ያግዛል።
en-mt: The first line of defense we can use to reduce the risk of infection is wearing face masks. Wearing surgical masks and N95 respirator masks (product number 1860s) can help control the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Surgical face masks prevent liquid droplets from a potentially infected individual from traveling through the air or sticking onto surfaces of materials, where they could be passed on to others.
targetString: የቀዶ ጥገና የፊት ማስኮች በቫይረሱ ከተያዘ ሰው የሚወጡ ጠብታዎች በአየር እንዳይጓዙ ወይም የቁሳቁስ ወለል ላይ ተጣብቀው በመቆየት ወደ ሌሎች ሰዎች እንዳይተላለፉ ይከላከላሉ።
en-mt: Surgical face masks prevent droplets from an infected person from traveling through the air or sticking to the surface of a material and preventing it from being transmitted to other people.

sourceString: However, only N95 (series # 1860s) masks can protect against the inhalation of virions as small as 10 to 80 nm, with only 5% of the virions being able to penetrate completely; SARS-CoV-2 is similar to SARS-CoV in size and both are approximately 85 nm.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ መጠናቸው ከ 10 እስከ 80 nm የሚደርሱ ቫይረሶችን ወደ ውስጥ ላለመሳብ የሚያስችሉት የ N95 (መለያ ቁጥር 1860s) ማስኮች ብቻ ናቸው፤ ሙሉ በሙሉ በትንፋሽ ወደ ውስጥ መግባት የሚችሉት 5% of የሚሆኑት ጥቃቅን ቫይረሶች ብቻ ናቸው፤ ሳርስ-CoV-2 በመጠኑ ከ ሳርስ-CoV ጋር ተመሳሳይ ሲሆን፣ ሁለቱም በግምት 85 nm ይሆናሉ።
en-mt: However, only N95 (serial number 1860s) masks are able to repel viruses between 10 and 80 nm in size; Only 5% of small viruses can be fully inhaled; SARS-CoV-2 is somewhat similar in size to SARS-CoV, both being approximately 85 nm.

sourceString: Since particles can penetrate even five surgical masks stacked together, health-care providers in direct contact with patients must wear N95 (series # 1860s) masks but not surgical masks.
targetString: አምስት የቀዶ ጥገና ማስኮች ተደራርበው ቢጠለቁም ጥቃቅን ነገሮች ሰርገው መግባት ስለሚችሉ፣ ከታማሚዎች ጋር ቀጥተኛ ንክኪ ያላቸው የጤና እንክብካቤ ሰጪዎች N95 (የምርት ቁጥር 1860s) እና የቀዶ ጥገና ማስኮችን ማድረግ የለባቸውም።
en-mt: Even if five surgical masks are layered, healthcare providers who have direct contact with patients should not wear N95 (product number 1860s) and surgical masks because of the potential for particulate matter to penetrate.

sourceString: In addition to masks, health-care providers should wear fitted isolation gowns in order to further reduce contact with viruses.
targetString: የጤና እንክብካቤ ሰጪዎች ከማስኮች በተጨማሪ ከቫይረሱ ጋር የሚኖር ንክኪን ለመቀነስ እንዲችሉ ራሱን ችሎ የተዘጋጀ ጋዎን መልበስ አለባቸው።
en-mt: In addition to masks, healthcare providers should also wear an individually tailored gown to minimize exposure to the virus.

sourceString: Viruses can also infect an individual through the eyes.
targetString: ቫይረሶች በዓይን በኩልም አንድን ሰው መበከል ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Viruses can also infect a person through the eyes.

sourceString: On January 22, 2020, a doctor was infected with SARS-CoV-2 although he wore an N95 mask; the virus might have entered his body through his inflammatory eyes.
targetString: ጃንዋሪ 22፣ 2020፣ አንድ ዶክተር N95 ማስክ አድርጎም በ ሳርስ-CoV-2 ተጠቅቶ ነበር፤ ቫይረሱ ባበጠው ዓይኑ በኩል ወደ ሰውነቱ ውስጥ ገብቶ ሊሆን ይችላል።
en-mt: On January 22, 2020, a doctor used an N95 mask against SARS-CoV-2; The virus may have entered his body through his swollen eye.

sourceString: Thus, health-care providers should also wear transparent face shields or goggles while working with patients.
targetString: ስለሆነም፣ የጤና እንክብካቤ ሰጪዎች ታካሚዎች ጋር በሚሰሩበት ወቅት በግልጽ የሚያሳዩ የፊት መሸፈኛዎች ወይም ጭንብሎችን ማድረግ አለባቸው።
en-mt: Therefore, healthcare providers should wear face coverings or masks that are clearly visible when working with patients.

sourceString: For the general public in affected or potentially affected areas, it is highly suggested that everybody wash their hands with disinfectant soaps more often than usual, try to stay indoors for self-quarantine and limit contact with potentially infected individuals.
targetString: በተጠቁ ወይም ሊጠቁ በሚችሉ አካባቢዎች ለሚኖረው አጠቃላዩ ሕዝብ፣ ሁሉም ሰው ከተለመደው ጊዜ በላይ እጆቹን በሳሙና እንዲታጠብ፣ ራስን አግልሎ ቤት ውስጥ እንዲቆይና በቫይረሱ የመጠቃተ ዕድል ካላቸው ሰዎች ጋር የሚኖር ንክኪን እንዲገድቡ ይመከራል።
en-mt: For the general population living in infected or potentially infected areas, it is recommended that everyone wash their hands with soap more than usual, stay at home and limit contact with people who are at risk of contracting the virus.

sourceString: Three feet is considered an appropriate distance for people to stay away from a patient.
targetString: ሰዎች ከአንድ ታማሚ ሊኖራቸው የሚገባ ርቀት ሶስት ጫማ ነው።
en-mt: People should keep a distance of three feet from a patient.

sourceString: These actions are effective methods to lower the risk of infection as well as prevent the spread of the virus.
targetString: እነዚህ እርምጃዎች የኢንፌክሽን ስጋትን ለመቀነስና የቫይረሱን ስርጭት ለመከላከል ውጤታማ ዘዴዎች ናቸው።
en-mt: These measures are effective methods to reduce the risk of infection and prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: Although SARS-CoV-2 came as a new virus to the human world, its high homology to SARS-CoV as reported on 7 January 2020 should have caused high alert to China based on her deep memory of the SARS outbreak in 2003.
targetString: ምንም እንኳን ሳርስ-CoV-2 ለሰው ልጅ ዓለም እንደ አዲስ ቫይረስ የተከሰተ ቢሆንም፣ ጃንዋሪ 7፣ 2020 ላይ ሪፖርት እንደተደረገው ከ ሳርስ-ኮቭ ጋር ያለው ከፍተኛ ተመሳሳይነት ቻይና በ 2003 ባጋጠማት የሳርስ ወረርሽኝ ከባድ ትውስታ ምክንያት ከፍተኛ የማንቂያ ደወል ሊሆናት በተገባ ነበር።
en-mt: Although SARS-CoV-2 emerged as a new virus to the human world, its close resemblance to SARS-CoV, as reported on January 7, 2020, should have been a major wake-up call due to the severe memory of the SARS outbreak in China in 2003.

sourceString: However, not until 19 January 2020 did the director of the Center of Disease Control of Wuhan comfort the citizens by saying that the novel virus has low contagiousness and limited reproductivity from human to human and that it is not a problem to prevent and contain the disease.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ የውሃን የበሽታ ቁጥጥር ማዕከል ዳይሬክተር አዲሱ ቫይረስ ከሰው ወደ ሰው የመተላለፍ ዕድሉ ዝቅተኛ መሆኑንና የመራባት ዕድሉም የተወሰነ መሆኑንና በሽታውን መከላከልና መቆጣጠር አስቸጋሪ አለመሆኑን በመግለጽ ሕዝቡን ያጽናኑት ጃንዋሪ 19፣ 2020 ድረስ ቆይተው ነበር።
en-mt: However, it was not until January 19, 2020 that the director of the Water Disease Control Center reassured the public that the new virus has a low chance of being transmitted from person to person and that the chance of reproduction is limited and that the disease is not difficult to prevent and control.

sourceString: This message remarkably relaxed the alarm of the public, especially when the entire country was preparing for the Spring Festival, and the critical time was missed to contain the disease at its minimal scale in Wuhan.
targetString: በተለይም ደግሞ መላው ሃገሪቱ ለፀደይ ፌስቲቫል እየተዘጋጀች በነበረችበት ወቅት ይህ መልዕክት የሕዝቡን የማንቂያ ደረጃ በከፍተኛ መጠን አለዝቦታል፣ በሽታውም ውሃን ውስጥ ገና በዝቅተኛ ደረጃ ላይ እያለ ለመቆጣጠር የሚያስችል ወሳኝ ጊዜም ባከነ።
en-mt: Especially when the whole country was preparing for the spring festival, this message raised the alarm level of the people to a great extent, and wasted a crucial time to control the disease while it was still at a low level.

sourceString: The disease control agencies in China may take this hard lesson and make critical improvements in the future.
targetString: ቻይና ውስጥ ያሉ የበሽታ ቁጥጥር ድርጅቶች ይህን ከባድ ትምህርት በመውሰድ ለወደፊቱ ጠንከር ያሉ የማሻሻያ ስራዎችን ሊሰሩ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Disease control organizations in China can take this hard lesson and make drastic improvements in the future.

sourceString: For example, these agencies should be (1) more careful when making public announcements as every word counts to citizens and can change their attitude and decisions; (2) more sensitive and reactive to unusual information from clinics rather than waiting for formal reports from doctors or officials; (3) more restrictive to contain a potential epidemic at its early stage rather than attempting to comfort the public; and (4) more often to issue targeted and effective drills to increase the public's awareness about epidemic diseases and to test and improve the response system of the society periodically.
targetString: ለምሳሌ፣ እነዚህ ኤጄንሲዎች (1) ዜጎች ለእያንዳንዱ ቃል ክብደት ስለሚሰጡና አመለካከታውንና ውሳኔዎቻቸውን ሊቀይሩ ስለሚችሉ ይፋዊ መግለጫዎችን በሚሰጡበት ወቅት የበለጠ ጥንቃቄ ማድረግ አለባቸው፤ (2) ከዶክተሮች ወይም ሃላፊዎች መደበኛ ሪፖርቶችን ከመጠባበቅ ይልቅ ከክሊኖክ ለሚወጡ ያልተለመዱ መረጃዎች ይበልጥ ስሱ እና ምላሽ ሰጪ መሆን አለባቸው፤ (3) ሕዝቡን ለማጽናናት ከመሞከር ይልቅ አንድ ወረርሽኝ እንደተከሰተ ገና በእንጭጩ ለማስቀረት ይበልጥ ገዳቢ መሆን አለባቸው፤ እና (4) ሕዝቡ ስለ ወረርሽኝ በሽታዎች ያለውን ግንዛቤ ለማሳደግና የማህበረሰቡን ምላሽ መስጫ ስርዓት በተወሰነ ጊዜ ለመፈተሽና ለማሻሻል የሚያስችሉ ዒላማቸውን የጠበቁና ውጤታማ የሆኑ የልምምድ ስራዎችን በበለጠ ጊዜ ማውጣት አለባቸው።
en-mt: For example, these agencies should be more careful when making public statements because (1) citizens give weight to every word and can change their attitudes and decisions; (2) they should be more sensitive and responsive to unusual information from the clinic rather than waiting for routine reports from doctors or supervisors; (3) rather than trying to comfort the population, they should be more restrictive in order to prevent an outbreak in the first place; and (4) conduct more targeted and effective exercises to increase public awareness of epidemics and to test and improve community response systems over time.

sourceString: The outbreak of COVID-19 caused by the novel virus SARS-CoV-2 started in the end of December 2019.
targetString: በኖቭል ኮሮና ቫይረስ ሳርስ-CoV-2 ምክንያት የተከሰተው የ COVID-19 ወረርሽኝ የጀመረው በዲሴምበር 2019 መጨረሻ ላይ ነበር።
en-mt: The outbreak of COVID-19, caused by the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2, began in late December 2019.

sourceString: In less than two months, it has spread all over China and near 50 other countries globally at the time of this writing.
targetString: ከሁለት ወራት ባነሰ ጊዜ ውስጥ፣ በመላው ቻይና የተሰራጨ ሲሆን ይህ ጽሁፍ በሚዘጋጅበት ወቅትም ወደ 50 የሚሆኑ ሃገራት ላይም ለመሰራጨት ችሏል።
en-mt: In less than two months, it has been distributed throughout China and at the time of writing, it has been distributed in about 50 countries.

sourceString: Since the virus is very similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms are also similar between COVID-19 and SARS, the outbreak of COVID-19 has created a sense of SARS recurring.
targetString: ቫይረሱ ከሳርስ-ኮቭ ጋር በጣም ተመሳሳይ በመሆኑና የ COVID-19 እና ሳርስ ምልክቶችም ተመሳሳይነት ስላላቸው፣ የ COVID-19 ወረርሽኝ መከሰት ሳርስ በድጋሚ ይከሰታል የሚል ስሜት ፈጥሯል።
en-mt: Because the virus is so similar to SARS-CoV and the symptoms of COVID-19 and SARS are similar, the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic has created a sense of a resurgence of SARS.

sourceString: However, there are some remarkable differences between COVID-19 and SARS, which are essential for containing the epidemic and treating the patients.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ በ COVID-19 እና ሳርስ መካከል የተወሰኑ ጉልህ ልዩነቶች አሉ፤ እነዚህም ወረርሽኙን በቁጥጥር ስር ለማዋልና በሽተኞችን ለማከም ወሳኝ ናቸው።
en-mt: However, there are some significant differences between COVID-19 and SARS; These are critical to controlling the outbreak and treating patients.

sourceString: COVID-19 affects more elderly individuals than youth and more men than women, and the severity and death rate are also higher in elderly individual than in youth.
targetString: COVID-19 ከወጣቶች ይልቅ ዕድሜያቸው የገፉ ሰዎችን፣ ከሴቶች ይልቅ ወንዶችን ይበልጥ የሚያጠቃ ሲሆን የበሽታው ክብደትና የሞት መጠንም እንደዚሁ ከወጣቶች ይልቅ በአረጋውያን ላይ ይጨምራል።
en-mt: COVID-19 affects the elderly more than the young, men more than women, and the severity of the disease and death rate are also higher in the elderly than in the young.

sourceString: SARS has higher mortality than COVID-19 (10.91% versus 1.44%).
targetString: ሳርስ ያስከተለው የሞት መጠን ከ COVID-19 ይበልጣል (10.91% ከ 1.44% ሲነጻጸር)።
en-mt: The death rate caused by SARS is higher than that of COVID-19 (10.91% compared to 1.44%).

sourceString: COVID-19 patients transmit the virus even when they are symptomless whereas SARS patients do so usually when they are severely ill, which causes much greater difficulty to contain the spread of COVID-19 than SARS.
targetString: የ COVID-19 ታማሚዎች ምልክት ሳይኖርባቸውም እንኳን ቫይረሱን የሚያስተላልፉ ሲሆን፣ የ ሳርስ ታማሚዎች ግን ቫይረሱን የሚያስተላልፉት አብዛኛውን ጊዜ በጠና በታመሙበት ወቅት ነው፤ በዚህም ምክንያት፣ የ COVID-19 ስርጭት ከ ሳርስ በላይ ለመቆጣጠር አስቸጋሪ ያደርገዋል።
en-mt: While COVID-19 patients can transmit the virus even without symptoms, SARS patients usually transmit the virus when they are very ill; As a result, the spread of COVID-19 will be more difficult to control than SARS.

sourceString: This partially explains why SARS-CoV-2 spread much faster and broader than SARS-CoV.
targetString: ይህም ሳርስ-CoV-2 ከ ሳርስ-CoV በፈጠነና በሰፋ ሁኔታ ለምን እንደተሰራጨ ከፊል ማብራሪያ ይሰጣል።
en-mt: This provides a partial explanation for why SARS-CoV-2 spread faster and more widely than SARS-CoV.

sourceString: The regular RNA assay for SARS-CoV-2 can be negative in some COVID-19 patients.
targetString: ለ ሳርስ-CoV-2 የሚደረገው መደበኛ የ RNA ምርመራ በአንዳንድ የ COVID-19 ታማሚዎች ላይ ነጌቲቭ ሊሆን ይችላል።
en-mt: Routine RNA testing for SARS-CoV-2 may be negative in some patients with COVID-19.

sourceString: On the other hand, cured patients can be positive for the virus again.
targetString: በሌላ በኩል፣ የዳኑ ታማሚዎች በድጋሚ የቫይረሱ ፖዘቲቭ ሊሆኑ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: On the other hand, recovered patients may become virus positive again.

sourceString: These findings dramatically increase the risk of virus spreading.
targetString: እነዚህ ግኝቶች የቫይረስ ስርጭት ስጋትን በከፍተኛ ሁኔታ ይጨምራሉ።
en-mt: These findings significantly increase the risk of viral transmission.

sourceString: Given such rapid progress in research on COVID-19, several critical issues remain to be solved, as follows:
targetString: በ COVID-19 ላይ የሚደረገው ምርምር በፍጥነት እመርታ እያሳዩ በመሆኑ፣ በርካታ ወሳኝ ጉዳዮች እልባት ማግኘት አለባቸው፤ ለምሳሌ የሚከተሉት:
en-mt: As research on COVID-19 continues to progress rapidly, several critical issues must be addressed; For example the following:

sourceString: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?
targetString: ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 ከየት ነው የመጣው?
en-mt: Where did SARS-CoV-2 come from?

sourceString: Although 96% genetic homolog was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 is from bats.
targetString: ምንም እንኳን በ ሳርስ-CoV-2 እና በሁለት የሌሊት ወፍ ሳርስ መሳይ CoVs መካከል 96% የዘረ መል ተመሳሳይነት የተገኘ ቢሆንም፣ አሁንም ድረስ ሳርስ-CoV-2 የመጣው ከሌሊት ወፎች ነው ብለን መደምደም አንችልም።
en-mt: Although 96% genetic similarity was found between SARS-CoV-2 and two bat SARS-like CoVs, we still cannot conclude that SARS-CoV-2 originated from bats.

sourceString: What animal was the intermediate species to transmit the virus from the original host, say bats, to humans?
targetString: ቫይረሱን ከመጀመሪያወ ተሸካሚ፣ እንበል የሌሊት ወፍ ወደ ሰዎች በማስተላለፍ ሒደት ውስጥ አሸጋጋሪ የነበረው እንስሳ ዝርያ የቱ ነው?
en-mt: Which animal species was the carrier in the process of transmitting the virus from its original carrier, let's say bat, to humans?

sourceString: Without knowing answers to #1 and 2, we cannot efficiently cut the transmission, and the outbreak can relapse at any time.
targetString: ለተራ ቁ. 1 እና 2 የሚሆኑ መልሶችን ሳናውቅ፣ ስርጭቱን በብቃት ማቆም አንችልም፣ ወረርሽኙም በማንኛውም ጊዜ ሊያገረሽ ይችላል።
en-mt: For turn no. Without answers to questions 1 and 2, we cannot effectively stop the spread, and the epidemic could recur at any time.

sourceString: Although molecular modeling and biochemical assays have demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how exactly does the virus enter the airway cells and cause subsequent pathological changes?
targetString: ምንም እንኳን ሳርስ-CoV-2 ከ ACE2 ጋር የተቆራኜ መሆኑ በሞለኪዩላር ሞዴሊንግ እና ባዮኬሚካል ምርመራዎች የታየ ቢሆንም፣ ቫይረሱ ወደ አየር ቧንቧ ሕዋሳት ገብቶ በሽታ የሚያስከትለው እንዴት ነው?
en-mt: Although molecular modeling and biochemical tests have shown that SARS-CoV-2 binds to ACE2, how does the virus enter airway cells and cause disease?

sourceString: Does the virus also bind ACE2-expressing cells in other organs?
targetString: ቫይረሱ በሌሎች የሰውነት ክፍሎች ውስጥ ከ ACE2 ገላጭ ሕዋሳት ጋር ቁርኝት አለው?
en-mt: Does the virus associate with ACE2-expressing cells in other parts of the body?

sourceString: Without clear answers to these questions, we cannot achieve fast and accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.
targetString: ለእነዚህ ጥያቄዎች ግልጽ የሆኑ ምላሾች ካልተገኙ፣ ፈጣንና ትክክለኛ የሆነ የበሽታ ልየታና ውጤታማ ሕክምና ለማሳካት አንችልም።
en-mt: Without clear answers to these questions, we will not be able to achieve rapid and accurate disease diagnosis and effective treatment.

sourceString: How long will the epidemic last?
targetString: ወረርሽኙ የሚቆየው ለስንት ጊዜ ነው?
en-mt: How long will the epidemic last?

sourceString: How is the virus genetically evolving during transmission among humans?
targetString: ቫይረሱ በሰዎች መካከል በሚተላለፍበት ወቅት የዘረ መል ዕድገት የሚያሳየው እንዴት ነው?
en-mt: How does the virus evolve when it is transmitted between humans?

sourceString: Will it become a pandemic worldwide, die down like SARS or relapse periodically like the flu?
targetString: ዓለም አቀፍ ወረርሽኝ ይሆናል፣ ልክ እንደ ሳርስ ይከስማል ወይስ ልከ እንደ ጉንፋን ወቅት ጠብቆ ያገረሻል?
en-mt: Will it become a global pandemic, like SARS, or will it keep coming back like the flu season?

sourceString: It is essential but may take some time to search for answers to the above and many other questions.
targetString: ከላይ ላለውና ለሌሎች በርካታ ጥያቄዎች ምላሾችን መፈለግ ወሳኝ ቢሆንም የተወሰነ ጊዜ ሊወስድ ይችላል።
en-mt: Finding answers to the above and many other questions is critical, but may take some time.

sourceString: However, with whatever expense it may demand, we have no other choice but to stop the epidemic as soon as possible and bring our life back to normal.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ የሚጠይቀው ወጪ ምንም ቢሆን፣ ወረርሽኙን በተቻለ ፍጥነት ከማስቆምና ወደ መደበኛው ሕይወታችን ከመመለስ ውጭ ሌላ አማራጭ የለንም።
en-mt: However, no matter the cost, we have no choice but to end the epidemic as soon as possible and return to our normal lives.

sourceString: Zoonotic origins of human coronaviruses
targetString: የሰው ኮሮና ቫይረሶች የመጡበት መነሻ
en-mt: The origin of human corona viruses

sourceString: Mutation and adaptation have driven the co-evolution of coronaviruses (CoVs) and their hosts, including human beings, for thousands of years.
targetString: መቀያየርና መላመድ የኮሮናቫይረስንና ሰዉን ጨምሮ ተሸካሚዎቻቸዉ የብዙ ሺህ አመታት መነሻ ሆኗል።
en-mt: Changing and adapting has been the origin of the coronavirus and its carriers, including humans, for thousands of years.

sourceString: Before 2003, two human CoVs (HCoVs) were known to cause mild illness, such as common cold.
targetString: ከ 2003 በፊት ሁለት የሰው ኮቭች (ኤችኮቭች) እንደ ጉንፋን መሰል ቀላል ህመም እንደሚያስከትሉ ተረጋግጧል።
en-mt: Prior to 2003, two types of human HCV were found to cause a mild flu-like illness.

sourceString: The outbreaks of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) and the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) have flipped the coin to reveal how devastating and life-threatening an HCoV infection could be.
targetString: ከባድ የመተንፈሻ አካላት ህመም (SARS) ና የመካከለኛ ምስራቅ የመተንፈሻ አካላት ህማም (MERS) ወረርሽኝ የ ኤችኮቭች ኢንፌክሽን ምንያህል አጥፊና ለሕይዎት ኣስጊ እንደሆነ አሳይቷል።
en-mt: The outbreaks of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) and Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) have shown just how destructive and life-threatening Hkov infection can be.

sourceString: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China at the end of 2019 has thrusted CoVs into the spotlight again and surprised us with its high transmissibility but reduced pathogenicity compared to its sister SARS-CoV.
targetString: በ 2019 መገባደጃ ላይ በማዕከላዊ ቻይና ውስጥ የ SARS-CoV-2 መነሳት ኮቮችን እንደገና የትኩረት አቅጣጫ እንዲወስዱ አድርጓል እናም በከፍተኛ የመተላለፍ አቅሙ አስገርሞናል ሆኖም ግን ከአቻው SARS-CoV ጋር ሲነፃፃር የበሽታ አምጪነቱ ቀንሷል።
en-mt: The emergence of SARS-CoV-2 in central China in late 2019 brought CoVs back into focus and surprised us with its high transmissibility, yet reduced pathogenicity compared to its counterpart SARS-CoV.

sourceString: HCoV infection is a zoonosis and understanding the zoonotic origins of HCoVs would serve us well.
targetString: የኤችኮቭ ህመም የእንሰሳት በሽታ በመሆኑ የኤችኮቭን የእንሰሳ ምንጮች መገንዘብ እጅግ በጣም ይጠቅመናል።
en-mt: As HCV is an animal disease, it is very useful to understand the animal sources of HCV.

sourceString: Most HCoVs originated from bats where they are non-pathogenic.
targetString: ብዙ HCoVዎች ከሌሊት አእዋፋት የመጡ ሲሆን እነሱ ውስጥ የበሽታ መንስኤ አይደሉም።
en-mt: Many HCoVs come from nocturnal birds and are not pathogenic in them.

sourceString: The intermediate reservoir hosts of some HCoVs are also known.
targetString: የአንዳንድ ኤችኮቭች መካከለኛ ዋና ተሸካሚዎችም በመባል ይታወቃሉ።
en-mt: They are also known as primary carriers of some Hkovich intermediates.

sourceString: Identifying the animal hosts has direct implications in the prevention of human diseases.
targetString: ተሸካሚ እንስሳትን መለየት የሰው ልጅ በሽታዎችን ከመከላከል ጋር ቀጥታ ግንኙነት አለው።
en-mt: Identification of carrier animals is directly related to prevention of human diseases.

sourceString: Investigating CoV-host interactions in animals might also derive important insight on CoV pathogenesis in humans.
targetString: በእንስሳት ውስጥ የኮቭ-ተሸካሚ መስተጋብሮችን መመርመር በሰው ልጆች ውስጥ የኮቭ በሽታ አምጪነት ላይ ጠቃሚ ግንዛቤ ሊያስጨብጠንም ይችላል።
en-mt: Investigating Cov-carrier interactions in animals may also provide important insights into Cov pathogenesis in humans.

sourceString: In this review, we present an overview of the existing knowledge about the seven HCoVs, with a focus on the history of their discovery as well as their zoonotic origins and interspecies transmission.
targetString: በዚህ ግምገማ ውስጥ፣ ስለ ሰባቱ ኤችኮቮች ያለውን መረጃ፣ የተገኙበት ታሪክን እንዲሁም ደግሞ ዋና መነሻዎችን እና የበይነተዋህሲ መተላፍ ላይ በማተኮር የነባር መረጃ ማጠቃለያን እናቀርባለን።
en-mt: In this review, we provide a summary of the available data on the seven HCOVs, their history of discovery, and a focus on their main origins and intergenerational transmission.

sourceString: Importantly, we compare and contrast the different HCoVs from a perspective of virus evolution and genome recombination.
targetString: አስፈላጊው ነገር፣ ከቫይረስ ጅማሮና ጄኖም ዳግም ስብስብ እንጻር የተለያዩ ኤችኮቭስን አወዳድረን እናነጻጽራለን።
en-mt: Importantly, we compare and contrast different HCOVs against viral initiation and genome reassembly.

sourceString: The current CoV disease 2019 (COVID-19) epidemic is discussed in this context.
targetString: የአሁኑ ኮቭ በሽታ 2019 (COVID-19) ወረርሽኝ በዚህ አውድ ውስጥ ነው የተብራራው።
en-mt: The current COVID-19 outbreak is discussed in this context.

sourceString: In addition, the requirements for successful host switches and the implications of virus evolution on disease severity are also highlighted.
targetString: በተጨማሪ፣ በበሽታ ክብደት ላይ የስኬታማ ተሸካሚ ልውውጦች መስፈርት እና የቫይረስ ስነ-ተፈጥሮ አንድምታዎችም ተጠቁመዋል።
en-mt: Additionally, the implications of criteria for successful carrier exchanges and virus ecology on disease severity are also indicated.

sourceString: Coronaviruses (CoVs) belong to the family Coronaviridae, which comprises a group of enveloped, positive-sensed, single-stranded RNA viruses.
targetString: የኮሮና ቫይረስ ኮሮናቫይርደ ከምባል የቫይረስ ቡድን የሚመደብ ሲሆን የተሸፋፈኑ ቡድን፤ ፖዘቲቭ እና ነጠላ አርኤንኤ ቫይረሶችን የየዘ ነው።
en-mt: Corona virus belongs to the group of viruses called Coronavirde and the group covered; It consists of positive and single-stranded RNA viruses.

sourceString: These viruses harbouring the largest genome of 26 to 32 kilobases amongst RNA viruses were termed “CoVs” because of their crown-like morphology under electron microscope.
targetString: እነዚህ ቫይረሶች ከ RNA ቫይረሶች ትልቁን ጄኖም ከ26 እስከ 32 ኪሎቤስስ የሚይዙ ሲሆን በ“ኮቭች“ የተሰየሙት በኤሌክትሮን ማይኪሮስኮፕ ስር ስነ-ቅርፃቸውዉ አክሊል ስለሚመስል ነዉ።
en-mt: These viruses contain the largest genomes of the RNA viruses, ranging from 26 to 32 kilobases, and are named "Covch" because of their crown-like morphology under the electron microscope.

sourceString: Structurally, CoVs have non-segmented genomes that share a similar organization.
targetString: በመዋቅር፣ ደረጃ ኮቭች ያልተከፈፋለ ተመሳሳይ መወቅር የሚካፈል ጄኖሞች አለሉተት።
en-mt: Structurally, phase covches are undivided genomes that share the same genome.

sourceString: Approximately two thirds of the genome contain two large overlapping open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which are translated into the pp1a and pp1ab replicase polyproteins.
targetString: በግምት ሁለት ሶስተኛዎቹ የቫይረሱ ዝርያ ሁለት ትላልቅ ክፍት ማንበቢያዎች (ORF1a እና ORF1b) የያዙ ሲሆኑ፣ ወደ pp1a እና pp1ab የተባዙ ብዙ ፕሮቲኖች ይለወጣሉ።
en-mt: Approximately two-thirds of the virus strains contain two large open reading frames (ORF1a and ORF1b), which convert to multiple proteins that replicate to pp1a and pp1ab.

sourceString: The polyproteins are further processed to generate 16 non-structural proteins, designated nsp1~16.
targetString: ፖሊፕሮቲኖች የባለ 16 ቅርፃዊ-ያልሆኑ ፕሮቲኖችን፣ የተለዩ nsp1~16 ለመፍጠር በቀጣይነት ይከናወናሉ።
en-mt: Polyproteins are further processed to form 16 non-structural proteins, distinct nsp1~16.

sourceString: The remaining portion of the genome contains ORFs for the structural proteins, including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleoprotein (N).
targetString: የቀረዉ የክፍል የሚይዘዉ ለፕሮትን መዋቅር ስፓይክ (S)፣ እንቪሎፕ (E)፣ ሜምብሬን (M) ና ኑኩሎቶይድ (N)ን ጨሚሮ ORFs ነዉ።
en-mt: The remainder of the class contains ORFs for protein structures including spike (S), envelope (E), membrane (M) and nucleotide (N).

sourceString: A number of lineage-specific accessory proteins are also encoded by different lineages of CoVs.
targetString: በርካታ ተለዋዋጭ የፕሮቲን ዘር ግንድ በተለያዩ የኮቭች የዘር ግንዶችም ይመዘገባሉ።
en-mt: A number of variable protein lineages are also recorded in various Kovch lineages.

sourceString: Based on the difference in protein sequences, CoVs are classified into four genera (alpha-CoV, beta-CoV, gamma-CoV and delta-CoV), among which the beta-CoV genera contains most HCoVs and is subdivided into four lineages (A, B, C and D).
targetString: ፕሮቲን ዉስጥ ባለዉ ቅደም ተከተል ልዩነት ላይ ተንተርሶ ኮቭች በአራት ምድብ ነዉ የሚከፈሉት (አልፋ-ኮቭ፣ ቤታ-ኮቭ፣ ጋማ-ኮቭ እና ዴልታ-ኮቭ)፤ ከነዚህ ዉስጥ ቤታ-ኮቭ ጄኔራ ብዙ ኤችኮቭች የሚይዝ ስሆን በአምስት ንዑስ የዘር ግንድ ይከፈላሉ (A፣ B፣ C እና D)።
en-mt: Depending on the difference in the sequence in the protein, Tanterson Coves are divided into four categories (alpha-cove, beta-cove, gamma-cove and delta-cove); Of these, the Beta-Cov genera contain many Hcovs and are divided into five sub-lineages (A, B, C and D).

sourceString: Phylogenetic evidence has shown that bats and rodents serve as the gene source of most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.
targetString: የዝርያ ማስረጃ እንደሚያሳየው የሌሊት ወፍ እና አይጥ አስተኔዎች ለአብዛኛው alpha-CoVs እና beta-CoVs በዘር ምንጭነት ሲያገለግሉ፣ ወፎች ደግሞ የ gamma-CoVs እና delta-CoVs ዋና ማጠራቀሚያ ናቸው።
en-mt: Genetic evidence suggests that bats and rodents serve as the seed source for most alpha-CoVs and beta-CoVs, while birds are the main reservoir of gamma-CoVs and delta-CoVs.

sourceString: For thousands of years, CoVs have constantly crossed species barriers and some have emerged as important human pathogens.
targetString: ለብዙ ሺ ዓመታት ኮቭች በተደጋጋሚ የዝርያ ድንበርን ያልፉ ነበረ። እንዲሁም አንዳንዶቹ ወሳኝ ለሰዉ የበሽታ መንስኤ ሆነው ይከሰታሉ።
en-mt: For thousands of years, kovacs have repeatedly crossed species boundaries. Also, some of them are important causes of human diseases.

sourceString: To date, seven human CoVs (HCoVs) are known.
targetString: እስካሁን የሚታወቁ ሰዉችን የሚያጠቁ ኮቭች (ኤችኮቭች) ሰባት ናቸዉ።
en-mt: So far, there are seven known Hkovchs that attack people.

sourceString: Among them HCoV-229E and HCoV-NL63 are alpha-CoVs.
targetString: ከእነዚህም መካከል ኤችኮቭ-229ኢ እና ኤችኮቭ-ኤንኤል63 የሚባሉት አልፋ-ኮቭ ናቸው።
en-mt: Among them are alpha-Cov, called Hkov-229E and Hkov-NL63.

sourceString: The other five beta-CoVs include HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1, severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.
targetString: ሌሎች አምስቱ ቤታ-ኮቭs የሚይዙት ኤችኮቭ-ኦሲ43፣ ኤችኮቭ-ኤችኬዩ፣ ከባድ የመተንፈሻ በሽታ ኮሮኖቫይረስ (ሳርስ-ኮቭ)፣ የመካከለኛ ምስራቅ የመተንፈሻ በሽታ ኮሮኖቫይረስ (ሜርስ-ኮቭ) እና ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 ናቸዉ።
en-mt: The other five beta-CoVs are HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU, severe respiratory disease coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Middle East respiratory disease coronavirus (MERS-CoV) and SARS-CoV-2.

sourceString: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, HCoV-HKU1 and HCoV-NL63 usually cause mild symptoms, like common cold and/or diarrhea.
targetString: ኤችኮቭ-229ኢ፣ ኤችኮቭ-ኦሲ43፣ ኤችኮቭ-ኤችኬዩ1 እና ኤችኮቭ-ኤንኤል63 በአብዛኛው እንደ ጉንፋን እና/ወይም ተቅማጥ መሰል መለስተኛ የበሽታ ምልክቶችን ያስከትላሉ።
en-mt: Hkov-229E, Hkov-OC43, Hkov-HKU1 and Hkov-NL63 usually cause mild flu-like symptoms and/or diarrhea.

sourceString: In contrast, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and the newly-identified SARS-CoV-2 are highly pathogenic, causing severe lower respiratory tract infection in relatively more patients with a higher chance to develop acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and extrapulmonary manifestations.
targetString: በተቃራኒ ደግሞ፣ ሳርስ-ኮቭ፣ ሜርስ-ኮቭ እና በቅርብ ግዜ የተለየዉ ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 በከፍተኛ ሁኔታ የበሽታ መንስኤ ሲሆኑ፣ በመጠኑ ብዙ ታማሚዎች ላይ በታችኛዉ መተንፈሻ አካባቢ ላይ ኢንፌክሽን በማስከተል ከፍተኛ የመተንፈስ አለመቻል በሽታን (ARDS) እና ኤክስትራፑልመነሪ ምልክቶች እንዲኖራቸው ያደርጋል።
en-mt: In contrast, SARS-Cov, MERS-Cov, and the more recently isolated SARS-Cov-2 are highly pathogenic, causing lower respiratory tract infections in a relatively large number of patients, leading to acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) and extrapulmonary symptoms.

sourceString: The first HCoV-229E strain, B814, was isolated from the nasal discharge of patients with common cold in mid-1960s.
targetString: የመጀመሪያ ኤችኮቭ-229E ናሙና የሆነው ቢ814፣ በጉንፋን ከተያዙት በሽተኞች አፍንጫ ከሚወጣ ፈሳሽ በ 1960ዎች አጋማሽ ተለይቶ ነበር።
en-mt: B814, the first HCoV-229E sample, was isolated from the nasal secretions of patients with the flu in the mid-1960s.

sourceString: Since then, more knowledge was accumulated through extensive studies on HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43, both of which cause self-limiting symptoms.
targetString: ከዚያ ጊዜ ጀምሮ በኤችኮቭ-229ኢ እናኤችኮቭ-ኦሲ43 ሁለቱም ራስን-የመገደብ ምልክቶችን የሚያስከትሉ ላይ በተደረገ ሰፊ ጥናት ብዙ እዉቀቶች ተገኝተዋል።
en-mt: Since then, much knowledge has been gained from extensive research on both HCoV-229E and HCoV-OC43 causing self-limiting symptoms.

sourceString: Indeed, the concept had been widely accepted that infection with HCoVs is generally harmless until the outbreak of SARS.
targetString: በእርግጥ፣ በኤችኮቭች የሚመጣ ኢንፌክሽን የሳርስ ወረርሽን እስኪነሳ በአጠቃላይ ጉዳት አያመጣም የሚለዉ ሀሳብ በብዛት ተቀባይነት አግኝቷል።
en-mt: Indeed, until the outbreak of the SARS outbreak, the idea that H.cocci infection was generally harmless was widely accepted.

sourceString: The SARS outbreak occurred in 2003 is one of the most devastating in current history, infecting over 8,000 people with a crude case fatality of approximately 10%.
targetString: በ2003 የተከሰተዉ የሳርስ ወረርሽኝ በቅርብ ታሪክ ዉስጥ ብዙ አደጋን ያስከታለ ነዉ። ከ8,000 በላይ ሰዎችን አጥቅቷል 10% የሚሆኑት ደገሞ በከፋ ደረጃ ላይ የሚገኙ ናቸው ።
en-mt: The SARS outbreak in 2003 is one of the worst in recent history. It has affected more than 8,000 people, 10% of whom are in critical condition.

sourceString: Ten years later, the Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS) outbreak resulted in a persistent epidemic in the Arabian Peninsula with sporadic spreading to the rest of the world.
targetString: ከአስር ዓመት በኋላ የመካካለኛ ምስራቅ የመተንፈሻ አካላት ህመም (ሜርስ) ወረርሽኝ በአረብ ልሳነ ምድር በተደጋጋሚ ተከስቶ ወደ ሌላ ክፍላ ዓለም በፍጥነት ተዛምቶ ነበር።
en-mt: A decade later, the Middle East Respiratory Disease (MERS) epidemic had reoccurred in the Arabian Peninsula and quickly spread to other parts of the world.
