targetString: ዋነኛው ህክምና ምልክታዊ እና ድጋፋዊ ህክምና ናቸው። የሚመከሩ የመከላከያ እርምጃዎች እጅ መታጠብ፣ ሲያስሉ አፍን መሸፈን፣ ከሌላ ሰው ያለ እርቀትን መጠበቅ፣ እና እንደተጠቁ ለሚያስቡ ሰዎች እራሳቸውን መከታተል እና እራሳቸውን ማግለልን ያካትታል።
en-mt: The mainstay of treatment is symptomatic and supportive care. Recommended preventive measures include washing hands, covering the mouth when coughing, keeping physical distance from other people, and self-monitoring and self-isolation for people who think they may have been exposed.

sourceString: Authorities worldwide have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace hazard controls, and facility closures.
targetString: በአለም ዙሪያ ያሉ ባለስልጣናት የጉዞ ገደብ፣ ኳራንቲንስ፣ የሰአት ገደብ፣ የስራ ቦታ አደጋ ቁጥጥሮች፣ እና የፋሲሊቲዎች መዘጋትን ስራ ላይ በማዋል ምላሻቸውን ሰጥተዋል።
en-mt: Authorities around the world have responded by implementing travel restrictions, quarantines, curfews, workplace risk controls, and facility closures.

sourceString: The pandemic has led to severe global socioeconomic disruption, the postponement or cancellation of sporting, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies exacerbated by panic buying.
targetString: ወረርሽኙ ከባድ የሆነ የአለም አቀፍ ሶሾኢኮኖሚክ ውጥረት፣ የስፖርት ጨዋታዎች፣ የሃይማኖት፣ የፖለቲካ እና ባህላዊ ዝግጅቶች መራዘም እና መሰረዝ፣ በድንጋጤ በሚደረገው ሸመታ መጠነ ሰፊ የአቅርቦቶች እጥረቶች አስከትሏል።
en-mt: The pandemic has caused severe global socioeconomic stress, postponements and cancellations of sporting events, religious, political and cultural events, and widespread shortages of supplies amid panic shopping.

sourceString: Schools and universities have closed either on a nationwide or local basis in 193 countries, affecting approximately 99.4 percent  of the world's student population.
targetString: በ 193 አገሮች ውስጥ በአካባቢ ወይም በአለም አቀፍ ደረጃ ትምህርትቤቶች እና ዪኒቨርሲቲዎች፣ ወደ 99.4 በመቶ የሚጠጋውን የተማሪዎች ቁጥር ላይ ተጽእኖ በማድረስ ተዘግተዋል።
en-mt: Schools and universities in 193 countries, either locally or internationally, have been closed, affecting nearly 99.4 percent of the student population.

sourceString: Misinformation about the virus has spread online, and there have been incidents of xenophobia and discrimination against Chinese people, other people of East and Southeast Asian descent and appearance, and others from areas with significant virus cases.
targetString: ስለቫይረሱ ትክክለኛ የልሆና መረጃ ኦንላይን በመሰራጨቱ በቻይና፣ ደቡብና ምስራቅ እስያ እና ከሌሎች ቫይረስ ከታየባቸዉ ሀገራት የመጡ ዜጎች ላይ ጥላቻና ማግለል እየደረሰባቸዉ ነዉ።
en-mt: Due to the spread of inaccurate information about the virus online, citizens from China, South and East Asia and other virus-affected countries are facing hatred and isolation.

sourceString: Due to reduced travel and closures of heavy industry, there has been a decrease in air pollution and carbon emissions.
targetString: በጉዞ መቀነስ እና ከባድ ኢንዱስትሪ መዘጋት ምክንያት፣ የአየር ብክለት እና የካርቦን ልቀቶች ቀንሰው ነበር።
en-mt: Due to reduced travel and heavy industry closures, air pollution and carbon emissions were reduced.

sourceString: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei province) reported a cluster of pneumonia cases of unknown cause on 31 December 2019, and an investigation was launched in early January 2020.
targetString: ዉሀን፣ ቻይና (የሁቤይ ግዛት ዋና ከተማ) ውስጥ የሚገኙ የጤና ባለስልጣናት፣ ዲሴምበር 31∕2019 ላይ ምንጩ የማይታወቅ የኒውሞኒያ ክስተት ጥርቅሞችን በማሳወቅ ምርመራ በ ጃንዋሪ 2020 ላይ እንዲጀመር አድርገዋል።
en-mt: Health authorities in Wuhan, China (the capital of Hubei Province) reported on December 31∕2019 the details of an incident of pneumonia of unknown origin, prompting an investigation to begin in January 2020.

sourceString: The cases mostly had links to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market and so the virus is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: አብዛኛዎቹ ክስተቶች ከሁዋናን የባህር ምግቦች ጅምላ ሽያጭ ገበያ ጋር ግንኙነት ያላቸው ሲሆን ቫይረሱ ደግሞ ዙኖቲክ መነሻ እንዳለው ይገመታል።
en-mt: Most of the cases are linked to the Huanan seafood wholesale market, and the virus is thought to be zoonotic in origin.

sourceString: The virus that caused the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses, and SARS-CoV.The earliest known person with symptoms was later discovered to have fallen ill on 1 December 2019, and that person did not have visible connections with the later wet market cluster.
targetString: ስርጭቱን ያስከተለው ቫይረስ SARS-CoV-2 በመባል የሚታወቅ ሲሆን፣ ከሌሊት ወፎች ኮሮናቫይረሶች፣ የፓንጎሊን ኮሮናቫይረሶች እና SARS-CoV ጋር በቅርብ ተዛማጅ የሆነ አዲስ የተገኘ ቫይረስ ነው። የመጀመሪያ የበሽታው ምልክቶች የታየበት ሰው በታህሳስ 1∕2019 ታምሞ ተገኝቷል እና ያ ግለሰብ ከእርጥብ ገበያ ምድብ ጋር የሚታይ ግንኙነት የለውም።
en-mt: The virus causing the outbreak is known as SARS-CoV-2, a newly discovered virus closely related to bat coronaviruses, pangolin coronaviruses and SARS-CoV. The person with the first symptoms of the disease was found ill on December 1∕2019 and that person has no apparent contact with the wet market category.

sourceString: Of the early cluster of cases reported in December 2019, two-thirds were found to have a link with the market.
targetString: በታህሳስ መጀመርያ 2019 ዉስጥ ከታዩ ኬዞች መካከል ሁለት ሶስተኛ የሚሆኑት ከገበያ ጋር ግንኙናት ያለቸዉ ናቸዉ።
en-mt: Two-thirds of the cases seen in the beginning of December 2019 are related to the market.

sourceString: On 13 March 2020, an unverified report from the South China Morning Post suggested that a case traced back to 17 November 2019, in a 55-year-old from Hubei province, may have been the first.On 26 February 2020, the WHO reported that, as new cases reportedly declined in China but suddenly increased in Italy, Iran, and South Korea, the number of new cases outside China had exceeded the number of new cases within China for the first time.
targetString: መጋቢት 13∕2020 እለት ከደቡብ ቻይና ሞርንንግ ፖስት እንደዘገበዉ ወደ ሕዳር 17, 2019 በመመለስ የመጀመሪያ ኬዝ የ 55 እድሜ ያለው ሳዉ በሁቤ ግዛት ዉስጥ የሚኖር ሰዉ ላይ እንደተገኘ ነዉ። የካቲት 26∕2020 ዕለት WHO እንደ እንደዘገበዉ አዳድስ ኬዞች በቻይና እያቀነሱ እንደመጡና በተቃራኒ ደግሞ በጣሊያን፣ ኢራን እና ደቡብ ኮሪያ ዉስጥ በፊጥናት መጨመር ጀማረ። ከቻይና ዉጪ ያሉ አድስ ኬዞች ለመጀመሪያ ግዜ ነዉ በቻይና ዉስጥ ያለዉን አዲስ ኬዞችን የበለጠው።
en-mt: On March 13∕2020, the South China Morning Post reported that the first case dating back to November 17, 2019 was a 55-year-old man living in Hubei Province. On February 26, 2020, the WHO reported that new cases are decreasing in China, and on the contrary, they are increasing rapidly in Italy, Iran and South Korea. For the first time, new cases outside of China outnumbered new cases in China.

sourceString: There may be substantial underreporting of cases, particularly among those with milder symptoms.
targetString: ብዙ አነስተኛ የተዘገቡ ኬዞች ሊኖሩ ይችላሉ፣ በተለይም መለስተኛ የበሽታ ምልከቶች ባለባቸው መካከል።
en-mt: There may be many underreported cases, especially among those with mild symptoms.

sourceString: By 26 February, relatively few cases had been reported among youths, with those 19 and under making up 2.4% of cases worldwide.The United Kingdom's chief scientific adviser, Patrick Vallance, estimated that 60% of the British population would need to become infected before effective herd immunity could be achieved.
targetString: በሚያዝያ 26፣ ከሌላው ጊዜ አንፃር ከ 19 አመት በታች የሆኑ ታዳጊ ወጣቶች ውስጥ ጥቂት ኬዞች የተመዘገቡ ሲሆን በአለም ዙሪያ ኬዞች ውስጥ 2.4% ያህሉን ይይዛል። የዩናይትድ ኪንግደም ዋና የሳይትፊክ አማካሪ የሆኑት ፓትሪክ ቫላንስ፣ ውጤታማ በሽታን የመቋቋም ሁኔታ ላይ መደረሱ ከመሰማቱ በፊት የእንግሊዝ ህዝብን ብዛትን 60% የሚሆኑት ሊጠቁ እንደሚያስፈልግ ገምተዋል።
en-mt: On April 26, fewer cases were reported in adolescents under the age of 19 than at any other time, accounting for 2.4% of cases worldwide. Patrick Vallance, the UK's chief scientific advisor, estimated that 60% of the UK population would need to be infected before effective disease resistance is felt.

sourceString: Cases refers to the number of people who have been tested for COVID-19, and whose test has been confirmed positive according to official protocols.
targetString: ኬዞች የሚያመለክቱት ለCOVID-19 የተመረመሩ ሰዎች እና በይፋ ፕሮቶኮሎች መሰረት የምርመራው ውጤታቸው ፖዘቲቭ መሆኑን የተረጋገጠባቸው ሰዎችን ነው።
en-mt: Cases refer to people who have been tested for COVID-19 and tested positive according to official protocols.

sourceString: As of 23 March, no country had tested more than 3% of its population, and many countries have had official policies not to test those with only mild symptoms, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.
targetString: በ 23 ማርች፣ ከ 3% በላይ ህዝቡን የመረመረ አገር የለም፣ እና እንደ ጣሊያን፣ ኔይዘርላንድ፣ ስፔይን፣ እና ስዊዘርላንድ ያሉ፣ ብዙ አገራት ቀለል ያሉ ምልክቶች ያሏቸውን ብቻ ያለመመርመር የባለስልጣን መመሪያዎች ነበሯቸው።
en-mt: As of March 23, no country had tested more than 3% of the population, and many countries, such as Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland, had official guidelines not to test only those with mild symptoms.

sourceString: A study published on 16 March found that in China, up to 23 January, an estimated 86% of COVID-19 infections had not been detected, and that these undocumented infections were the infection source for 79% of documented cases.
targetString: በፈረንጆቹ መጋቢት 16 በታተመዉ ጥናት መሰረት በቻይና ዉስጥ እስከ ጥር 23 በግምት 86%ቱ የCOVID-19 ስርጭት አልታወቀም ነበር። እነዚህ ያልተመዘገቡ ስርጭቶች ለ 79%ቱ የተመዘገቡ የበሽታዉ ስርጭት ምንጭ የሆኑ ናቸዉ።
en-mt: As of January 23, approximately 86% of the spread of COVID-19 in China was undiagnosed, according to a study published on March 16. These unreported transmissions are the source of 79% of recorded transmission of the disease.

sourceString: A statistical analysis published 30 March estimated that numbers of infections in Italy were considerably greater than the reported cases.
targetString: መጋቢት 30 የታተመው የስታቲስቲካል ትንታኔ በጣልያን የተጠቂዎች ቁጥር ከተመዘገቡት ኬዞች በላይ ከፍ ያለ እንደሚሆን ገምቷል።
en-mt: A statistical analysis published on March 30 estimated that the number of victims in Italy would be higher than the number of registered cases.

sourceString: The initial estimates of the basic reproduction number (R0) for COVID-19 were 1.4 to 2.4.
targetString: የመጀመሪያው ግምት ለ COVID-19 መሰረታዊ ድጋሚ የማምረት ቁጥር (R0) ከ 1.4 እስከ 2.4 ነበር።
en-mt: The original estimate for the basic replication number (R0) for COVID-19 was 1.4 to 2.4.

sourceString: A study published by the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention has concluded that it may be 5.7.
targetString: በዩኤስ የበሽታ ቁጥጥር እና መካላከያ ማዕከል የታተመው ጥናት 5.7 ሊሆን እንደሚችል ይደመድማል።
en-mt: A study published by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention concludes that it may be 5.7.

sourceString: Most people with COVID-19 recover.
targetString: COVID-19 ያለባቸው አብዛኛዎቹ ሰዎች ያገግማሉ።
en-mt: Most people with COVID-19 recover.

sourceString: For those who do not, the time from development of symptoms to death has been between 6 and 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.
targetString: ለማያዉቁት፤ አንድ ሰዉ ምልክ ታይቶበት እስከሚሞት ድረስ የሚፈጀዉ ግዜ ከ 6 እሰከ 41 ቀናት ነዉ፣ በጣም የተለመደዉ ደግሞ 14 ቀን ነዉ።
en-mt: For those who don't know. The time it takes for a person to develop symptoms and die is 6 to 41 days, with the most common being 14 days.

sourceString: As of 10 April 2020, approximately 97,000 deaths had been attributed to COVID-19.
targetString: እስከ ሚያዝያ 10∕2020 ባለው ጊዜ፣ ከ COVID-19 ጋር በተገናኘ ወደ 97,000 ሞቶች ተመዝግበዋል።
en-mt: As of April 10∕2020, nearly 97,000 deaths related to COVID-19 have been recorded.

sourceString: In China, as of 5 February about 80% of deaths were in those over 60, and 75% had pre-existing health conditions including cardiovascular diseases and diabetes.Official tallies of deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic generally refer to dead people who tested positive for COVID according to official protocols.
targetString: እስከ የካቲት 5 ድረስ በቻይና ከተመዘገበዉ ሞት ዉስጥ 80% የሚሆነዉ እድሜያቸዉ ከ 60 ዓመት በላይ ስሆን 75% የሚሆኑት ደግሞ ነባር የደም ዝውውርና የስኳር በሽታ ያለባቸዉ ናቸው። በ COVID-19 ምክንያት የተከሰተ ኦፊሴላዊ የሞት መጠን ባጠቃላይ በኦፊሴላዊ ፕሮቶኮሎች መሰረት የ COVID-19 ፖዘቲቭ ሆነው የሞቱ ሰዎችን የሚመለከት ነው።
en-mt: As of February 5, 80% of the deaths recorded in China were over 60 years of age, and 75% were people with pre-existing conditions such as diabetes or hypertension. The official death rate due to COVID-19 generally refers to people who have died positive for COVID-19 according to official protocols.

sourceString: The number of true fatalities from COVID-19 may be much higher, as it may not include people who die without testing - e.g. at home, in nursing homes, etc.
targetString: ሳይመረመሩ የሞቱ ለምሳሌ ቤት ዉስጥ፣ በቤተ ለቤት ህኪሚና እና በመሳሰሉት የሞቱትን ሳይካተት በCOVID-19 ምክንያት የሞት ቁጥር ከፍ ሊል ይችላል።
en-mt: The number of deaths due to COVID-19 could be higher without including undiagnosed deaths such as those who died at home, at family doctors, etc.

sourceString: Partial data from Italy found that the number of excess deaths during the pandemic exceeded the official COVID death tally by a factor of 4-5x.
targetString: በጣልያን ያለው ከፊል ውሂብ በአለም አቀፍ ወረርሽኙ ወቅት የነበረው እላፊ የሞት ቁጥር ከCOVID ሞት ይፋዊ ቁጥር ከ 4-5 እጥፍ እንደሚበልጥ ደርሶበታል።
en-mt: Partial data from Italy found that the overall death toll during the global pandemic was 4-5 times higher than the official number of COVID-19 deaths.

sourceString: A spokeswoman for the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) acknowledged "We know that [the stated death toll] is an underestimation", a statement corroborated by anecdotal reports of undercounting in the U.S. Such underestimation often occurs in pandemics, such as the 2009 H1N1 swine flu epidemic.The first confirmed death was in Wuhan on 9 January 2020.
targetString: የዩ.ኤስ የበሽታ ቁጥጥር እና መከላከል ማዕከላት (CDC) ቃል አቀባይ "[የተገለፀው የሞት ቁጥር] ዝቅ ተደርጎ መገመቱን እናውቃለን"፣ በዩ.ኤስ እንደዚህ አይነት ከግምት በታች የሆነ ከቁጥር በታች የሆኑ የተዘበራረቁ ሪፖርቶች መግለጫ በወረርሽኙ ወቅት አልፎ አልፎ ይከሰታል፣ ይህም ልክ በ 2009 እንደተከሰተው H1N1 ስዋይን ፍሉ ስርጭት ላይ እንደሆነው አይነት ነው። በውሃን የተረጋገጠው የመጀመሪያ ሞት ኬዝ የተከሰተው እ.ኤ.አ በጥር 9፣ 2020 ነበር።
en-mt: A spokesman for the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said: "We are aware that [the number of reported deaths] is an underestimate," adding that such underreporting in the US is rare during outbreaks, as was the case in 2009. It's like the H1N1 swine flu is circulating. The first confirmed death by water occurred on January 9, 2020.

sourceString: The first death outside mainland China occurred on 1 February in the Philippines, and the first death outside Asia was in France on 14 February.
targetString: የመጀመሪያው ሞት ከዋናው ምድር ቻይና የተፈጠረው ፊሊፒንስ ውስጥ በ 1 ፌብሩዋሪይ ነው፣ የመጀመሪያው ሞት ከኤዢያ ውጪ ደግሞ ፈረንሳይ ውስጥ ፌብሩዋሪ 14 ላይ ነው።
en-mt: The first death from mainland China occurred in the Philippines on February 1, while the first death outside Asia occurred in France on February 14.

sourceString: By 28 February, outside mainland China, more than a dozen deaths each were recorded in Iran, South Korea, and Italy.
targetString: ልክ ጥር 28 ላይ ከቻይና ዉጪ በኢራን፣ ደቡብ ኮሪያ እና ጣሊያን ዉስጥ ብዙ ሞት ተመዝግቧል።
en-mt: As of January 28, more deaths were recorded outside of China in Iran, South Korea and Italy.

sourceString: By 13 March, more than forty countries and territories had reported deaths, on every continent except Antarctica.Several measures are commonly used to quantify mortality.
targetString: ማርች 13 ላይ፣ በእያንዳንዱ አህጉር ከአንታርቲካ በስተቀር፣ ከአርባ በላይ ሀገሮች እና ግዛቶች ሞት እንዳለ ተናግረዋል። የሞቱን መጠን ለመለካት የተለያዩ እርምጃዎች በጋራ ተወስደዋል።
en-mt: As of March 13, more than forty countries and territories reported deaths on every continent except Antarctica. Various measures have been taken together to measure the death rate.

sourceString: These numbers vary by region and over time, and are influenced by the volume of testing, healthcare system quality, treatment options, time since initial outbreak, and population characteristics such as age, sex, and overall health.The death-to-case ratio reflects the number of deaths divided by the number of diagnosed cases within a given time interval.
targetString: እነዚህ ቁጥሮች በአከባቢ ይለያያሉ፤ ከግዜ በዋል ግን በሚደራገዉ የምርመራ ብዛት፣ በጤና አገልጊሎት ጥራት፣ በህኪምና አመራጮች፣ ወረርሽኙ ከተነሳ ጀምሮ ባለዉ ጊዜ እና የህዝብ በሃሪያት የሆኑ እንደ እድሜ፣ ፆታ እና አጠቃላይ ጤና ባሉ ነገሮች ጫና ይደረግበታል። የሞት እና ኬዝ ሬሽዮ የሚያሳያዉ በተወሰና ግዜ ገደብ ዉስጥ የሞት ቁጥርን ለተያዙት ቁጥር ማካፋል ነዉ።
en-mt: These numbers vary by location; Over time, however, it is pressured by the number of tests conducted, the quality of health care, the choice of doctors, the time since the outbreak began, and demographic factors such as age, gender, and general health. The death and case ratio shows the number of deaths divided by the number of cases within a certain period of time.

sourceString: Based on Johns Hopkins University statistics, the global death-to-case ratio is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) as of 10 April 2020.
targetString: በጆንስ ሆፕኪንስ ዩኒቨርሲቲ ስታትስቲክስ መሰረት፣ እ.ኤ.አ እስከ ሚያዝያ 10፣ 2020 ድረስ ያለው የአለም አቀፍ ኬዝ-ያለው ሞት መጠን 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204) ነው።
en-mt: According to statistics from Johns Hopkins University, the global case-fatality rate as of April 10, 2020 is 6.0% (97,039/1,617,204).

sourceString: The number varies by region.
targetString: ቁጥሩ በየክልሉ ይለያያል።
en-mt: The number varies from region to region.

sourceString: In China, estimates for the death-to-case ratio decreased from 17.3% (for those with symptom onset 1–10 January 2020) to 0.7% (for those with symptom onset after 1 February 2020).Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which reflects the percent of diagnosed people who die from a disease, and the infection fatality rate (IFR), which reflects the percent of infected (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who die from a disease.
targetString: በቻይና፣ በኬዝ-ያለው-ሞት መጠን ከ 17.3% (እ.ኤ.አ ከጥር 1-10፣ 2020 ጀምሮ የበሽታ ምልክት ለታየባቸው) ወደ 0.7% (እ.ኤ.አ ከየካቲት 1፣ 2020 በኋላ የበሽታ ምልክት ለታየባቸው) ቀንሷል። ሌሎች እርምጃዎች የሚያካትቱት የኬዝ ሞት መጠን (CFR) የሚያካትቱ ሲሆን፣ ተመርምረው የነበሩ በበሽታው ህይወታቸው ያለፈ ሰዎች ብዛትን በመቶኛ የሚያሳይ ነው፣ እናም የኢንፌክሽን ሞት መጠን (IFR) ደግሞ በበሽታው ህይወታቸው ያለፈ የተጠቂዎች (የተመረመሩ እና ያልተመረመሩ) ሰዎችን ብዛትን በመቶኛ የሚያሳይ ነው።
en-mt: In China, the case-fatality rate decreased from 17.3% (for those diagnosed from January 1-10, 2020) to 0.7% (for those diagnosed after February 1, 2020). Other measures include the case fatality rate (CFR), which is the percentage of people who have been diagnosed who died of the disease, and the infection case fatality rate (IFR), which is the percentage of infected people (diagnosed and undiagnosed) who have died.

sourceString: These statistics are not timebound and follow a specific population from infection through case resolution.
targetString: እነዚህ አኃዛዊ መረጃዎች በጊዜ የተገደቡ አይደሉም፤ እናም በአንድ የተወሰነ የጉዳይ ሂደት አማካይነት አንድ የተወሰነ ህዝብ በበሽታው ከተያዙ ይከተላሉ።
en-mt: These statistics are not limited by time; And through a specific case process, they follow if a specific population becomes infected.

sourceString: A number of academics have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.
targetString: በርካታ ምሁራን እነዚህን ቁጥሮች ለተወሰኑ የህዝብ ብዛቶች ለማስላት ሞክረዋል።
en-mt: Several scholars have attempted to calculate these numbers for specific populations.

sourceString: The University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine estimates that the infection fatality rate for the pandemic as a whole is between 0.1% and 0.39%.
targetString: የኦክስፎርድ ዩንቨርሲቲ ማስረጃን መሰረት ያደረገው የጤና ማእከል በዚህ ወረርሽኝ ምክንያት የሚከሰተው ሞት ከ 0.1% እስከ 0.39% ሊሆን እንደሚችል ገምቷል።
en-mt: The Oxford University Center for Evidence-Based Health estimates that the death rate from this outbreak could range from 0.1% to 0.39%.

sourceString: The upper estimate of this range is consistent with the results from the first random testing for COVID-19 in Germany, and a statistical study analysing the impact of testing on CFR estimates.
targetString: ለዚህ ሬንጅ ከፊተኛ ግምት መጀመሪያ በጀርመን የ COVID-19 የተደረጋ ምርመራ እና በ CFR ግምት ላይ ያተደረጋ ስታትስቲካዊ ጥናት ጋር የሚሄድ ነዉ።
en-mt: A preliminary estimate for this range is based on a statistical study conducted on the initial diagnosis of COVID-19 in Germany and the CFR estimate.

sourceString: The WHO asserts that the pandemic can be controlled.
targetString: WHO እንዳሳወቀዉ ወረርሽኙ መቆጣጣር የሚቻል ነዉ።
en-mt: According to WHO, the epidemic is manageable.

sourceString: The peak and ultimate duration of the outbreak are uncertain and may differ by location.
targetString: ወረርሽኙ ከፍተኛ ደረጃ ላይ የሚደርስበትን እና ለምን ያህል ጊዜ እንደሚቆይ እርግጠኛ ሆኖ መናገር አስቸጋሪ ከመሆኑ ባሻገር ከቦታ ቦታ ሊለያይ ይችላል።
en-mt: It is difficult to say with certainty when the epidemic will reach its peak and how long it will last, and it can vary from place to place.

sourceString: Maciej Boni of Penn State University stated, "Left unchecked, infectious outbreaks typically plateau and then start to decline when the disease runs out of available hosts.
targetString: የፔን ሰቴት ዩኒvርሲቲዋ ማርሴጅ ፔን እነዳለችዉ “ሳይታይ ይቆይና የኢንፌክሽን ወረርሽኝ ተመሳሳይ ሆኖ ይቆያል። ከዛ በበሽታዉ ከተያዙት ዉስጥ ሲጠፈ እየቀነሰ ይሄዳል።”
en-mt: "It remains invisible and the epidemic remains the same," says Penn State University's Marge Penn. Then, when it disappears from those infected with the disease, it decreases."

sourceString: But it's almost impossible to make any sensible projection right now about when that will be".
targetString: ነገር ግን ይህ መቼ እዉን አንደሚሆን አሁን ላይ ሆኖ መገመት የማይሆን ነዉ”።
en-mt: But it is impossible to imagine when this will happen."

sourceString: The Chinese government's senior medical adviser Zhong Nanshan argued that "it could be over by June" if all countries can be mobilized to follow the WHO's advice on measures to stop the spread of the virus.
targetString: የቻይና መንግስት ከፍተኛ የህክምና አማካሪ የሆኑት ዝሆንግ ናንሻን የቫይረሱን ስርጭት ለመግታት የሚወሰዱ እርምጃዎች በተመለከተ የአለም ጤና ድርጅትን ምክር ለመከተል ሁሉም ሃገራት የሚንቀሳቀሹ ከሆነ "በሰኔ ሊያቆም ይችላል" ሲሉ ይሞግታሉ።
en-mt: Zhong Nanshan, the Chinese government's top medical adviser, argues that if all countries move to follow the World Health Organization's advice on measures to curb the spread of the virus, "it could end in June."

sourceString: On 17 March, Adam Kucharski of the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine stated that SARS-CoV-2 "is going to be circulating, potentially for a year or two".
targetString: በመጋቢት 17፣ ከለንደን የንፅሃና እና የትሮፒካል ህክምና አዳም ኩቻርስኪ SARS-CoV-2 "ለአመት አሊያም ለሁለት አመት ያህል ተደጋጋሚ ይታያል" ብለው ተናግረዋል።
en-mt: On March 17, Adam Kucharski of London's Clinical and Tropical Medicine said that SARS-CoV-2 "appears to recur every year or two."

sourceString: According to the Imperial College study led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be required "until a vaccine becomes available (potentially 18 months or more)".
targetString: በ Neil Ferguson በሚመራው እንደ የኢምፔሪያል ኮሌጅ ጥናት ከሆነ፣ የአካል መራራቅ እና ሌሎች እርምጃዎች ክትባት እስኪገኝ ድረስ (ምናልባት 18 ወራቶች ወይም ከዛ በላይ)"ያስፈልጋሉ።
en-mt: According to Imperial College research led by Neil Ferguson, physical distancing and other measures will be needed until a vaccine is available (perhaps 18 months or more).

sourceString: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University stated, "I think it's unlikely that this coronavirus—because it's so readily transmissible—will disappear completely" and it "might turn into a seasonal disease, making a comeback every year".
targetString: William Schaffner ከ Vanderbilt University “ይህ ኮሮናቫይረስ በቀላሉ ሊተላለፍ የሚችል በመሆኑ ሙሉ በሙሉ ይጠፋል ለማለት ያስቸግራል” እና በየዓመቱ ተመልሶ ሊመጣ እና ወደ ወቅታዊ በሽታ ሊለወጥ ይችላል ብዬ አስባለሁ" ብለው ተናግሯል።
en-mt: William Schaffner of Vanderbilt University said, "It's hard to say that this coronavirus will go away because it's so transmissible, and I think it can come back every year and turn into a seasonal disease."

sourceString: The virulence of the comeback would depend on herd immunity and the extent of mutation.
targetString: የመመለሱ ጉዳት የሚወሰነዉ በጋራ በሚደረግ እሚዩኒቲና በዲኤንኤ ለውጥ መሰረት ነዉ።
en-mt: Rebound damage is determined by shared immunity and DNA changes.

sourceString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can be relatively non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.
targetString: የCOVID-19 በሽታ ምልክቶች በአንፃሩ ልዩ-ያልሆነ እና የተጠቁ ሰዎች የበሽታ ምልክት የማይታይባቸው ሊሆኑ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Symptoms of COVID-19, on the other hand, are non-specific and infected people may be asymptomatic.

sourceString: The two most common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).
targetString: ሁለት የተለመዱ ምልክቶች ትኩሳት (88%) እና ደረቅ ሳል ናቸው (68%)።
en-mt: Two common symptoms are fever (88%) and dry cough (68%).

sourceString: Less common symptoms include fatigue, respiratory sputum production (phlegm), loss of the sense of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, chills, vomiting, hemoptysis, diarrhea, or cyanosis.The WHO states that approximately one person in six becomes seriously ill and has difficulty breathing.
targetString: አነስተኛ የተለመዱ ምልክቶች ድካም፣ የመተንፈሻ አካላት ፈሳሽ መፈጠር (አክታ)፣ የማሽተት ስሜት ማጣት፣ የትንፋሽ ማጠር፣ የጡንቻ እና መጋጠሚያ ህመም፣ የጉሮሮ መቁሰል፣ ራስ ምታት፣ መንቀጥቀጥ፣ ማስመለስ፣ ደም የተቀላቀለበት አጣዳፊ ሳል፣ ተቅማጥ ወይም የቆዳ መበለዝን ያካትታሉ። የአለም ጤና ድርጅት ከስድስት ሰዎች ውስጥ በግምት አንዱ በጠና ሊታመም እና ለመተንፈስ ሊቸገር እንደሚችል ገልጿል።
en-mt: Less common symptoms include fatigue, production of respiratory fluid (sputum), loss of smell, shortness of breath, muscle and joint pain, sore throat, headache, tremors, vomiting, acute cough with blood, diarrhea or skin rash. The World Health Organization states that approximately one in six people will become seriously ill and have difficulty breathing.

sourceString: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists emergency symptoms as difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden confusion, difficulty waking, and bluish face or lips; immediate medical attention is advised if these symptoms are present.Further development of the disease can lead to severe pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, sepsis, septic shock and death.
targetString: የአሜሪካ የበሽታ ቁጥጥር እና መከላከል ማዕከላት (ሲዲሲ) የድንገተኛ ምልክቶች የሚባሉትን እንደ ለመተንፈስ መቸገር፣ የማያቆም የደረት ህመም ወይም ጫና፣ ድንገተኛ ውዝግብ፣ ለመራመድ መቸገር፣ እና የፊት ወይም ከንፈር መበለዝ ዘርዝሯል፤ እነዚህ ምልክቶች ከታዩ በአፋጣኝ የህክምና ትኩረት ማግኘት ይመከራል። ተጨማሪ የበሽታ መስፋፋት ወደ ከፋ ሳንባ ምች፣ ከባድ የመተንፈሻ አካላት ጫና ችግር፣ መበስበስ፣ የመበከል ሁኔታ እና ሞት ያስከትላል።
en-mt: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) lists so-called emergency symptoms as shortness of breath, persistent chest pain or pressure, sudden seizures, difficulty walking, and swelling of the face or lips; Immediate medical attention is recommended if these symptoms occur. Further spread of disease can lead to severe pneumonia, severe respiratory distress syndrome, decompensation, sepsis, and death.

sourceString: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, with no clinical symptoms but with test results that confirm infection, so researchers have issued advice that those with close contact to confirmed infected people should be closely monitored and examined to rule out infection.
targetString: በበሽታው ከተያዙ አንዳንዶቹ ምናልባት ምንም ምልክት የላቸውም፣ ምንም የክሊኒካል ምልክቶች የሌላቸው ነገር ግን የምርመራው ውጤት የተረጋገጠ ኢንፌክሽን የሚያሳይ፣ ከተረጋገጠ ኢንፌክትድ ሰዎች ጋር ግንኙነት ያላቸው ሰዎች ኢንፌክሽኑ እንዲጠፋ በቅርበት ክትትል ሊደረግላቸው እና ሊመረመሩ እንደሚገባ እንዲመከሩ ተመራማሪዎች ሀሳብ ሰጥተዋል።
en-mt: Some of those infected may be asymptomatic, those who have no clinical symptoms but test positive, and who have been in contact with confirmed infected individuals should be closely monitored and tested to rule out the infection, the researchers suggest.

sourceString: Chinese estimates of the asymptomatic ratio range from few to 44%.
targetString: ቻይኖች የምልክት አልባነት ንጽጽርን ከጥቂት እስከ 44% ድረስ ገምተውታል።
en-mt: The Chinese have estimated the symptom-free ratio as low as 44%.

sourceString: The usual incubation period (the time between infection and symptom onset) ranges from one to 14 days; it is most commonly five days.As an example of uncertainty, the estimate of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lost their sense of smell was initially 30% and later fell to 15%.
targetString: የተለመደው የመራቢያ ጊዜ (በኢንፌክሽኑ እና ምልክቱ በሚታይበት መካከል ያለው ጊዜ) ከ አንድ እስከ 14 ቀኖች ክልል ውስጥ ነው፣ አብዛኛውን ጊዜ አምስት ቀናት ነው። እርግጠኛ ያለመሆን ምሳሌ፣ ከ COVID-19 ጋር ያሉ የሰዎች ክፍልፋይ ግምት የማሽተት ስሜታቸውን ያጡት በመጀመሪያ 30% ሲሆን እና በኋላም ደግሞ ወደ 15% ቀነሰ።
en-mt: The normal incubation period (the time between infection and the appearance of symptoms) is in the range of one to 14 days, usually five days. As an example of uncertainty, estimates of the fraction of people with COVID-19 who lose their sense of smell were initially 30% and later declined to 15%.

sourceString: Some details about how the disease is spread are still being determined.
targetString: ቫይረሱ እንዴት እንደሚተላላፍ የተወሰኑ ዝርዘሮች ገና ወደ ፊት የሚገለፅ ነዉ የሚሆነዉ።
en-mt: Some details about how the virus is transmitted are yet to be revealed.

sourceString: The disease is believed to be primarily spread during close contact and by small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking; with close contact being within 1 to 2 metres (3 to 6 feet).
targetString: በሽታው በዋናነት ቅርብ በሆነ ግንኙነት እና በማሳል፣ ማስነጠስ፣ ወይም ማውራት ወቅት በሚፈጠሩ ትናንሽ ጠብታዎች ይተላለፋል፣ የቅርብ ግንኙነት ከ 1-2 ሜትር (ከ 3 እስከ 6 ጫማ) መሆን ነው።
en-mt: The disease is spread mainly by close contact and small droplets produced during coughing, sneezing, or talking, with close contact being 1-2 meters (3 to 6 feet).

sourceString: Studies have found that an uncovered coughing can lead to droplets travelling up to 4.5 metres (15 feet) to 8.2 metres (27 feet).
targetString: ጥናቶች ያልተሸፈነ ሳል ከ 4.5 ሜትሮች (15 ጫማ) እስከ 8.2 ሜትሮች (27 ጫማ) ድረስ የሚጓዙ እርጥበቶችን ሊፈጥር እንደሚችል ማወቅ ችለዋል።
en-mt: Studies have found that an uncovered cough can create plumes that travel 4.5 meters (15 feet) to 8.2 meters (27 feet).

sourceString: Some have proposed that the virus may also be transmitted by small droplets that stay for more prolonged periods in the air, that may be generated during speech.Respiratory droplets may also be produced during breathing out, including when talking, though the virus is not generally airborne.
targetString: ቫይረሱ በንግግር ወቅት ሊፈጠሩ በሚችሉ ጠብታዎች ሊተላለፍ እንደሚችል እና እነዚህም ጠብታዎች አየር ላይ ለረጅም ጊዜ ሊቆይ እንደሚችሉ አንዳንዶች ይደመድማሉ። የመተንፈሻ አካላት ጠብታዎች ማውራትን ጨምሮ በአተነፋፈስ ወቅትም ሊፈጠሩ ይችላሉ፣ ሆኖም ቫይረሱ በአጠቃላይ አየር ወለድ አይደለም።
en-mt: Some have concluded that the virus can be transmitted through droplets created during speech, and that these droplets can remain in the air for long periods of time. Respiratory droplets can also be produced during breathing, including talking, but the virus is generally not airborne.

sourceString: The droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
targetString: በአቅራቢያ ባሉ ሰዎች አፎች ወይም አፍንጫዎች ላይ ሊያርፉ ወይም ወደ ሳንባዎች ሊሳቡ የሚችሉ ይሆናል።
en-mt: They may land on the mouths or noses of nearby people or be drawn into the lungs.

sourceString: Some medical procedures such as intubation and cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) may cause respiratory secretions to be aerosolized and thus result in airborne spread.
targetString: የካርስዮፑልሞነሪ ማገገም (CPR) የመተንፈሻ አካል ቀዶ በአያር ለሚተላለፉ በሽታዎች ሊያጋልጥ ይችላል።
en-mt: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) respiratory surgery can expose you to airborne diseases.

sourceString: It may also spread when one touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.
targetString: የሆነ ሰው የተበከለ ወለል ይህም ቆዳ ጨምሮ ከነኩ በኋላ አይናቸውን፣ አፍንጫቸውን ወይም አፋቸውን ሲነኩም ሊሰራጭ ይችላል።
en-mt: It can spread when someone touches a contaminated surface, including skin, and then touches their eyes, nose, or mouth.

sourceString: While there are concerns it may spread by faeces, this risk is believed to be low.
targetString: በሰገራ አማካይነት ሊተላለፍ ይችላል የሚባለው ስጋት ቢኖርም፣ ይህ ስጋት የመከሰት እድሉ በጣም አነስተኛ ነው።
en-mt: Although there is a risk of faecal transmission, this risk is very unlikely.

sourceString: The Government of China denied the possibility of faecal-oral transmission of SARS-CoV-2.The virus is most contagious during the first three days after onset of symptoms, although spread may be possible before symptoms appear and in later stages of the disease.
targetString: የቻይና መንግስት SARS-CoV-2 አማካነት በአፍ መተላለፉን አስተባብሏል። ቫይረሱ ምልከቱ ታይቶ በመጀመሪያ ሦስት ቀናት በጣም ይተላለፋል ምንም እንኳ ምልክት ሳታይ እና በሽተዉ ከታያ በዋላ መሰራጨት ብችልም ማላት ነዉ።
en-mt: The Chinese government has denied that SARS-CoV-2 was transmitted through oral transmission. The virus is very contagious in the first three days after symptoms appear, even if you don't show symptoms and the smell can spread from person to person.

sourceString: People have tested positive for the disease up to three days before onset of symptoms suggesting transmission is possible before developing significant symptoms.
targetString: ሰዎች ምልክት ማሳየት ከመጀመራቸው ሶስት ቀናት በፊት በሽታው እንዳለባቸው የሚያሳይ ማረጋገጫ የተገኘባቸው ሲሆን ይህም ምልክት ከማሳየት በፊት በሽታው ሊታለፍ እንደሚችል አሳይቷል።
en-mt: People were diagnosed with the disease three days before they started showing symptoms, showing that the disease can be missed before symptoms appear.

sourceString: Only few reports of laboratory-confirmed asymptomatic cases exist, but asymptomatic transmission has been identified by some countries during contact tracing investigations.
targetString: በለቦራቶሪ የተረጋገጠ በጣም ጥቂት የበሽተዉ ስርጭት ዘገባ ነበር፣ ነገር ግን በተመሳሰይ ሁኔታ በሌሎች ሀገራት ኒኪኪ የለቸዉ ስመረመሩ ተመሳሳይ ስርጭት ተገኝቷል።
en-mt: There have been reports of very few laboratory-confirmed outbreaks, but similar outbreaks have been found in other countries that do not have Nikkei.

sourceString: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) states that while it is not entirely clear how easily the disease spreads, one person generally infects two to three others.The virus survives for hours to days on surfaces.
targetString: የአውሮፓ የበሽታ መከላከል እና መቆጣጠር ማዕከል (ECDC) በሽታው እንዴት በቀላሉ እንደተሰራጨ፣ አንድ ግለሰብ ከሁለት እስከ ሶስት ግለሰቦች በሽታውን እንደሚያስተላለፍ ሙሉ በሙሉ ግልፅ እንዳልሆነ አሳውቀዋል። ቫይረሱ በወለሎች ላይ ከሰዓታት እስከ ቀናት ድረስ ሊቆይ ይችላል።
en-mt: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) has informed that it is not completely clear how easily the disease is spread, that one person can transmit the disease from two to three people. The virus can survive on surfaces for hours to days.

sourceString: Specifically, the virus was found to be detectable for up to three days on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, for one day on cardboard, and for up to four hours on copper.
targetString: በተለይ በፕላስቲክ (polypropylene) እና 304 የማይዝግ ብረት ላይ ቫይረሱ እስከ ሶስት ቀናት፣ በኮፐር ላይ እስከ አራት ሰዓታት ሊቆይ ይችላል።
en-mt: Especially on plastic (polypropylene) and 304 stainless steel, the virus can last up to three days, on copper up to four hours.

sourceString: This, however, varies based on the humidity and temperature.Pets and other animals have tested positive for COVID-19.
targetString: ነገር ግን ይሄ አንደ እርጥበት እና ቴምፕሬቸር ላይ ተንተርሶ ይለያያል። የቤት እንስሳትና ሌሎች አንስሳትም COVID-19 ፖዘቲቭ ሆነው ተገኝተዋል።
en-mt: But this varies depending on humidity and temperature. Pets and other animals have also tested positive for COVID-19.

sourceString: There is no evidence animals can pass the virus on to humans, though British authorities advise washing one's hands after contact with animals, like after contact with other surfaces infected people could have touched.
targetString: እንስሳት ቫይረሱን ወደ ሰዎች ማስተላለፍ ይችሉ እንደሆነ የሚያረጋግጥ ማስረጃ የለም፣ ቢሆንም የብሪትሽ ባለስልጣናት፣ ልክ የበሽታው የተጠቃ ሰው የነካውን ወለል ከነኩ በኋላ እንደሚደረገው ከእንስሳት ጋር ከተነካኩ በኋላ እጆቻቸው እንዲታጠቡ ይመክራሉ።
en-mt: There is no evidence that animals can transmit the virus to humans, but British authorities recommend washing hands after touching animals, just as you would after touching a surface touched by an infected person.

sourceString: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a novel virus, first isolated from three people with pneumonia connected to the cluster of acute respiratory illness cases in Wuhan.
targetString: ኮሮናቫይረስ 2 (SARS-CoV-2) የመተንፈሻ አካላት ከባድ በሽታ የኖቭል ቫይረስ ሲሆን፣ በዉሃን ውስጥ ከባድ የመተንፈሻ አካላት ህመም ኬዞች ምድብ ጋር የተገናኘ የሳንባ ምች ካለባቸው ሶስት ሰዎች ላይ መጀመሪያ የተለየ ነው።
en-mt: Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), a novel severe respiratory disease virus, was first isolated from three people with pneumonia associated with a cluster of severe respiratory disease cases in Wuhan.

sourceString: All features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in related coronaviruses in nature.Outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which dissolves its protective envelope.SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.
targetString: የኖቭል ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 ቫይረስ ሁሉም ባህሪያት በተዛማጅ ኮሮናቫይረስ ጋር ተፈጥሮ ውስጥ ይከሰታሉ። ከሰዎች አካል ውጭ፣ ቫይረሱ በቤት ውስጥ ሳሙና ይገደላል፣ ምክንያቱም ሳሙና የቫይረሱን መከላከያ ሽፋን ያስወግዳል። ሳርስ-ኮቭ-2 ከዋናው ሳርስ-ኮቭ ጋር በቅርበት ይዛመዳል።
en-mt: All the features of the novel SARS-CoV-2 virus occur in nature with related coronaviruses. Outside of the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, because soap removes the virus' protective coating. SARS-CoV-2 is closely related to the original SARS-CoV.

sourceString: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.
targetString: ዞኖትክ መነሻ እንዳለዉ ነዉ የሚታሰበዉ።
en-mt: It is thought to have a zoonotic origin.

sourceString: Genetic analysis has revealed that the coronavirus genetically clusters with the genus Betacoronavirus, in subgenus Sarbecovirus (lineage B) together with two bat-derived strains.
targetString: የጄኔትክ ምርመራ እንደሚያሳየዉ ኮሮኖቫይረስ በጄኔትክ ከጂነስ ቤታኮሮኖቫይረስ፣ ንዑስ ጂነስ ሰርቤኮቫይረስ (lineage B) ከሌሎች ከሌልት ዋፍ የተገኙ ሁለት ስትሬኖች ጋር ይመደባል።
en-mt: Genetic testing shows that the coronavirus is genetically classified as belonging to the genus Betacoronavirus, subgenus Cerbecovirus (lineage B), along with two other strains derived from the late wave.

sourceString: It is 96% identical at the whole genome level to other bat coronavirus samples (BatCov RaTG13).
targetString: በሁሉም ጄኖም ደረጃ ከሌላ የሌሊት ወፍ ኮሮኖቫይረስ ናሙና (BatCov RaTG13) በ 96% ይመሳሰላል።
en-mt: It is 96% similar to another bat coronavirus sample (BatCov RaTG13) at the whole genome level.

sourceString: In February 2020, Chinese researchers found that there is only one amino acid difference in certain parts of the genome sequences between the viruses from pangolins and those from humans.
targetString: እ.ኤ.አ የካቲት 2020፣ የቻይና ተመራማሪዎች በፓንጎሊኖች እና በሰዎች ቫይረሶች መካከል ካሉት የጄኖም ቅደም ተከተሎች በአንዳንድ ክፍሎች ውስጥ የአንድ አሚኖ አሲድ ልዩነት ብቻ መኖሩን ደርሰውበታል።
en-mt: In February 2020, Chinese researchers discovered that only one amino acid difference existed in some parts of the genome sequences between pangolins and human viruses.

sourceString: Whole-genome comparison to date has found at most 92% of genetic material shared between pangolin coronavirus and SARS-CoV-2, which is insufficient to prove pangolins to be the intermediate host.
targetString: እስካሁን ያለው መላ-ጂኖም ንፅፅር በፓንጎሊን ኮሮናቫይረስ እና SARS-CoV-2 መካከል ወደ 92% የዘረ-መል ማቴሪያል እንደሚጋሩ ደርሶበታል፣ ይህም ፓንጎሊኖች መካከለኛ ተሸካሚ መሆናቸውን ለማረጋገጥ በቂ ነው።
en-mt: Whole-genome comparisons to date have found that pangolin coronaviruses and SARS-CoV-2 share about 92% of their genetic material, enough to confirm that pangolins are intermediate carriers.

sourceString: Infection by the virus can be provisionally diagnosed on the basis of symptoms, though confirmation is ultimately by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) of infected secretions or CT imaging.
targetString: በቫይረሱ የሚመጣ ኢንፌክሽን በምልክቶቹ መሰረት ሊታከም የሚችል ሲሆን፣ ነገር ግን ማረጋገጫ የሚሆነው በሪቨርስ ትራንስክሪፕሽን ፖሊመራስ ቼን ሪአክሽን (rRT-PCR) ወይም የ CT ምስሎች ነው።
en-mt: A viral infection can be treated based on symptoms, but confirmation is by reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR) or CT imaging.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: PCR ን ከ CT ያወዳደረው ዉሃን ውስጥ የተደረገው ጥናት ያመላከተው CT ከ PCR በላይ የበለጠ ተጋለጭ እንደሆነ ነው፣ ግን ያዉ በመጠኑ ያነሰ ግልፅነት ከሌሎች የሳንባ ነቀርሳዎች እና የበሽታ ሂደቶች ጋር የተመሳሰለ ብዙ የእይታ ባህሪያቱ።
en-mt: A study in Wuhan comparing PCR to CT indicated that CT was more sensitive than PCR, but that it was somewhat less clear for many of the visual features in common with other lung cancers and disease processes.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".
targetString: እስከ መጋቢት 2020 ባለው፣ የአሜሪካ ራዲዮሎጂ ኮሌጅ ሲቲ ለCOVID-19 ምርመራ ለማጣራት ወይም እንደ-መጀመሪያ-መስመር ሙከራ ጥቅም ላይ መዋል እንደሌለበት ይመክራል።
en-mt: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that CT should not be used as a screening or first-line test for the diagnosis of COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO has published several RNA testing protocols for SARS-CoV-2, with the first issued on 17 January.
targetString: የአለም ጤና ድርጅት ለ SARS-CoV-2 ጥናት የተላየዩ የ RNA ምርመራ ሂደት የሚሆን መመሪያ በፈረንጆቹ ጥር 17 የመጀመሪያዉን ዕትም አዉጥቷል።
en-mt: On January 17th, the World Health Organization released the first edition of the guidelines for RNA testing for SARS-CoV-2 research.

sourceString: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).
targetString: ሙከራዉ በእውነተኛ-ጊዜ ተቃራኒ ግልባጭ ፖሊሜሬዝ ሰንሰለት ምላሽን ይጠቀማል (rRT-PCR)።
en-mt: The test uses real-time reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (rRT-PCR).

sourceString: The test can be done on respiratory or blood samples.
targetString: ምርመረዉ በመተንፈሻ አካል ወይም የደም ናሙና ላይ ሊሰራ ይችላል።
en-mt: The test can be done on a breath or blood sample.

sourceString: Results are generally available within a few hours to days.
targetString: ውጤቱ ባጠቃላይ ከጥቂት ሰዓታት እስከ አንድ ቀን ድረስ ይገኛል።
en-mt: Results are generally available within a few hours to a day.

sourceString: Generally this test is carried out on a nasopharyngeal swab though a throat swab may also be used.A number of laboratories and companies are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.
targetString: በአጠቃላይ ምርመራው የሚደረገው የአፍንጫን የውስጥ ክፍል በመጥረግ ሲሆን የጉሮሮ መጥረግ ናሙናም ሊወሰድ ይችላል። ብዙ ቤተ-ሙከራዎች እና ድርጅቶች ሰሮሎጂካል ምርመራዎችን እያዘጋጁ ይገኛሉ፣ እነዚህም አንቲቦዲዎችን የሚለዩ ናቸው።
en-mt: The test is generally done by swabbing the inside of the nose, and a throat swab sample may also be taken. Many laboratories and organizations are developing serological tests, which detect antibodies.

sourceString: As of 6 April 2020, none of these has been proved sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.
targetString: ከ ኤፕሪል 6፣ 2020 ጀምሮ፣ ከእነዚህ ውስጥ አንዳቸውም በስፋት ጥቅም ላይ እንዲውል የጸደቀ በበቂ ሁኔታ ትክክለኛነቱ አልተረጋገጠም።
en-mt: As of April 6, 2020, none of these have been proven sufficiently accurate to be approved for widespread use.

sourceString: In the US a serological test developed by Cellex has been approved for emergency use by certified laboratories only.
targetString: በአሜሪካ ውስጥ በሴልክስ የተገነባው የሲሮሎጂካል ሙከራ ለድንገተኛ አገልግሎት በተረጋገጡ ላቦራቶሪዎች ብቻ ጸድቋል።
en-mt: The serological test developed by Celex in the US is approved for emergency use only by certified laboratories.

sourceString: Characteristic imaging features on radiographs and computed tomography (CT) of people who are symptomatic include asymmetric peripheral ground glass opacities and absent pleural effusions.
targetString: ራዲዮግራፎች እና ስሌት የሚሰራ ቶሞግራፊ (CT) እና ምልክት ያለባቸው ሰዎች ላይ ያለው ባህሪ አንድ አይነት ቅርጽ የሌላቸው የተፈጨ ብርጭቆን የሚያካትትና የሌሉ በጎድን እና ሳምባ መካከል ያለ ፈሳሽ ናቸው።
en-mt: Radiographs and computed tomography (CT) and the characteristic features in people with symptoms include irregular ground-glass masses and fluid between the ribs and lungs.

sourceString: The Italian Radiological Society is compiling an international online database of imaging findings for confirmed cases.
targetString: የጣሊያን ራዲዮሎጂ ማህበረሰብ አለም አቀፍ ኦንላይን የምስል ዳታቤዝን እየሰራ ሲሆን የተረጋገጡ ክስተቶችን የሚያሳይ ነው።
en-mt: The Italian Society of Radiology is developing an international online image database of confirmed cases.

sourceString: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, imaging without confirmation by PCR is of limited specificity in identifying COVID-19.
targetString: እንደ አድኖቫይረስ ካሉ ሌሎች ኢንፌክሽኖች መደራረብ ምክንያት፣ በ PCR ያልተረጋገጠ ምስል COVID-19 ን ለመለየት ውስንነቱ የተገደበ ነው።
en-mt: Due to overlap with other infections such as adenovirus, non-PCR-confirmed imaging is limited in its ability to detect COVID-19.

sourceString: A large study in China compared chest CT results to PCR and demonstrated that though imaging is less specific for the infection, it is faster and more sensitive, suggesting its consideration as a screening tool in epidemic areas.
targetString: በቻይና ውስጥ አንድ ትልቅ ጥናት የደረት CT ውጤት ከ PCR ጋር አነጻጽሩዋል እናም ምንም እንኳን ምስል ለበሽታው አነስተኛ የተለየ ቢያሳይም፣ ፈጣን እና የበለጠ ጥንቃቄ የተሞላበት፣ ወረርሽኝ በሚከሰትባቸው እንደ የማጣሪያ መሳሪያ አድርጎ ከግምት ውስጥ አስገብቶታል።
en-mt: A large study in China compared chest CT results with PCR and considered it a faster and more sensitive screening tool in outbreaks, even though imaging showed less specificity for the disease.

sourceString: Artificial intelligence-based convolutional neural networks have been developed to detect imaging features of the virus with both radiographs and CT.
targetString: አርቴፊሻል ኢንተለጀንስ (ሰው ሰራሽ አስተውሎት) -ተኮር ትስስራዊ ኒውራል ኔትዎርኮች የቫይረሱ የሚታዩ ይዘቶችን በራዲዮግራፎች እና ሲቲ ለማግኘት ተሰርተዋል።
en-mt: Artificial intelligence-based neural networks have been developed to detect the visible contents of the virus on radiographs and CT.

sourceString: Strategies for preventing transmission of the disease include maintaining overall good personal hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing or sneezing into a tissue and putting the tissue directly into a waste container.
targetString: አጠቃላይ ጥሩ ንፅህና ማስጠበቅ፣ እጆችን መታጠብ፣ ባልታጠቡ እጆች አይኖችን፣ አፍንጫን ወይም አፍን ከመንካት መቆጠብ እና በሶፍት ላይ ማሳል እና ማስነጠስ እናም ሶፍቱን በቆሻሻ ማጠራቀሚያ ውስጥ በቀጥታ መጣል ጨምሮ የበሽታውን መተላለፍ የሚረዱ ስልቶች።
en-mt: Strategies to help prevent disease transmission include maintaining good general hygiene, washing hands, avoiding touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands, and coughing and sneezing into a soft tissue and disposing of soft tissue directly in the trash.

sourceString: Those who may already have the infection have been advised to wear a surgical mask in public.
targetString: ቀድሞውኑ የተጠቁ ሰዎች ህዝብ ወዳለበት ቦታ ከመሄዳቸው በፊት የሰርጂካል ጭምበል እንዲያደርጉ ይመከራሉ።
en-mt: People who have already been infected are advised to wear a surgical mask before going to public places.

sourceString: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent transmission.Many governments have restricted or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries and areas affected by the outbreak.
targetString: የአካላዊ መራራቅ እርምጃዎችም የበሽታን መተላለፍ ለመከላከል ይመከራሉ። በርካታ መንግስታት ከ እና ወደ ሃገራት ስርጭቱ ወሰተስፋፋባቸው ሃገራት የሚደረጉ ሁሉንም አላስፈላጊ ጉዞዎችን አግደዋል ወይም እንዳይደረጉ መክረዋል።
en-mt: Physical distancing measures are also recommended to prevent the spread of disease. Many governments have banned or advised against all non-essential travel to and from countries where the virus has spread.

sourceString: However, the virus has reached the stage of community spread in large parts of the world.
targetString: ሆኖም ግን፣ ቫይረሱ በብዙ የዓለም ክፍሎች ውስጥ በማህበረሰብ ውስጥ ወደ ሚሰራጭበት ደረጃ ደርሷል።
en-mt: However, the virus has reached the point where it is spreading in communities in many parts of the world.

sourceString: This means that the virus is spreading within communities, and some community members don't know where or how they were infected.Health care providers taking care of someone who may be infected are recommended to use standard precautions, contact precautions, and eye protection.Contact tracing is an important method for health authorities to determine the source of an infection and to prevent further transmission.
targetString: ይህ ማለት ቫይረሱ በማህበረሰቡ ውስጥ እየተሰራጨ ነው፤ አንዳንድ የማህበረሰቡ አባላት በበሽታው የት እና እንዴት እንደተያዙ አያውቁም። በበሽታው ሊጋለጥ የሚችለውን ማህበረሰብ የሚነከባከቡ የጤና ተንከባካቢዎች መደበኛና ደረጃዊን የጠበቀ ቅድመ ጥንቃቄ፣ የንክኪ ጥንቃቄ እንዲያደርጉና አይናቸውን እንዲጠብቁ ይመከራሉ። በበሽታው ከተያዘው ሰው ጋር አካላዊ ንክኪ መኖር አለመኖርን መፈተሸ ፣ ማረጋገገጥ ለጤና ባለስልጣናት የበሽታውን ምንጭ ለማወቅ እና በሽታው እንዳይተላለፍ ለመከላከል በጣም ጠቃሚ ዘዴ ነው።
en-mt: This means the virus is spreading in the community. Some members of the community do not know where or how they contracted the disease. Health care workers who care for the community who may be exposed to the disease are advised to take regular and standardized precautions, avoid contact and protect their eyes. Checking and verifying the absence of physical contact with an infected person is a very important method for health authorities to determine the source of the disease and prevent the spread of the disease.

sourceString: The use of location data from mobile phones by governments for this purpose has prompted privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and over 100 other organizations issuing a statement calling for limits on this kind of surveillance.
targetString: በመንግስት በተንቀሳቃሽ ስልኮች የአካባቢ መረጃ ለዚህ አላማ መጠቀም የግለሰባዊ ስጋቶች አስከትሏል፣ Amnesty International እና ከ 100 በላይ ድርጅቶች ጋር በእንደዚህ አይነቱ የስለላ ክትትል ላይ ገደቦቸን የሚሰጥ ጥሪ አቅርበዋል።
en-mt: The government's use of mobile phone location data for this purpose has raised privacy concerns, with Amnesty International and more than 100 organizations calling for limits on such surveillance.

sourceString: Various mobile apps have been implemented or proposed for voluntary use, and as of April 7, 2020, over a dozen expert groups were working on privacy-friendly solutions, such as using Bluetooth to log a user's proximity to other cellphones.
targetString: ብዙ የሞባይል አፕሊኬሽኖች ፊላጎት ላይ በተመረተ ጥቅም ላይ እንድዉል ቀርበዋል፤ በሚያዚያ 7፣ 2020 ብዙ ባለሞያዎች ሲጠብቁ እንደነ ብሉቱዝን በቅርባት በመጠቀም ሌላ ስለክን ማግኘት ነዉ።
en-mt: Many mobile applications are available for use on Philagot. April 7, 2020 Many experts have been waiting for the next step in using Bluetooth proximity.

sourceString: Users then receive a message if they've been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19.Misconceptions are circulating about how to prevent infection; for example, rinsing the nose and gargling with mouthwash are not effective.
targetString: ተጠቃሚዎች ለ COVID-19 አዎንታዊ ምርመራ ከተደረገለት ሰው ጋር ተቀራርቦ ቆይተው ከሆነ መልዕክት ይደርሳቸዋል። ኢንፌክሽኖችን እንዴት መከላከል እንደሚቻል የተሳሳቱ አመለካከቶች እየተሰራጩ ነው፣ ለምሳሌ፣ አፍንጫን ማጠብ እና በአፍ ማጽጃ መታጠብ ውጤታማ አይደለም።
en-mt: Users will receive a message if they have been in close contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19. Misconceptions about how to prevent infections are being spread, for example, nasal irrigation and mouthwash are not effective.

sourceString: There is no COVID-19 vaccine, though many organizations are working to develop one.
targetString: ብዙ ድርጅቶች ለመፍጠር እየሰሩ ቢሆንም እንኳን ለ COVID-19 የተገኘ ምንም አይነት ክትባት የለም።
en-mt: There is no vaccine available for COVID-19, even though many organizations are working to create one.

sourceString: Hand washing is recommended to prevent the spread of the disease.
targetString: እጅ መታጠብ የበሽታውን ስርጭት ለመቀነስ ይመከራል።
en-mt: Hand washing is recommended to reduce the spread of disease.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that people wash hands often with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after going to the toilet or when hands are visibly dirty; before eating; and after blowing one's nose, coughing, or sneezing.
targetString: ቢያንስ ለሃያ ሰከንዶች ያህል ሰዎች እጃቸውን በሳሙና እና በውሃ እንዲያጥቡት CDC ይመክራል፣ በተለይም ወደ መጸዳጃ ቤት ከሄዱ በኋላ ወይም እጆች በግልጽ ሲቆሽሹ፤ ከመብላት በፊት፤ እና አፍንጫን ከነካኩ፣ ካሳሉ፣ ወይም ካስነጠሱ በኋላ።
en-mt: The CDC recommends that people wash their hands with soap and water for at least twenty seconds, especially after using the bathroom or when hands are visibly soiled; Before eating And after you touch your nose, cough, or sneeze.

sourceString: This is because outside the human body, the virus is killed by household soap, which bursts its protective bubble.
targetString: ይህ የሆነበት ምክንያት በሳሙና በመታጠብ ቫይረሱ ከሰውነት አካል ውጭ ስለሚሞት ነው።
en-mt: This is because washing with soap kills the virus outside the body.

sourceString: CDC further recommended using an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol by volume when soap and water are not readily available.
targetString: ሳሙና እና ውሃ በማይገኝበት ቦታ 60% አልኮል የሆነ አልኮል ነክ የእጅ ሳኒታይዘር መጠቀምን CDC መክሯል።
en-mt: The CDC recommends using 60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer where soap and water are not available.

sourceString: The WHO advises people to avoid touching the eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.
targetString: WHO ሰዎች አይናቸውን፣ አፍንጫቸውን ወይም አፋቸውን ባልታጠበ እጅ እንዳይነኩ ይመክራል።
en-mt: WHO advises people not to touch their eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.

sourceString: Surfaces may be decontaminated with a number of solutions (within one minute of exposure to the disinfectant for a stainless steel surface), including 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% isopropanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.
targetString: ገጽታዎች በበርካታ መፍትሄዎች (ለአይዝጌ ብረት የተሰራው ማፅጃ በአንድ ደቂቃ ውስጥ)፣ ከ 62–71% ኢታኖል፣ 50–100% ፕሮፖፔልol፣ 0.1% ሶድየም ሃይፖክሎራይድ፣ 0.5% ሃይድሮጂን ፔሮክሳይድ፣ እና 0.2–“7.5% ፖቪዶን-አዮዲን ሊፀዱ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Surfaces can be cleaned in several solutions (1 minute for stainless steel cleaner), 62–71% ethanol, 50–100% propanol, 0.1% sodium hypochlorite, 0.5% hydrogen peroxide, and 0.2–7.5% povidone-iodine.

sourceString: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and chrohexidine gluconate, are less effective.
targetString: ሌላ መፍትሄዎች፣ እንደ ቤንዛልኮኒየም ክሎራይድ እና ክሮሄክሳይዲን ግሉኮኔት አይነቶቹ፣ ውጤታማነታቸው የቀነሰ ነው።
en-mt: Other solutions, such as benzalkonium chloride and crohexidine gluconate, are less effective.

sourceString: The CDC recommends that if a COVID case is suspected or confirmed at a facility such as an office or day care, all areas such as offices, bathrooms, common areas, shared electronic equipment like tablets, touch screens, keyboards, remote controls, and ATM machines used by the ill persons, should be disinfected.
targetString: CDC እንደሚመክረው፣ የ COVID በሽታ በአገልግሎት መስጫ አከባቢ፤ ቢሮ ወይም የሕጻናት መዋያ በመሳሰሉ ቦታዎች የሚጠረጠር ወይም የሚረጋገጥ ሲሆን፣ መታጠብያ፣ የጋራ መገልገያ አከባቢ እና የጋራ የኤሌክትሪክ መጠቀሚያ ቦታዎች፣ ጠረጴዛ፣ የጋራ ኮምፒዩተር፣ ATM፣ እና የመሳሰሉትን አከባቢዎች ቫይረሱን በሚያጠፋ መድሃኒት ማጽዳት ያስፈልጋል።
en-mt: As the CDC recommends, COVID disease in a service setting; When it is suspected or confirmed in places such as an office or a nursery, washrooms, common utility areas and common electrical areas, tables, common computers, ATMs, etc., need to be cleaned with disinfectants.

sourceString: Health organizations recommended that people cover their mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue when coughing or sneezing, and disposing of any tissue immediately.
targetString: የጤና ድርጅቶች ሰዎች በሚስሉበት ወይም በሚያስነጥሱበት ጊዜ አፋቸውን እና አፍንጫቸውን በታጠፈ ክንድ ወይም በመሃረብ እንዲሸፍኑ እና ማንኛውንም መሃረብ ወዲያውኑ እንዲጣል መክረዋል።
en-mt: Health organizations recommend that people cover their mouths and noses with a folded arm or handkerchief when coughing or sneezing, and discard any handkerchiefs immediately.

sourceString: Surgical masks are recommended for those who may be infected, as wearing a mask can limit the volume and travel distance of expiratory droplets dispersed when talking, sneezing, and coughing.
targetString: የሰርጂካል መስክ ማድረግ የሚመከራዉ ለተጠቁ ሰዎች ብቻ ነዉ የሚመከረዉ። ምክኒያቱም ቫይረሱ ብዙ ተጉዞ እንዳይሰራጭ እና ሰዉ ሲያወራ፣ ስያስነጥስ እና ሲየስል የቫይረሱን ስሪጭት ስለሚገድብ ነዉ።
en-mt: Surgical excision is recommended only for affected individuals. The reason is that the virus does not travel a lot and it limits the spread of the virus when a person talks, sneezes and coughs.

sourceString: The WHO has issued instructions on when and how to use masks.
targetString: የአለም ጤና ድርጅት ጭምብሎችን መቼ እና እንዴት መጠቀም እንደሚገባ መመሪያዎችን ሰጥቷል።
en-mt: The World Health Organization has issued guidelines on when and how to use masks.

sourceString: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at the University of Leeds, "Wearing a mask can reduce the propensity [of] people to touch their faces, which is a major source of infection without proper hand hygiene."Masks have also been recommended for use by those taking care of someone who may have the disease.
targetString: በሊግስ ዩኒቨርስቲ ቫይሮሎጂስት በሆኑት በስቴፈን ግሪፊን መሰረት፣ "ጨምብል/ማስክ ማድረግ ሰዎች ፊታቸውን [የ] መንካት ሁኔታ እንዲቀንስ ሊያደርግ እንደሚችል፣ ይህም ደግሞ በሚገባ ባልታጠበ እጅ ሊፈጠር የሚችል ዋና የኢንፌክሽን ምንጭን ያስቀራል።" ማስኮች/ጭምብሎች በሽታው ሊኖርባቸው የሚችሉ ሰዎች ወደ ሌላ ሰው እንዳያዘምዱም ሊያደርጉም ይችላሉ።
en-mt: According to Stephen Griffin, a virologist at League University, "Wearing a mask can reduce people's ability to touch their face, which eliminates a major source of infection that can occur from poorly washed hands." Masks can also prevent people who may have the disease from spreading it to others.

sourceString: The WHO has recommended the wearing of masks by healthy people only if they are at high risk, such as those who are caring for a person with COVID-19, although they also acknowledge that wearing masks may help people avoid touching their face.
targetString: ጤናማ ሰዎች የፊት እና አፍጫ መሸፈኛን ማድረግ የለባቸዉ በCOVID-19 ለተያዙት ድገፍ ከሚያደርጉት ሰዎች ጋር ኒኪኪ ካለቸዉ እና ጋላጥ ከሆኑ ብቻ ስሆን ነዉ ብሎ አ.ጤ.ድ ይመክረሉ ምንም እንኳ የፊት እና አፍንጫ መሸፈኛን ማድረግ ጥሩ እንደሆና እነርሱም ቢገነዘቡም ማለት ነዉ።
en-mt: Healthy people should wear a face and nose cover only when they are in contact with people who are infected with COVID-19 and are gay, even if they understand that it is good to wear a face and nose cover.

sourceString: Several countries have started to encourage the use of face masks by members of the public.
targetString: በርካታ አገራት የህዝባቸውን አባላት የፊት ጭንብል መጠቀምን ማበረታታት ጀምረዋል።
en-mt: Many countries have started encouraging members of the public to wear face masks.

sourceString: In the U.S., the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face mask made out of cloth.China has specifically recommended the use of disposable medical masks by healthy members of the public, particularly when coming into close contact (1 metre (3 ft) or less) with other people.
targetString: በዩናይትድ ስቴትስ ውስጥ፣ CDC የሚሰጠው ምክረ ሃሳብ ከጨርቅ የተሰሩ ለሕክምና አገልግሎት የማይውሉ የፊት ማስኮችን ማድረግን ነው። ቻይና ደግሞ ጤናማ የሆነው የማህበረሰብ ክፍል በተለይም ከሌሎች ሰዎች ጋር የቅርብ ንክኪ በሚኖራቸው ወቅት (1 ሜትር (3 ጫማ) ወይም ያነሰ) ለአንዴ አገልግሎት የሚውሉ የሕክምና ማስኮችን መጠቀምን ትመክራለች።
en-mt: In the United States, the CDC recommends wearing non-medical face masks made of cloth. China also recommends the use of disposable medical masks by the healthy part of the community, especially during close contact with other people (1 meter (3 feet) or less).

sourceString: Hong Kong recommends wearing a surgical mask when taking public transport or staying in crowded places.
targetString: የህዝብ ትራንስፖርት ሲጠቀሙ ወይም በተጨናነቁ ቦታዎች በሚቆዩበት ወቅት የሰርጂካል ማስክ እንዲደረግ ይመክራል።
en-mt: It recommends wearing a surgical mask when using public transport or staying in crowded places.

sourceString: Thailand's health officials are encouraging people to make cloth facemasks at home and wash them daily.
targetString: የታይላንድ የጤና መኮንኖች ሰዎች ከልብስ የሚሰሩ የፊት ጭምብሎችን እንዲያደርጉና በየቀኑ እንዲያጥቧቸው እያበረታቱ ነው።
en-mt: Thai health officials are encouraging people to wear face masks made of cloth and wash them daily.

sourceString: The Czech Republic and Slovakia banned going out in public without wearing a mask or covering one's nose and mouth.
targetString: ቼክ ሪፐብሊክ እና ስሎቫኪያ ጭምብል ሳይለብሱ ወይም አፍንጫን እና አፍን ሳይሸፍኑ ወደ አደባባይ መውጣትን ከልክለዋል።
en-mt: The Czech Republic and Slovakia have banned going out without wearing a mask or covering the nose and mouth.

sourceString: On 16 March, Vietnam requested everyone to wear a face mask when going to public areas in order to protect themselves and others.
targetString: በመጋቢት 16፣ ቬትናም ማንኛውም ዜጋ ከቤት ወደ ህዝባዊ ቦታዎች ሲወጣ የፊት መሸፈኛ ጭምብል በመልበስ እራሳቸውንና ሌሎችን እንዲጠብቁ አዝዛለች።
en-mt: On March 16, Vietnam ordered all citizens to protect themselves and others by wearing a face covering mask when going out of the house to public places.

sourceString: The Austrian government mandated that everyone entering a grocery store must wear a face mask.
targetString: የኦስትሪያ መንግስት ማንኛውም ግሮሰሪ መደብር ውስጥ የሚገባ ሰው የፊት ጭምብል እንዲያደርግ አስገድዷል።
en-mt: The Austrian government has made it mandatory for anyone entering a grocery store to wear a face mask.

sourceString: Israel has asked all residents to wear face masks when in public.
targetString: እስራኤል ሁሉም ዜጎቿ ዉጪ ሲወጡ የአፍ እና አፊንጫ መሸፈኛ እንዲያደረጉ ጠይቃለች።
en-mt: Israel requires all its citizens to wear face and nose coverings when going out.

sourceString: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks per day since mid-March, required passengers on trains and intercity buses to wear face masks on 1 April.
targetString: ታይዋን፣ ከማርች ግማሽ አመት ጀምሮ በቀን አስር ሚሊየን ጭንብሎችን እያመረተች ስትገኝ፣ የባቡር ተሳፋሪዎችን እና የከተማ አውቶቢሶች ሚጠቀሙትን ከ ኤፕሪል 1 ጀምሮ የፊት ጭንብሎችን እንዲያደርጉ አዛለች።
en-mt: Taiwan, which has been producing ten million masks a day since the March half-year, ordered train passengers and city buses to wear face masks from April 1.

sourceString: Panama has made it obligatory to wear a face mask whenever going outside, while also recommending the manufacture of a homemade face mask for those who cannot purchase face masks.
targetString: ፓናማ ወደ ውጪ የሚወጡ ሰዎች በሙሉ የፊት ጭምብል እንዲያደርጉ የምታስገድድ ሲሆን፣ የፊት ጭምብል መግዛት ለማይችሉ ሰዎች ደግሞ ቤት ውስጥ የሚሰራውን እንዲያደርጉ ስታበረታታ ነበር።
en-mt: Panama has made it mandatory for all people going out to wear face masks, and for those who can't afford one, it has been encouraging them to do so at home.

sourceString: Face masks have also been widely used in Japan, South Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.
targetString: የፊት ጭንብሎችም በጃፓን፣ ሰሜን ኮሪያ፣ ማሌዢያ፣ እና ሲንጋፖር ውስጥ በስፋት ተደርገዋል።
en-mt: Face masks are also widely used in Japan, North Korea, Malaysia, and Singapore.

sourceString: Social distancing (also known as physical distancing) includes infection control actions intended to slow the spread of disease by minimizing close contact between individuals.
targetString: ማህበራዊ መራራቅ ወይም (አካላዊ መራራቅ በመባል የሚታወቀዉ) የበሽታው መስፋፍያ ሁኔታዎችን መጠበቅን የሚያካትት ሲሆን በግለቦች መካከል ያለውን ንክኪ በመቀነስ የበሽታውን ስርጭት ይቀንሳል።
en-mt: Social distancing or (also known as physical distancing) involves maintaining conditions for the spread of disease and reduces the spread of disease by reducing contact between people.

sourceString: Methods include quarantines; travel restrictions; and the closing of schools, workplaces, stadiums, theatres, or shopping centres.
targetString: ዘዴዎቹ የሚያካትቱት ለይቶ ማቆያ፤ የጉዞ እገዳ፤ ትምህርት ቤቶችን፣ ስራ ቦታ፣ ስቴዲዬሞች፣ ትያትር ቤቶች እና የግብይት ማዕከላትን መዝጋት ነዉ።
en-mt: Methods include quarantine; travel ban; Closing schools, workplaces, stadiums, theaters and shopping malls.

sourceString: Individuals may apply social distancing methods by staying at home, limiting travel, avoiding crowded areas, using no-contact greetings, and physically distancing themselves from others.
targetString: ግለሰቦች የማህበራዊ ርቀት መጠበቂያ መንገዶችን ለመተግበር የሚችሉት ቤት በመቀመጥ፣ ጉዞን በመገደብ፣ ሰዉ የሚበዛበት ቦታ ባለመሄድ፣ ሳይነካኩ ሰላም በመባባል፣ ራሳቸዉን ከሌሎች በአካል በመራቅ ነዉ።
en-mt: Individuals can practice social distancing by staying at home, limiting travel, not going to crowded places, saying hello without touching, and physically distancing themselves from others.

sourceString: Many governments are now mandating or recommending social distancing in regions affected by the outbreak.
targetString: ብዙ መንግስታት በአሁኑ ወቅት በወረርሽኙ የተጠቁን ግዛቶች ውስጥ የማህበረሰብ መራራቅን እየመከሩ እና እንደ ግዴታ እያስደረጉት ነው።
en-mt: Many governments are currently recommending and mandating social distancing in affected states.

sourceString: The maximum gathering size recommended by US government bodies and health organizations was swiftly reduced from 250 people (if there was no known COVID-19 spread in a region) to 50 people, and later to 10 people.
targetString: በዩናይትድ ስቴትስ መንግስት አካል እና ጤና ድርጅት የሚመከረው አንድ ላይ የመሰብሰብ ቁጥር ከ 250 እንዲወርድ የተደረገ ሲሆን (ምንም አይነት የሚታወቅ የ COVID-19 ምልክት የሌለ ከሆነ ሲሆን) ወደ 50 እንዲወርድ የተደረገ ሲሆን ከዚያም ወደ 10 ሰዎች ወርዷል።
en-mt: The number of gatherings recommended by the United States government and the World Health Organization has been lowered from 250 (if there are no known symptoms of COVID-19) to 50, and then to 10 people.

sourceString: On 22 March 2020, Germany banned public gatherings of more than two people.Older adults and those with underlying medical conditions such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, hypertension, and compromised immune systems face increased risk of serious illness and complications and have been advised by the CDC to stay home as much as possible in areas of community outbreak.In late March 2020, the WHO and other health bodies began to replace the use of the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing", to clarify that the aim is to reduce physical contact while maintaining social connections, either virtually or at a distance.
targetString: መጋቢት 22፣ 2020 እለት ጀርመን ማንም ሰዉ ከሁለት በላይ ሆኖ ዉጭ እንዳይገናኝ ክልከላ ጥላለች። በዕድሜ የገፉ እና የህኪሚናን ሁኔታን የሚከታተሉ ይህ ማለት ስኳር በሽታ፣ የልብ በሽታ፣ የመተንፈሻ አካለት በሽታ፣ ደም ብዛት፣ በሽታን የመከላከል አቅማቸዉ ደካማ የሆኑ እና ለከባድ ህመም እና ሌሎች ዉስበስብ ነገሮች የተጋለጡ ሰዎች በተቻለ መጠን ወረርሽኙ በተከሰተባት አካባቢ ከቤት እንደይወጡ የCDC ምክረ ሐሳብ ነዉ። በማርች ወር መጨረሻ አካባቢ፣ WHO እና ሌሎች የጤና ድርጅቶች "ማህበራዊ መራራቅ" የሚለውን ቃል በ "አካላዊ መራራቅ" መተካት የጀመሩ ሲሆን፣ የዚህም ምክንያት አላማው ማህበራዊ ትስስሮችን በኢንተርኔት ወይም በርቀት በማስጠበቅ አካላዊ ንክኪን መቀነስ ስለሆነ ነው።
en-mt: On March 22, 2020, Germany banned more than two people from meeting outside. The CDC recommends that the elderly and those with medical conditions, such as diabetes, heart disease, respiratory disease, high blood pressure, weakened immune systems, and those who are at risk of serious illness and other complications, stay out of the affected area as much as possible. In late March, the WHO and other health organizations began replacing the term "social distancing" with "physical distancing," because the goal is to reduce physical contact by maintaining social connections online or remotely.

sourceString: The use of the term "social distancing" had led to implications that people should engage in complete social isolation, rather than encouraging them to stay in contact with others through alternative means.Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the pandemic.
targetString: ማህበራዊ መራራቅ የሚለው ቃል አጠቃቀም በተሟላ የማህበራዊ ንጠላ ውስጥ መሳተፍ ያለባቸው ሰዎችን ያመለክታል፣ ከሌሎች ጋር ግንኙነታቸውን እንዲቀጥሉ ከመምከር ይልቅ በአማራጭ መንገዶች በኩል እንዲሆን። አንዳንድ ባለስልጣናት በአለም አቀፍ ወረርሽኝ ወቅት ጥቅም ላይ የሚውሉ የወሲባዊ ጤና መመሪያዎችን ሰጥተዋል።
en-mt: The use of the term social distancing refers to people who must engage in complete social isolation, rather than recommending that they continue to interact with others through alternative means. Some authorities have issued sexual health guidelines for use during the global pandemic.

sourceString: These include recommendations to only have sex with someone you live with, who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.
targetString: እነዚህም አብረው ከሚኖሩትና ቫይረሱ ወይም የቫይረሱ ምልክቶች ከሌሉበት ሰው ጋር ብቻ ወሲብ እዲፈፅሙ መምከርን ያካትታል።
en-mt: These include recommending that you only have sex with someone you live with who does not have the virus or symptoms of the virus.

sourceString: Self-isolation at home has been recommended for those diagnosed with COVID-19 and those who suspect they have been infected.
targetString: በበሽታው እንደተያዙ የተጠረጠሩ እና በ COVID-19 ለተያዙ ሰዎች ራስን አግልሎ በቤት መቀመጥ ይመከራል።
en-mt: Self-isolation at home is recommended for people who are suspected of being infected and have been diagnosed with COVID-19.

sourceString: Health agencies have issued detailed instructions for proper self-isolation.Many governments have mandated or recommended self-quarantine for entire populations living in affected areas.
targetString: የጤና ኤጄንሲዎች ዝርዝር የሆኑ ራስን ለይቶ የማስቀመጥ መመሪያዎችን አቅርበዋል። ብዙ መንግስታት ቫይረሱ በተከሰተበት ስፍራ ያሉ ሰዎች ራሳቸውን ለይተው እንዲቀመጡ ይመክራሉ።
en-mt: Health agencies have provided detailed self-isolation guidelines. Many governments are recommending that people in areas where the virus has spread self-quarantine.

sourceString: The strongest self-quarantine instructions have been issued to those in high risk groups.
targetString: ጠንካራ የራስ-ለይቶ ማቆያ መመሪያዎች በከፍተኛ ስጋት ቡድኖች ውስጥ ላሉት ተሰጥቷል።
en-mt: Strong self-isolation guidelines are given to those in high-risk groups.

sourceString: Those who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently travelled to a country or region with widespread transmission have been advised to self-quarantine for 14 days from the time of last possible exposure.
targetString: COVID-19 ካለበት የሆነ ሰው ጋር ተጋላጭ ሊሆኑ የሚችሉ ሰዎች እና ቫይረሱ ወደተስፋፋበት ሃገር ወይም ክልል በቅርብ ተጉዘው የነበሩት ተጋለጭ ከሆኑበት የመጨረሻ ቀን ጀምሮ ለ 14 ቀናት በራስ-ለይቶ ማቆያ እንዲቆዩ ይመከራሉ።
en-mt: People who may have been exposed to someone with COVID-19 and those who have recently traveled to a country or region where the virus is endemic are advised to self-isolate for 14 days from the last day of exposure.

sourceString: Strategies in the control of an outbreak are containment or suppression, and mitigation.
targetString: ስርጭቱን ለመቆጣጠር የሚውሉ ስልቶች ማገድ ወይም መከልከል እና መቀነስ ናቸው።
en-mt: Strategies to control the spread are containment or containment and mitigation.

sourceString: Containment is undertaken in the early stages of the outbreak and aims to trace and isolate those infected as well as introduce other measures of infection control and vaccinations to stop the disease from spreading to the rest of the population.
targetString: እንቅስቃሴን ማገድ በወረርሽኙ የመጀመሪያ ክፍሎች ላይ የሚደረግ ሲሆን አላማውም የተበከሉትን ሰዎች በክትትል ለማወቅ እና ለይቶ ለማቆየት እንዲሁም በቀሪው ህብረተሰብ ላይ ያለውን ስርጭት ለመቀነስ ይቻል ዘንድ የኢንፌክሽን ቁጥጥር ሌሎች አዳዲስ መንገዶችን ለማስተዋወቅ ነው።
en-mt: Movement restrictions are applied in the early stages of an outbreak and aim to introduce new methods of infection control in order to identify and isolate infected people through surveillance and to minimize transmission to the rest of the population.

sourceString: When it is no longer possible to contain the spread of the disease, efforts then move to the mitigation stage: measures are taken to slow the spread and mitigate its effects on the healthcare system and society.
targetString: የበሽታውን መስፋፋት ከዚህ በላይ መግታት ካልተቻለ፣ ሙከራዎች ከዛ ወደ መቋቋም ደረጃ ይወሰዳሉ፡ መስፋፋቱን ለመቀነስ እና የጤና እንክብካቤ ስርአት እና ማህበረሰቡ ላይ ያለውን ውጤቶች ለመቋቋም እርምጃዎች ይወሰዳሉ።
en-mt: If the spread of the disease can no longer be contained, efforts are then moved to the containment phase: measures are taken to slow the spread and deal with the effects on the health care system and the community.

sourceString: A combination of both containment and mitigation measures may be undertaken at the same time.
targetString: የመያዝ እና የመቋቋም ጣምራ እርምጃዎች በአንድ ላይ ሊወሰድ ይችላል።
en-mt: A combination of containment and resistance measures can be taken together.

sourceString: Suppression requires more extreme measures so as to reverse the pandemic by reducing the basic reproduction number to less than 1.Part of managing an infectious disease outbreak is trying to decrease the epidemic peak, known as flattening the epidemic curve.
targetString: መሰረታዊ የመራቢያ ቁጥርን ከ 1 በታች በመቀነስ አለም አቀፍ ወረርሽኙን ለመለወጥ የበለጠ ከባድ እርምጃዎችን ይፈልጋል። የተላላፊ በሽታ ወረርሽኝ መቆጣጠር አንዱ ክፍል የወረርሽኝ አካሄድ በመባል የሚታወቀውን የወረርሽኙን ስርጭት መቀነስ በመጠቀም የበሽታውን ወረርሽኝ ለመቀነስ መሞከር ነው።
en-mt: It requires more drastic measures to reverse the global epidemic by reducing the basic reproductive number below 1. Part of controlling an infectious disease outbreak is trying to reduce the outbreak of the disease by using a method known as the epidemiologic approach.

sourceString: This decreases the risk of health services being overwhelmed and provides more time for vaccines and treatments to be developed.
targetString: ይህም የጤና አገልግሎት መስጫዎች ከአቅም በላይ እንዳይጨናነቁ በማድረግ ክትባትና ህክምናዎች ለማዘጋጀት ተጨማሪ ጊዜ ይሰጣል።
en-mt: This will ensure that health services are not overcrowded and provide more time to prepare vaccines and treatments.

sourceString: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that may manage the outbreak include personal preventive measures, such as hand hygiene, wearing face-masks, and self-quarantine; community measures aimed at physical distancing such as closing schools and cancelling mass gathering events; community engagement to encourage acceptance and participation in such interventions; as well as environmental measures such surface cleaning.More drastic actions aimed at containing the outbreak were taken in China once the severity of the outbreak became apparent, such as quarantining entire cities and imposing strict travel bans.
targetString: ወረርሽኙን ሊቆጣጠር የሚችል ከፋርማሲዩቲካል ዉጪ የሆነ ጣልቃገብነት የሚካተተዉ ራስን የመከላከል ዘዴዎች እነደነ እጅ ንፅህና የአፍ እና አፍንጫ መሸፈኛ ማድረግ እና ራስን ማግለል፤ አካላዊ መራራቅን ላማስፈፀም ህብረተሰባዊ እርምጃዎችን እንደነ ትምህርት ቤቶችን መዝጋት፣ ሰዉ የሚሰባሰብባቸው ፕሮግራሞች መሰረዝ፤ እንደነዚህ ያሉ እርምዎች ተቀባይነት እንዲነያገኙ ለማድረግ ህብረተሰብ እንዲሳተፍ ማድረግ፤ እንዲሁም አከባበ በቂ እርምጃዎች ማፅዳት ነዉ። በቻይና ዉስጥ ወረርሽኙ ከፍተኛ ደረጃ ላይ ሲደረስ ወረርሽኙን ለመግታት ጠንክር እርምጃ ተወስደዋል። እነዚህ እርምጃዎች ሙሉ ከተሞችን ራሳቸዉን ለይቶ ማቆያ ማሰገባትና ሙሉ በሙሉ ጉዞን ማገድ ነዉ።
en-mt: Non-pharmaceutical interventions that can control outbreaks include self-defense techniques such as hand hygiene, covering the mouth and nose, and self-isolation; Social measures to enforce physical distancing include closing schools, canceling programs where people gather; Engaging the community in making such corrections acceptable; Also, there are enough measures to clean the surroundings. When the epidemic reached its peak in China, drastic measures were taken to contain the epidemic. These measures include self-quarantine of entire cities and complete travel bans.

sourceString: Other countries also adopted a variety of measures aimed at limiting the spread of the virus.
targetString: ሌሎች ሃገራትም የቫይረሱን ስርጭት ለመገደብ አለማ የተለያዩ እርምጃዎችን ወስደዋል።
en-mt: Other countries have also taken various measures to limit the spread of the virus.

sourceString: South Korea introduced mass screening and localized quarantines, and issued alerts on the movements of infected individuals.
targetString: ደቡብ ኮርያ አብዛኛውን ሰው የሚያካትት ምርመራ እና ለይቶ መቀመጥን ያስተዋወቀች ሲሆን፣ የተበከሉ ሰዎች ደግሞ እንቅስቃሴ በሚያደርጉበት ጊዜ ማሳወቂያዎችን ታወጣለች።
en-mt: South Korea has introduced mass testing and quarantine, issuing notifications when infected people move.

sourceString: Singapore provided financial support for those infected who quarantined themselves and imposed large fines for those who failed to do so.
targetString: ሲንጋፖር ራሳቸዉን ለተወሰነ ግዜ ላገለሉት የገነዘብ ድጋፍ ስተዳርግ ይሄንን የልተገበሩት ላይ ዳግሞ ቅጣት ጥላለች።
en-mt: Singapore has given cognitive support to those who have isolated themselves for a while, and has punished those who have not followed this.

sourceString: Taiwan increased face mask production and penalized hoarding of medical supplies.Simulations for Great Britain and the United States show that mitigation (slowing but not stopping epidemic spread) and suppression (reversing epidemic growth) have major challenges.
targetString: ታይዋን የፊት ማስክ ምርትን እና የህክምና አቅርቦቶች የተቀናጀ ስርጭትን ጨምራለች። ቅነሳ (የወረርሽኙን ስርጭት መቀነስ ግን አለማቆም) እና መቆጣጠር (የወረርሽኙን እድገት መቀልበስ) ከባድ ተግዳሮቶች እንዳለበት የታላቋ ብሪታኒያ እና ዩናይትድ ስቴትስ ቅኝቱ ያሳያል።
en-mt: Taiwan has increased production of face masks and integrated distribution of medical supplies. The survey of Great Britain and the United States shows that reduction (reducing the spread of the epidemic but not stopping it) and control (reversing the progress of the epidemic) are serious challenges.

sourceString: Optimal mitigation policies might reduce peak healthcare demand by 2/3 and deaths by half, but still result in hundreds of thousands of deaths and health systems being overwhelmed.
targetString: ተመራጭ የሆኑ ፖሊሲዎችን መጠቀም ከፊተኛ የጤና ችግርን በ 2/3ኛ ሲቀንስ ሞትን በግማሽ ይቀንሳል። ነገር ግን በሺህዎች የሚቆጠር ሞት እና የጤና ዘዴ አዉንም ብዙ ችግር እንዳለ ያሳያሉ።
en-mt: Adoption of preferred policies can reduce primary health problems by two-thirds and reduce mortality by half. But the thousands of deaths and the health system show that there is a lot going on.

sourceString: Suppression can be preferred but needs to be maintained for as long as the virus is circulating in the human population (or until a vaccine becomes available, if that comes first), as transmission otherwise quickly rebounds when measures are relaxed.
targetString: በሰው ልጆች ውስጥ ቫይረሱ እየተሰራጨ እስካለ ድረስ ጭቆናን መጠቀም ተመራጭ ሊሆን ይችላል ግን መጠበቅ አለበት(ወይም ክትባት እስኪገኝ ድረስ፣ ያ መጀመሪያ ከመጣ)፣ ሁኔታዎች በሚላሉበት ጊዜ ስርጭቱ በፍጥነት ይመልሳል።
en-mt: As long as the virus is circulating in humans, using suppression may be preferable but must wait (or until a vaccine is available, if that comes first), when conditions allow transmission to return quickly.

sourceString: Long-term intervention to suppress the pandemic causes social and economic costs.
targetString: ወራርሽኙን ለመግታት የረጅም ግዜ ጣልቃ መግባት የማህበራዊ እና ምጣኔ ሐብታዊ ቀዉስን ያስከትላል።
en-mt: A long-term intervention to stop the epidemic will cause a social and economic crisis.

sourceString: There are no specific antiviral medications approved for COVID-19, but development efforts are underway, including testing of existing medications.
targetString: ለ COVID-19 የተፈቀዱ የተወሰኑ የጸረ-ቫይረስ መድሃኒቶች የሉም፣ ነገር ግን የነባር መድሃኒቶች መፈተሻን ጨምሮ፣ የልማት ጥረቶች አየተካሄዱ ናቸው።
en-mt: There are no specific antiviral drugs approved for COVID-19, but development efforts, including testing of existing drugs, are underway.

sourceString: Taking over-the-counter cold medications, drinking fluids, and resting may help alleviate symptoms.
targetString: ያለ ሃኪም ትዕዛዝ የሚሸጡ መድሃኒቶችን መውሰድ፣ ፈሳሾች መጠጣት፣ እና እረፍት የሕመም ምልክቶችን ለመቀነስ ሊረዳ ይችላል።
en-mt: Taking over-the-counter medications, drinking fluids, and resting can help reduce symptoms.

sourceString: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and breathing support may be required.
targetString: በክብደቱ ላይ በመመርኮዝ፣ የኦክስጅን ህክምና፣ በደም ስር የሚሰጡ ፋሳሾች እና የመተንፈሻ ድጋፍ ሊያስፈልጉ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Depending on the severity, oxygen therapy, intravenous fluids, and respiratory support may be required.

sourceString: The use of steroids may worsen outcomes.
targetString: እስቴሮይዶችን መጠቀም የባሰ ለከፋ ውጤቶች ሊመራ ይችላል።
en-mt: Using steroids can lead to worse outcomes.

sourceString: Several compounds that were previously approved for treatment of other viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.
targetString: በቫይረስ የተነሳ ለሚመጡ በሽታዎች ህክምና የተፈቀዱ በርካታ ስፍራዎች COVID-19 ን ለማከም አገልግሎት እየተመረመሩ ይገኛሉ።
en-mt: Several facilities approved for the treatment of viral diseases are being investigated for use in treating COVID-19.

sourceString: The WHO also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief of the symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.
targetString: የአለም ጤና ድርጅትም አንዳንድ "ባህላዊ እና በቤት የሚዘጋጁ መድሃኒቶች" በ SARS-CoV-19 ከሚከሰቱ የበሽታ ምልክቶች ማስታገሻ ሊሰጡ እንደሚችሉ ገልጿል።
en-mt: The World Health Organization has also stated that some "traditional and home remedies" can provide relief from symptoms caused by SARS-CoV-19.

sourceString: Increasing capacity and adapting healthcare for the needs of COVID-19 patients is described by the WHO as a fundamental outbreak response measure.
targetString: ለ COVID-19 ታካሚዎች ፍላጎቶች አቅም ማሳደግ እና የጤናን እንክብካቤን ማመቻቸት እንደ መሰረታዊ ለበሽታው ስርጭት መግቻ የተወሰደ እርምጃ ነው ሲል WHO ገልጻል።
en-mt: Building capacity and optimizing health care for the needs of patients with COVID-19 is a fundamental step in curbing the spread of the disease, WHO said.

sourceString: The ECDC and the European regional office of the WHO have issued guidelines for hospitals and primary healthcare services for shifting of resources at multiple levels, including focusing laboratory services towards COVID-19 testing, cancelling elective procedures whenever possible, separating and isolating COVID-19 positive patients, and increasing intensive care capabilities by training personnel and increasing the number of available ventilators and beds.
targetString: የ ECDC እና የአለም ጤና ድርጅት የአውሮፓ ክልላዊ ፅ/ቤት ግብዓቶችን በበርካታ መጠኖች ለማንቀሳቀስ፣ ይህም የCOVID-19 ምርመራ በተመለከተ የላቦራቶሪ አገልግሎቶች ላይ ማተኮር፣ በሚቻልበት ጊዜ ሁሉ ሂደቶችን መሰረዝ፣ COVID-19 ፖዘቲቭ የሆኑ ታካሚዎችን መለየት እና መነጠል እና ሰራተኞች በማሰልጠን የፅኑ ህሙማን እንክብካቤ አቅሞችን መጨመር እና ያሉትን የመተንፈሻ ማሽኖች እና አልጋዎች ቁጥር መጨመር ጨምሮ ለሆስፒታሎች እና የመጀመሪያ ደረጃ የጤና እንክብካቤ አገልግሎቶች መመሪያዎችን ሰጥቷል።
en-mt: ECDC and the WHO Regional Office for Europe to mobilize resources at multiple levels, including focusing on laboratory services for COVID-19 diagnosis, canceling procedures whenever possible, identifying and isolating patients who are positive for COVID-19, and increasing intensive care capacities by training staff And it issued directives to hospitals and primary health care services, including increasing the number of ventilators and beds available.

sourceString: There are various theories about where the very first case (the so-called patient zero) may have originated.
targetString: ስለመጀመሪያው ክስተት (ታካሚ ዜሮ) ከየት እንደተነሳ የሚነገሩ ብዙ መላምቶች አሉ።
en-mt: There are many theories about where the first event (Patient Zero) originated.

sourceString: The first known case of the novel coronavirus may trace back to 1 December 2019 in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: መጀመሪያ የተዋቀዉ የኮሮኖቫረስ ኬዝ በ ታህሳስ 1 2019 ውሃን፣ ሁቤ፣ ቻይና ዉስጥ ነዉ።
en-mt: The first reported case of the coronavirus was on December 1, 2019, in Wuhan, Hubei, China.

sourceString: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei gradually increased.
targetString: በአንድ ወር ውስጥ፣ በሁቤይ ያለው የኮሮናቫይረስ የጉዳት ቁጥር ቀስ በቀስ ቀንሷል።
en-mt: Within a month, the number of coronavirus cases in Hubei has gradually decreased.

sourceString: These were mostly linked to the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market, which also sold live animals, and one theory is that the virus came from one of these kinds of animals; or, in other words, has a zoonotic origin.A pneumonia cluster of unknown cause was observed on 26 December and treated by the doctor Zhang Jixian in Hubei Provincial Hospital, who informed the Wuhan Jianghan CDC on 27 December.
targetString: እነዚህ አብዛኛዎቹ ከሃዋንያን የባህር ምግብ የጅምላ ገበያ ጋር የተገናኙ ነበሩ፣ ይህም የቀጥታ እንስሳትን ከሚሸጡት በተጨማሪ ነው፣ እናም አንድ ጽንሰ-ሀሳብ ቫይረሱ የመጣው ከእነዚህ የእንስሳት ዓይነቶች ውስጥ አንዱ ነው፤ ወይም በሌላ አገላለጽ ዞኖቲካዊ መነሻ አለው። በ ዲሴምበር 26 ውስጥ ያልታወቀ መንስኤ የሳንባ ምች ክሊኒክ ታይቷል እናም በሀይቢ የክልል ሆስፒታል በ ዲሴምበር 27 ለዉሃን ጂያንጋን CDC ያሳውቀዉ ሐኪሙ Zhang Jixian የታከመ ነዉ።
en-mt: Most of these were linked to Hawaiian seafood wholesale markets, in addition to those selling live animals, and one theory is that the virus originated from one of these animals. Or in other words it has a zoonotic origin.
