en-mt: There are currently about 18,000 machines in the United States, and Abbott ramps up production to be able to perform 50,000 tests a day. The test, which uses a monoclonal antibody that binds directly to the nucleocapsid protein (N protein) of the novel coronavirus, is expected to show results in 15 to 20 minutes, just like a rapid influenza test.

sourceString: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little diagnostic value in early stages, whereas CT [computed tomography] findings may be present even before symptom onset."
targetString: ማርች 2020 ላይ የነበረ የሊትሬቸር ሪቪው በመጀመሪያ ደረጃዎች ላይ “የደረት ራዲዮግራፊዎች ያላቸው ዋጋ በጣም ትንሽ እንደሆነ ሆኖም CT \[computed tomography] ውጤቶች በቦታው ላይ ምልክት ከመታየቱም በፊት ቢሆን እንኳን ሊኖሩ እንደሚችሉ ደምድሟል።
en-mt: A March 2020 literature review concluded that "chest radiographs are of little value in early stages, but CT [computed tomography] results may be present even before symptoms are present."

sourceString: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacificities with a peripheral, asymmetric and posterior distribution.
targetString: በሲቲ ላይ ዓይነተኛ ገጽታዎች የሁለትዮሽ መልቲሎባር የመሬት-መስታወት ኦፓሲፊቲዎችን ከተጓዳኝ፣ ያልተበሳጠረ እና ከጀርባ ስርጭትን ጋር ያካትታሉ።
en-mt: Typical features on CT include bilateral multilobar ground-glass opacities with confluent, diffuse, and background distribution.

sourceString: Subpleural dominance, crazy paving and consolidation develop as the disease evolves.
targetString: ንኡስ ብዝሀዊነት ጫና፣ ትክክል ያልሆን ጠረጋ አና ሁሉን አካታችነት ይህ በሽታ በሚለወጥበት ጊዜ ያድጋል።
en-mt: The pressure of sub-diversity, misalignment and inclusivity grows as this disease evolves.

sourceString: A study comparing PCR to CT in Wuhan at the point of origin of the current pandemic has suggested that CT is significantly more sensitive than PCR, though less specific, with many of its imaging features overlapping with other pneumonias and disease processes.
targetString: በመነሻው ነጥብ ውሃን ውስጥ PCR ን ከ CT የሚያነጻጽር ጥናት CT ይበልጥ ከ PCR ይልቅ የመቀበል ባህሪ እንዳለው፣ ነገር ግን ዝቅተኛ ውስንነት ኖሮት አብዛኛዎቹ የምስል ባህሪዎቹ ከሳምባ ምች እና የበሽታዎች ሂደት ጋር አንድ አይነት መልክ ያለው ነው።
en-mt: A baseline study comparing PCR to CT in water showed that CT had higher acceptance rates than PCR, but had lower limitations, with most of the imaging features being similar to those of pneumonia and disease progression.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the American College of Radiology recommends that "CT should not be used to screen for or as a first-line test to diagnose COVID-19".As of March 2020, the CDC recommends PCR for initial screening.
targetString: በማርች 2020 የአሜሪካ ራዲዮሎጂ ኮሌጅ “CT እንደመጀመሪያ ደረጃ የ COVID-19 መመርመሪያ ጥቅም ላይ መዋል የለበትም” ይላል። በማርች 2020 CDC ደግሞ ለመጀመሪያ ደረጃ ምርመራ PCR ጥቅም ላይ እንዲውል ይመክራል።
en-mt: In March 2020, the American College of Radiology states that "CT should not be used as a primary diagnostic tool for COVID-19." As of March 2020, the CDC is recommending the use of PCR for initial screening.

sourceString: Part of the immune response to infection is the production of antibodies including IgM and IgG.
targetString: የበሽታ መከላከል ምላሽ ለበሽታ መከላከል የአንቲቦዲ ምርት ሲሆን IgM እና IgG የሚያካትት ነው።
en-mt: The immune response is the production of antibodies to fight disease and includes IgM and IgG.

sourceString: These can be used to detect infection in individuals starting 7 days or so after the onset of symptoms, to determine immunity, and in population surveillance.Assays can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or by point-of-care testing (PoCT).
targetString: እነዚህ ምልክት ማሳየት ከጀመሩ 7 ቀናት ወይም ከዚያ በላይ የሆናቸው ሰዎች ኢንፌክሽንን ለመለየት፣ የመከላከል አቅምን ለመወሰን፣ እና በህዝብ ጥናት ውስጥ ነው። ምርመራዎች በማዕከላዊ ቤተ ሙከራዎች (CLT) ውስጥ ወይም በእንክብካቤ መስጫ ነጥብ (PoCT) ላይ ሊደረጉ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: These are used to detect infection in people 7 days or older after symptom onset, to determine immunity, and in population studies. Tests can be performed in central laboratories (CLT) or at the point of care (PoCT).

sourceString: The high-throughput automated systems in many clinical laboratories will be able to perform these assays but their availability will depend on the rate of production for each system.
targetString: ሀይ ስሩፑት የሚባሉ አውቶማቲክ ሲስተሞች አብዛኛዎቹ ክሊኒካዊ ቤተሙከራዎች ውስጥ እነዚህን ምርመራዎች ማድረግ የሚችሉ ሲሆን ነገር የመገኘታቸው መጠንም በእያንዳንዱ ሲስተም ውስጥ በምርት መጠን የሚወሰን ይሆናል።
en-mt: High-throughput automated systems are capable of performing these tests in most clinical laboratories, and their availability will depend on the production volume of each system.

sourceString: For CLT a single specimen of peripheral blood is commonly used, although serial specimens can be used to follow the immune response.
targetString: ለ CLT አንድ የደም ናሙና በተለምዶ ጥቅም ላይ ይውላል፣ ነገር ግን የበሽታ መከላከልን ምላሽ ለማየት ሲሪያል ናሙናዎች ጥቅም ላይ ሊውሉ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: A single blood sample is typically used for CLT, but serial samples may be used to look at the immune response.

sourceString: For PoCT a single specimen of blood is usually obtained by skin puncture.
targetString: ለ PoCT የደም ናሙና አብዛኛውን ጊዜ የሚገኘው መርፌ በመውጋት ነው።
en-mt: A blood sample for PoCT is usually obtained through a needle stick.

sourceString: Unlike PCR methods an extraction step is not needed before assay.On March 26, 2020, the FDA named 29 entities that provided notification to the agency as required and are now therefore able to distribute their antibody tests.
targetString: ከ PCR ዘዴዎች በተቃራኒ ከማውጣቱ በፊት የማስነሻ እርምጃ አስፈላጊ አይደለም። በ ማርች 26፣ 2020 እንደአስፈላጊነቱ ለኤጀንሲው ማስታወቂያ የሰጡ 29 ተቋማትን በመሰየም የፀረ-ሰው ምርመራዎችን አሁን ማሰራጨት ችለዋል።
en-mt: Unlike PCR methods, no primer step is necessary before extraction. By March 26, 2020, 29 institutions had been notified that they had notified the agency that they were now able to distribute antibody tests.

sourceString: As of April 7, 2020, only a single test has been approved by the FDA under an emergency use authorization.In late March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received European approvals for their test kits, which can detect IgG and IgA antibodies against the virus in blood samples.
targetString: እ.ኤ.አ. በኤፕሪል 7 ቀን 2020፣ በአደጋ ጊዜ አጠቃቀም ፈቃድ መሠረት በኤፍዲኤ የተፈቀደው አንድ ፈተና ብቻ ነው። እ.ኤ.አ. ማርች 2020 መገባደጃ ላይ Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics እና Epitope Diagnostics IgG እና IgA በደም ናሙናዎች ውስጥ ፀረ እንግዳ አካላትን ለይቶ ለማወቅ የሚያስችል የአውሮፓ ፈቃድን አገኙ።
en-mt: In the year As of April 7, 2020, only one test has been approved by the FDA under an emergency use permit. In the year At the end of March 2020, Euroimmun Medical Laboratory Diagnostics and Epitope Diagnostics received a European license to detect IgG and IgA antibodies in blood samples.

sourceString: The testing capacity is several hundred samples within hours and therefore much faster than the conventional PCR assay of viral RNA.
targetString: የምርመራው አቅም በብዙ መቶዎች የሚቆጠሩ ናሙናዎችን በሰዓት መመርመር ሲሆን ከተለመደው የቫይረሱን RNA በ PCR ከመለየት የሚፈጥን ነው።
en-mt: The capability of the test is to analyze hundreds of samples per hour, which is faster than conventional PCR detection of viral RNA.

sourceString: The antibodies are usually detectable 14 days after the onset of the infection.In early April, the UK found none of the antibody test kits it purchased were sufficiently good to use.
targetString: አንቲቦዲዎች አብዛኛውን ጊዜ በ 14 ቀናት የመበከል ጊዜ ውስጥ ይለያሉ። በአፕሪል መጀመሪያ ላይ ዩኬ ውስጥ የትኛውም የአንቲቦዲ መመርመሪያ የተገዛ መሳሪያ ጠቃሚ አልነበረም።
en-mt: Antibodies are usually detected within 14 days of infection. By early April, none of the antibody test kits purchased in the UK were useful.

sourceString: Hong Kong has set up a scheme where suspected patients can stay home, "emergency department will give a specimen tube to the patient", they spit into it, send it back and get a test result a while after.The British NHS has announced that it is piloting a scheme to test suspected cases at home, which removes the risk of a patient infecting others if they come to a hospital or having to disinfect an ambulance if one is used.In drive-through testing for COVID-19 for suspected cases, a healthcare professional takes sample using appropriate precautions.
targetString: ሆንግ ኮንግ የሚጠረጠሩ ታካሚዎች ቤት ውስጥ እንዲሆኑ የሚያስችላቸውን እርምጃ ወስዳለች፣ “የድንገተኛ ጊዜ ዲፓርትመንት ለታካሚው የናሙና ቱቦን የሚሰጥ ሲሆን”፣ እነርሱ ይተፉበታል፣ ይመልሱታል እንዲሁም የምርመራ ውጤቶችን ከጊዜ በኋላ ያገኛሉ። የእንግሊዝ NHS የሚጠረጠሩ ጉዳዮችን ቤት ውሰጥ ለመመርመር የሚያሰችል ዝግጅት በማድረግ ላይ የሚገኝ ሲሆን፣ ሆስፒታል ውስጥ ቢሄዱ የሚጠረጡ ሰዎች ሌሎች ሰዎችን እንዳይበክሉ የሚያደርግ ሲሆን አምቡላንስ ጥቅም ላይ ቢውል ከኢንፌክሽን ለማጽዳት ነው። በመኪና በመንዳት ማለፍ COVID-19 መመርመሪያ ለሚጠረጠር ጉዳይ፣ የጤና ባለሞያ ናሙና ትክክለኛውን መሳሪያ በመጠቀም ይወስዳል።
en-mt: Hong Kong has taken steps to allow suspected patients to stay at home, "while the emergency department gives the patient a sample tube," which they spit out, return it, and get test results later. The NHS in England is making arrangements to test suspected cases at home, to prevent infected people from infecting others if they go to hospital, and to clean up infections if ambulances are used. For a suspected case of a drive-by COVID-19 test, a healthcare professional will take the sample using the right equipment.

sourceString: Drive-through centers have helped South Korea do some of the fastest, most-extensive testing of any country.In Germany, the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance Physicians said on 2 March, that it had a capacity for about 12,000 tests per day in the ambulatory setting and 10.700 had been tested in the prior week.
targetString: ከመኪና ሳይወጡ የሚታለፍባቸው ማእከላት ደቡብ ኮርያ ውስጥ በጣም ፈጣን የሆነ፣ እና ሰፊ የሆነ ምርመራ በሀገሪቱ ውስጥ ይደረግ ዘንድ አስችሏል። ጀርመን ውስጥ፣ የህጋዊ ጤና መድን ብሄራዊ ትብብር ሀኪሞች ማርች 2 ላይ እንዳሉት ከሆነ፣ በቀን ውስጥ 12,000 ምርመራዎችን በአምቡላንስ ውስጥ ለማድረግ የሚችል አቅም ያለው ሰሆን ከዚህ በፊት በነበረው ሳምንት 10.700 ምርመራዎች ተደርገው ነበር።
en-mt: Drive-thru centers in South Korea allow for the fastest, most comprehensive screening in the country. In Germany, according to the doctors of the National Association of Statutory Health Insurance on March 2, an elephant with the capacity to carry out 12,000 tests a day in an ambulance had performed 10,700 tests in the previous week.

sourceString: Costs are borne by the health insurance when the test is ordered by a physician.
targetString: ሀኪም ምርመራ እንዲደረግ በሚያዝበት ወቅት ወጪዎች የሚሸፈኑት በጤና መድን ነው።
en-mt: When a doctor orders a test, the costs are covered by health insurance.

sourceString: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has an overall capacity for 160,000 tests per week.
targetString: እንደ Robert Koch Institute ፕሬዝዳንት ከሆነ፣ ጀርመን በሳምንት ውስጥ 160,000 ምርመራዎችን የማድረግ አቅም አላት።
en-mt: According to the president of the Robert Koch Institute, Germany has the capacity to conduct 160,000 tests a week.

sourceString: As of 19 March drive in tests were offered in several large cities.
targetString: እስከ ማርች 19 ባለው ጊዜ በብዙ ትላልቅ ከተማዎች በመኪና እየነዱ የሚታለፍበት ምርመራ ማድረግ ቀርቦ ነበር።
en-mt: By March 19, a drive-thru test was proposed in many major cities.

sourceString: As of 26 March 2020 the total number of tests performed in Germany was unknown, because only positive results are reported.
targetString: ማርች 26 2020 ላይ ጀርመን ውስጥ የተደረገው አጠቃላይ የምርመራዎች ቁጥር የማይታወቅ ሲሆን ምክንያቱ ደግሞ ፖዘቲቭ ውጤቶች ብቻ ሪፖርት ስለሚደረጉ ነው።
en-mt: The total number of tests performed in Germany on 26 March 2020 is unknown, as only positive results are reported.

sourceString: A first lab survey revealed that as of calendar week 12/2020 a total of at least 483,295 samples were tested up to and including week 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) tested positive for SARS-CoV-2.In Israel, researchers at Technion and Rambam Hospital developed and tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients simultaneously, by pooling the samples and only testing further if the combined sample is found to be positive.In Wuhan a makeshift 2000-sq-meter emergency detection laboratory named "Huo-Yan" (Chinese: 火眼, or "Fire Eye" in English) was opened on 5 February 2020 by BGI, which can process over 10,000 samples a day.
targetString: የመጀመሪያ ደረጃ ቤተ ሙከራ ጥናት እንደሚያሳየው ከቀን መቁጠርያ ሳምንት 12/2020 ጀምሮ ቢያንስ 483,295 ናሙናዎች እስከ 12/2020 ድረስ ምርመራ የተደረገባቸው እና 33,491 ናሙናዎች (6.9%) የ SARS-CoV-2 የተረጋገጠ መሆናቸውን ደርሰውበታል። በእስራኤል ውስጥ ተመራማሪዎች በ Technion እና Rambam ሆስፒታል በአንድ ጊዜ ከ 64 ታካሚዎች ናሙናዎችን ለመፈተሽ አንድ ዘዴን ፈትነው ሞክረዋል ፣ ናሙናዎችን በማቀላቀል የተቀናጀ ናሙና አዎንታዊ ሆኖ ከተገኘ ብቻ። ሂዩ-ያ "(ቻይንኛ-ç« çœ¼ ፣ ወይም "የእሳት ዐይን" በእንግሊዝኛ) በቀን 10,000 ናሙናዎች ማካሄድ በሚችለው በ የካቲት 5∕2020 በቢጂአይ ተከፈተ።
en-mt: A preliminary laboratory study showed that at least 483,295 samples were tested from the calendar week of 12/2020 until 12/2020 and 33,491 samples (6.9%) were confirmed for SARS-CoV-2. In Israel, researchers at the Technion and Rambam Hospital tested a method for testing samples from 64 patients at a time, mixing the samples only if a composite sample tested positive. Hiu-ya (Chinese-ç« çœ¼, or "eye of fire" in English) was opened by BGI on February 5∕2020, capable of processing 10,000 samples per day.

sourceString: With the construction overseen by BGI-founder Wang Jian and taking 5-days, modelling has show cases in Hubei would have been 47% higher and the corresponding cost of the tackling the quarantine would have doubled if this testing capacity hadn't come on line.
targetString: የ BGI መስራች በሆኑት Wang Jian የቅርብ ክትትል ስር ከሚገኘው ግንባታ ጋር እንዲሁም 5 ቀናትን በመውሰድ፣ ሞዴል ስራው በ ሁቤይ ውስጥ በ 47% ከፍ ሊል የሚችል የነበረ ሲሆን ለይቶ መቀመጥ የሚያስወጣው ወጪ ደግሞ የምርመራው ሁኔታ ባይጀመር ኖሮ በእጥፍ ከፍ ይል ነበር።
en-mt: With construction under the close supervision of BGI founder Wang Jian and taking 5 days, the model work in Hubei could have increased by 47%, and the cost of quarantine would have doubled if the testing situation had not started.

sourceString: The Wuhan Laboratory has been promptly followed by Huo-Yan labs in Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing, and Shanghai, in a total of 12 cities across China.
targetString: የውሃን ላቦራቶሪን ተከትለው በመላው ቻይና ውስጥ የሚገኙ 12 ከተሞች ውስጥ የተከፈቱ ሲሆን ከእነዚህም ውስጥ ሼንዘን፣ ቲይያንጂን፣ ቤጂንግ እና ሻንጋይ ይገኙበታል።
en-mt: Following the water lab, they opened in 12 cities across China, including Shenzhen, Tianjin, Beijing and Shanghai.

sourceString: By 4 March 2020 the daily throughput totals were 50,000 tests per day.Open source, multiplexed designs released by Origami Assays have been released that can test as many as 1122 patient samples for COVID19 using only 93 assays .  These balanced designs can be run in small laboratories without the need for robotic liquid handlers.
targetString: ማርች 4 2020 ላይ እለታዊ የጅምላ ምርመራዎች በቀን 50,000 ነበሩ። ኦፐን ሶርስ መልቲፕሌክስ ዲዛይንስ በ Origami Assays የተለቀቀ ሲሆን 93 ምርመራዎችን ብቻ በመጠቀም 1122 የ COVID19 ታካሚ ናሙናዎችን ለመመርመር የሚያሰችል ነው። አነዚህ ሚዛናዊ የሆኑ ንድፎች በትንንሽ ቤተሙከራዎች ውስጥ ሊደረጉ የሚችሉ ሲሆን ሮቦት የፈሳሽ መያዣዎችን አይፈልጉም።
en-mt: On March 4, 2020, daily mass tests were 50,000 per day. An open-source multiplex design was released by Origami Assays to screen 1122 COVID19 patient samples using only 93 assays. These balanced designs can be done in small labs and do not require robotic liquid containers.

sourceString: By March, shortages and insufficient amounts of reagent has become a bottleneck for mass testing in the EU and UK and the US.
targetString: ማርች ወር ላይ፣ የምርመራ ንጥረ ነገር እጥረት እና ማነስ አውሮፓ ህብረት፣ ዩኬ እና አሜሪካ ውስጥ ብዙሃኑን በመመርመር ሂደት ላይ ከፍተኛ ማነቆ ሆነ።
en-mt: In March, shortages and shortages of diagnostic materials became a major obstacle to mass testing in the EU, UK and US.

sourceString: This has led some authors to explore sample preparation protocols that involve heating samples at 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes to release RNA genomes for further testing.On 31 March it was announced United Arab Emirates was now testing more of its population for Coronavirus per head than any other country, and was on track to scale up the level of testing to reach the bulk of the population.
targetString: ይህም አንዳንድ ጸሀፊዎች አንዳንድ የምርመራ ሂደቶችን ማለትም ናሙናዎችን እስከ 98 °C (208 °F) ለ 5 ደቂቃ በማሞቅ የ RNA ዘረመሎች እንዲለቀቁ እና ተጨማሪ ምርመራ ይደረግ ዘንድ የሚያደርገውን ሂደት እንዲመረምሩ አድርጓል። በማርች 31 ቀን የተባበሩት አረብ ኢምሬቶች ከማንኛውም ሀገር ይልቅ በነፍስ ወከፍ እየመረመረ እንደሆነ ማስታወቂያ ተሰጥቶ የነበረ ሲሆን ብዙሃኑን የህዝብ ክፍል ለማዳረስ መስመር ላይ ነበር።
en-mt: This has led some authors to investigate some diagnostic procedures, such as heating samples to 98 °C (208 °F) for 5 minutes, to release the RNA genes and allow further analysis. On March 31, it was announced that the United Arab Emirates was testing more per capita than any other country, and was on track to reach the majority of the population.

sourceString: This was through a combination of drive-through capability, and purchasing a population-scale mass-throughput laboratory from Group 42 and BGI (based on their "Huo-Yan" emergency detection laboratories in China).
targetString: ይህም በመኪና እየነዱ ማለፍ፣ አንዲሁም መላውን ህዝብ የሚያካትት የቤተሙከራ ከ ቡድን 42 እና BGI (ይህም የሚመሰረተው በ "Huo-Yan" ቻይና ውስጥ ባለው ድንገተኛ ቤተ ሙከራ ነው)።
en-mt: This includes a drive-by, as well as an entire population of labs from Team 42 and BGI (which is based in the "Huo-Yan" emergency lab in China).

sourceString: Constructed in 14 days, the lab is capable of conducting tens of thousands RT-PCR tests per day and is the first in the world of this scale to be operational outside of China.
targetString: በ 14 ቀናት ውስጥ የተሰራው ቤተሙከራ በሺዎች የሚቆጠሩ RT-PCR ምርመራዎችን በቀን ማድረግ የሚችል ሲሆን ከቻይና ውጪ በዚህ መጠን ለመስራት የሚችል በአለማችን የመጀመሪያው ነው።
en-mt: The lab, which was built in 14 days, is capable of performing thousands of RT-PCR tests per day, and is the first in the world to be able to do this scale outside of China.

sourceString: Different testing recipes targeting different parts of the coronavirus genetic profile were developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, and the United States.
targetString: የተለያዩ የምርመራ ቅደም ተከተሎች የኮሮና ቫይረስን የተለያየ የዘረመል ክፍሎች ኢላማ ውስጥ የሚያስገባ ሲሆን የተመረተው ደግሞ ቻይና፣ ፈረንሳይ፣ ጀርመን፣ ሆንግ ኮንግ፣ ጃፓን እና ዩናይትድ ስቴትስ ውስጥ ነው።
en-mt: Different diagnostic sequences target different genetic segments of the coronavirus and have been developed in China, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan and the United States.

sourceString: The World Health Organization adopted the German recipe for manufacturing kits sent to low-income countries without the resources to develop their own.
targetString: የአለም ጤና ድርጅት የጀርመንን የመሳሪያዎች ማምረት አዘገጃጀት ቅደም ተከተል ዝቅተኛ ገቢ ላላቸው እና የራሳቸውን መስራት ለማይችሉ ሀገራት ለራሱ አድርጎ ወስዶታል።
en-mt: The World Health Organization has adopted Germany's order to manufacture equipment for low-income countries that cannot make their own.

sourceString: The German recipe was published on 17 January 2020; the protocol developed by the United States Centers for Disease Control was not available until 28 January, delaying available tests in the U.S.China and the United States had problems with the reliability of test kits early in the outbreak, and these countries and Australia were unable to supply enough kits to satisfy demand and recommendations for testing by health experts.
targetString: የጀርመን የአዘገጃጀት ቅደም ተከተል በ ጃንዋሪ 17፣ 2020 የተዘጋጀ ሲሆን፣ በዩናይትድ ስቴትስ የበሽታ ቁጥጥር ማዕከላት የተዘጋጀው ፕሮቶኮል እስከ ጃንዋሪ 28 ድረስ ዝግጁ አልነበረም፤ ይህም በተባበሩት የቻይና መንግስታት ውስጥ ያሉ ምርመራዎች እንዲዘገዩ ያደረገ ሲሆን ዩናይትድ ስቴትስ ደግሞ በመመርመሪያ መሳሪያዎች አሰተማማኝነት ላይ ወረርሽኙ በጀመረበት ወቅት ችግር አጋጥሟት ነበር፤ እንዲሁም እነዚህ ሀገራት እና አውስትራሊያ ፍላጎትን የሚያሟላ በቂ የሆነ መመርመሪያ መሳሪያን ለማቅረብ እና በጤና ባለሞያዎች ደግሞ ምክሮችን ለማቅረብ ሳይችሉ ቀርተዋል።
en-mt: The German protocol was prepared on January 17, 2020, and the protocol developed by the US Centers for Disease Control was not ready until January 28; This has led to delays in testing at the United Nations in China, while the United States has had problems with the reliability of testing equipment at the start of the outbreak; Also, these countries and Australia are unable to provide adequate testing equipment to meet demand and recommendations by health professionals.

sourceString: In contrast, experts say South Korea's broad availability of testing helped reduce the spread of the novel coronavirus.
targetString: በተቃራኒው፣ ኤክስፐርቶች እንደሚናገሩት፣ ደቡብ ኮሪያ ውስጥ ሰፊ የሆነ ምርመራ የማድረግ አቅም መኖሩ የኖቭል ኮሮና ቫይረስን ስርጭት ለመቀነስ እገዛ አድርጓል።
en-mt: On the contrary, experts say, South Korea's extensive testing capacity has helped slow the spread of the novel coronavirus.

sourceString: Testing capacity, largely in private sector labs, was built up over several years by the South Korean government.
targetString: የደቡብ ኮሪያ መንግስት አብዛኛውን ጊዜ በግሉ ሴክተር ላብራቶሪዎቸ ውስጥ የመመርመር አቅምን ለበርካታ ዓመታት ሲገነባ ነበር።
en-mt: The South Korean government has been building testing capacity for several years, mostly in private sector laboratories.

sourceString: On 16 March, the World Health Organization called for ramping up the testing programmes as the best way to slow the advance of COVID-19 pandemic.High demand for testing due to wide spread of the virus caused backlogs of hundreds of thousands of tests at private U.S. labs, and supplies of swabs and chemical reagents became strained.
targetString: ማርች 16 ላይ፣ የአለም ጤና ድርጅት የ COVID-19ን ወረርሽኝን ስርጭት ለመቀነስ ምርመራዎችን ማፍጠን እንደሚገባ አሳስቧል። ቫይረሱ በነበረው ከፍተኛ ስርጭት ምክንያት የጨመረው የመመርመሪያ መሳሪያዎች ፍላጎት በመቶ ሺዎች የሚቆጠሩ የቫይረስ መመርመሪያ እጥረትና ኬሚካል ፍላጎት እጥረት እንዲፈጠር አድርጓል።
en-mt: On March 16, the World Health Organization urged that tests be accelerated to reduce the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic. The increased demand for diagnostic equipment due to the high prevalence of the virus has led to a shortage of hundreds of thousands of virus tests and chemical shortages.

sourceString: In March 2020 China reported problems with accuracy in their test kits.
targetString: በማርች 2020 ቻይና በመመርመሪያ መሣሪያዎቻቸው ትክክለኛነት ላይ ችግሮች እንዳሉ አሳወቀች።
en-mt: In March 2020, China announced that there were problems with the accuracy of their diagnostic equipment.

sourceString: In the United States, the test kits developed by the CDC had "flaws;" the government then removed the bureaucratic barriers that had prevented private testing.Spain purchased test kits from Chinese firm  Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but found that results were inaccurate.
targetString: ዩናይትድ ስቴትስ ውስጥ በ CDC የተሰሩት መመርመሪያዎች “ችግር” የነበረባቸው ሲሆን መንግስት የግል ምርመራዎችን ለማድረግ ገደብ የሚያደርጉትን ቢሮክራሲዎች አስወግዷል። ስፔን ከቻይናው ድርጅት Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd መመርመሪያዎችን ገዝታ የነበረ ሲሆን ውጤቶች ግን ትክክል አልነበሩም።
en-mt: In the United States, the tests developed by the CDC were "problematic" and the government removed the red tape that limited private testing. Spain had bought tests from the Chinese company Shenzhen Bioeasy Biotechnology Co Ltd, but the results were not accurate.

sourceString: The firm explained that the incorrect results may be a result of a failure to collect samples or use the kits correctly.
targetString: ድርጅቱ እንዳስረዳው፣ የተሳሳቱ ውጤቶች ሊገኙ የቻሉት ናሙናዎችን ባለመሰብሰብ ወይም መሳሪያዎቹን በትክክል ባለመጠቀም ምክንያት ሊሆን ይችላል።
en-mt: According to the organization, erroneous results may be due to improper collection of samples or improper use of the equipment.

sourceString: The Spanish ministry said it will withdraw the kits that returned incorrect results, and would replace them with a different testing kit provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy.80% of test kits the Czech Republic purchased from China gave wrong results.Slovakia purchased 1.2 million test kits from China which were found to be inaccurate.
targetString: የስፔን ሚኒስቴር እንዳለው፣ የተሳሳቱ ውጤቶችን ያስገኙ መሳሪያዎች ተመላሽ ተደርገው Shenzhen Bioeasy በሚያቀርበው የተለየ የመመርመሪያ መሳሪያ ይተካል። ቼክ ሪፐብሊክከቻይና ከገዛቻቸው የምርመራ መሳሪያዎች መካከል 80% የሚሆኑት የተሳሳቱ ውጤቶችን አስገኝተዋል። ስሎቫኪያ ደግሞ ከቻይና 1.2 ሚሊዮን የመመርመሪያ መሳሪያዎች ገዝታ የነበረ ሲሆን እነርሱም ደግሞ የተሳሳተ መረጃን ሰጥተዋል።
en-mt: According to the Spanish ministry, devices that produce false results will be returned and replaced with a different diagnostic device provided by Shenzhen Bioeasy. 80% of the diagnostic equipment the Czech Republic bought from China gave false results. Slovakia also bought 1.2 million diagnostic equipment from China, which also gave false information.

sourceString: Prime Minister Matovič suggested these be dumped into the Danube.Ateş Kara of the Turkish Health Ministry said the test kits Turkey purchased from China had a "high error rate" and did not "put them into use."The UK purchased 3.5 million test kits from China but in early April 2020 announced these were not usable.
targetString: ጠቅላይ ሚኒስትር MatoviÄ እነዚህ በ Danube ውስጥ እንዲጣሉ ሃሳበ አቅርበዋል። የቱርክ ጤና ሚኒስቴር ሰራተኛ የሆኑት AteÅŸ Kara እንደገለጹት፣ ቱርክ ከቻይና የገዛቻቸው የመመርመራሪያ ኪቶች “ከፍተኛ የስህተት መጠን” ያላቸው በመሆኑ “ጥቅም ላይ አላዋሉትምም።’’ “ዩኬ ከቻይና 3.5 ሚሊዮን መመርመሪያ ኪቶችን የገዛች ቢሆንም፣ ኤፕሪል 2020 መጀመሪያ ላይ ግን ጥቅም ላይ ሊውሉ እንደማይችሉ አሳውቃለች።
en-mt: Prime Minister MatoviÄ proposed that these be thrown into the Danube. According to AteÅŸ Kara, an employee of the Turkish Ministry of Health, the test kits Turkey bought from China had a "high error rate" and were "unusable".

sourceString: Testing, followed with quarantine of those who tested positive and tracing of those with whom the SARS-CoV-2 positive people had had contact, resulted in positive outcomes.
targetString: ምርመራ፣ ፖዘቲቭ የሆኑ ሰዎችን ለይቶ በማስቀመጥ እና SARS-CoV-2 ያለባቸውን ሰዎች መከታተል፣ አዎንታዊ የሆነ ውጤት እንዲፈጠር አድርጓል።
en-mt: Testing, isolating positive people and tracking people with SARS-CoV-2, has led to positive results.

sourceString: Researchers working in the Italian town of Vò, the site of the first COVID-19 death in Italy, conducted two rounds of testing on the entire population of about 3,400 people, about ten days apart.
targetString: በጣሊያን ከተማ VÃ² ውስጥ የሚሰሩ ተመራማሪዎች፣ ጣሊያን ውስጥ የመጀመሪያው የ COVID-19 ሞት የተመዘገበበት ስፍራ፣ በጠቅላላው 3,400 የሚሆነው ህዝብ ሁሉ ላይ በአስር ቀናት ልዩነት ውስጥ ሁለት ዙር ምርመራ አድርጓል።
en-mt: Researchers working in the Italian city of VÃ², the site of Italy's first recorded COVID-19 death, conducted two rounds of tests ten days apart on a total population of 3,400.

sourceString: About half the people testing positive had no symptoms, and all discovered cases were quarantined.
targetString: ፖዘቲቭ ከሆኑት ሰዎች ውስጥ ግማሽ የሚሆኑት ምንም አይነት ምልክት የላቸውም ነበር እንዲሁም ሁሉም የታወቁ ክስተቶች ለይቶ ማቆያ ውስጥ ነበሩ።
en-mt: Half of those who tested positive had no symptoms and all known cases were in quarantine.

sourceString: With travel to the commune restricted, this eliminated new infections completely.
targetString: ወደ ማህበረሰብ የሚደረግ ጉዞ ላይ ገደብ በመደረጉ ምክንያት አዳዲስ ኢንፌክሽኖችን ለማስቆም ተችሏል።
en-mt: Restrictions on community travel have stopped new infections.

sourceString: With aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, the 2020 coronavirus pandemic in Singapore has proceeded much more slowly than in other developed countries, but without extreme restrictions like forced closure of restaurants and retail establishments.
targetString: ከፍተኛ የሆነ የንክኪ መስመርን በመፈለግ፣ የጉዞ ገደቦችን በማድረግ እና ለይቶ በማቆየት የ 2020 ኮሮና ቫይረስ ወረርሽኝ ሲንጋፖር ውስጥ ከሌሎች ያደጉ ሃገሮች ይልቅ በጣም በዝቅተኛ ፍጥነት የተሰራጨ ሲሆን ነገር ግን በጣም ከባድ የሆነ ሬስቶራንቶችን እና የችርቻሮ ድርጅቶችን በግድ የመዝጋት ያሉ እርምጃዎች አልተወሰዱም።
en-mt: Due to high contact line tracing, travel restrictions and quarantine, the 2020 coronavirus outbreak has spread much slower in Singapore than in other developed countries, but no drastic measures such as forced restaurant and retail closures have been taken.

sourceString: Many events have been cancelled, and Singapore did start advising residents to stay at home on 28 March, but schools reopened on time after holiday break on 23 March.
targetString: ብዙ ኩነቶች የተሰረዙ ሲሆን፣ ሲንጋፖር ደግሞ ነዋሪዎችን እስከ ማርች 28 ድረስ ቤታቸው እንዲቆዩ ምክር መስጠት ጀመረች፤ ነገር ግን ትምህርት ቤቶች ከእረፍት ጊዜ በኋላ ማርች 23 ላይ ተከፍተዋል።
en-mt: Many events were cancelled, and Singapore began advising residents to stay at home until March 28; But schools reopened on March 23 after vacation.

sourceString: Several other countries have also managed the pandemic with aggressive contact tracing, inbound travel restrictions, testing, and quarantining, but with less aggressive lock-downs, such as Iceland and South Korea.
targetString: ሌሎች ብዙ ሀገሮች ከፍተኛ የሆነ የንክኪ ክትትል፣ የተገደበ ጉዞ፣ ምርመራ፣ ለይቶ ማቆየት በማድረግ ወረርሽኙን ለመቆጣጠር ችለዋል፤ ነገር ግን አነስተኛ የሆነ በአይስላንድ እና ደቡብ ኮርያ ውስጥ እንደተወሰደው መጠነኛ ሀገራዊ እንቅስቃሴ ገደብ በማድረግ ነው።
en-mt: Many other countries have managed to contain the outbreak through intensive contact tracing, restricted travel, testing, and quarantine; But a smaller one, like the one taken in Iceland and South Korea, is by restricting national activity.

sourceString: A statistical study has found that countries that have tested more, relative to the number of deaths, have much lower case fatality rates, probably because these countries are better able to detect those with only mild or no symptoms.
targetString: በስታቲስቲካዊ ጥናት መሠረት ከሞቱት ቁጥር አንፃር በበለጠ የበለጠ ምርመራ ያደረጉ ሀገሮች ምናልባት የመያዝ እድላቸው ዝቅተኛ ነው፣ ምናልባት እነዚህ አገራት ቀላል ወይም ምንም ምልክት የሌለባቸውን ለመለየት ስለሚችሉ ነው።
en-mt: Statistically, countries with more testing than deaths are likely to have lower rates of infection, perhaps because these countries are better able to identify those with mild or no symptoms.

sourceString: WHO recommends that countries that do not have testing capacity and national laboratories with limited experience on COVID-19 send their first five positives and the first ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of the 16 WHO reference laboratories for confirmatory testing.
targetString: WHO የምርመራ አቅም የሌላቸው ሀገራት እና ውስን የሆነ COVID-19 ን የመርመር ልምድ ያላቸው ብሄራዊ ቤተሙከራዎች የመጀመሪያዎቹን የ COVID-19 አምስት ፖዘቲቭ ናሙናዎች እና አስር አሉታዊ የCOVID-19 ናሙናዎች WHO ካሉት 16 የመመርመሪያ ማእከላት ውስጥ ወደ አንዱ በመላክ የማረጋጫ ምርመራ ያደርጉ ዘንድ ይመክራል።
en-mt: WHO recommends that countries without diagnostic capacity and national laboratories with limited experience in diagnosing COVID-19 send the first five positive COVID-19 samples and ten negative COVID-19 samples to one of WHO's 16 testing centers for confirmatory testing.

sourceString: Out of the 16 reference laboratories, 7 are in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in Australia.
targetString: ከ16 የጥቆማ ቤተሙከራዎች፣ 7ቱ እስያ ውስጥ፣ 5 አውሮፓ ውስጥ፣ 2 አፍሪካ ውስጥ 1 ሰሜን አሜሪካ ውስጥ እና 1 ደቡብ አሜሪካ ውስጥ እንዲሁም 1 አውስትራሊያ ውስጥ የሚገኙ ናቸው።
en-mt: Of the 16 recommended laboratories, 7 are located in Asia, 5 in Europe, 2 in Africa, 1 in North America and 1 in South America, and 1 in Australia.

sourceString: In the following chart, the column “Positive as % of tests” is influenced by the country's testing policy.
targetString: በሚቀጥለው ገበታ ላይ ከተመረመሩ ሰዎች መቶኛ አንጻር የፖዘቲቨ አምድ በአገሪቱ የምርመራ ፖሊሲ ተጽእኖ ሥር ይገኛል።
en-mt: In the next chart, in terms of the percentage of people tested, the positive column is under the influence of the country's testing policy.

sourceString: A country that only tests people admitted to hospitals will have a higher positive as % of tests than a country that tests all citizens, whether or not they are showing symptoms, other things being equal.
targetString: ሆስፒታል ውስጥ ያሉትን ሰዎች ብቻ የሚመረምር ሀገር ሙሉን ህዝባቸውን ከሚመረምሩ ውስጥ ከፍተኛ የፖዘቲቭ % የሚኖርባቸው ሲሆን ይህም ምልክት ቢኖርባቸውም ባይኖርባቸውም ሌሎች ነገሮች ሳይቀየሩ ማለት ነው።
en-mt: A country that only tests people in the hospital will have a higher % of positives than those that test their entire population, regardless of whether they have symptoms or not, all other things being equal.

sourceString: Hand washing (or handwashing), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning one's hands for the purpose of removing soil, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.
targetString: እጅ መታጠብ (ወይም እጅ ማፅዳት)፣ የእጅ ንፅህና ተብሎም የሚታወቅ ሲሆን አፈርን፣ ቅባቶችን፣ ረቂቅ ተሕዋስያንን ወይም ሌሎች አላስፈላጊ ነገሮችን ለማስወገድ የሚደረግ እጆችን የማፅዳት ተግባር ነው።
en-mt: Hand washing (or hand cleaning), also known as hand hygiene, is the act of cleaning the hands to remove dirt, grease, microorganisms, or other unwanted substances.

sourceString: Hand washing with soap consistently at certain "critical moments" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases, for example diarrhoea and cholera, which are transmitted through fecal–oral route.
targetString: በቀን ውስጥ በተወሰኑ “ወሳኝ ወቅቶች” እጅን በሳሙና መታጠብ የብዙ በሽታዎችን ስርጭት ይከላከላል፤ ለምሳሌ ያህል ተቅማጥ እና ኮሌራ ሰሲሀሆነኑ፣ እነዚህም ባልታጠቡ እጆች ወደ አፍ የሚተላለፉ ናቸው።
en-mt: Washing hands with soap at certain "critical times" during the day prevents the spread of many diseases; For example, diarrhea and cholera are sexually transmitted diseases, which are transmitted to the mouth by unwashed hands.

sourceString: People can also become infected with respiratory diseases such as influenza or the common cold, for example, if they do not wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (i.e., mucous membranes).
targetString: ለምሳሌ፡- አይኖቻቸውን፣ አፍንጫቸውን ወይም አፋቸውን ከመነካታቸው በፊት እጃቸውን ካልታጠቡ (ማለትም፣ የ mucous ሕብረ ሕዋስ) ሰዎች እንደ ኢንፍሉዌንዛ ወይም በተለመደው ጉንፋን በመሳሰሉት የመተንፈሻ አካላት በሽታ ሊይዙም ይችላሉ፣ ።
en-mt: For example, if people don't wash their hands before touching their eyes, nose, or mouth (ie, mucous tissue), people can catch a respiratory illness like influenza or the common cold.

sourceString: The five critical moments during the day where washing hands with soap is important include: before and after defecation, after cleaning a child's bottom or changing nappies, before feeding a child, before eating and before and after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: በቀኑ ውሎ ወቅት እጅን በሳሙና መታጠብ አስፈላጊ የሚሆንባቸው አምስቱ ወሳኝ አጋጣሚዎች የሚከተሉትን ያጠቃልላሉ፡ ሽንት ቤት ከመጸዳዳት በፊትና በኋላ፣ የህፃኑን የታችኛው ክፍል ካጸዱ በኋላ ወይም ዳይፐር ከቀየሩ በኋላ፣ ህፃኑን ከመመገብዎ በፊት እና ምግብ ከመብላትዎ በፊትና ምግብ ከማዘጋጀት ወይም ጥሬ ሥጋን፣ ዓሳን፣ ወይም የዶሮ ስጋ ከመንካትዎ በፊትና በኋላ።
en-mt: The five most important times to wash your hands with soap during the day include: before and after using the toilet, after cleaning the baby's bottom or changing a diaper, before feeding the baby and before eating and preparing food or touching raw meat, fish, or poultry. Later.

sourceString: If water and soap are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash.The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:
targetString: ውሃ እና ሳሙና ከሌሉ፣ እጆች በአመድ ሊጸዱ ይችላሉ። የዓለም ጤና ድርጅት እጆችን መታጠብን ይመክራል፡
en-mt: If soap and water are not available, hands can be cleaned with ash. The World Health Organization recommends washing hands:

sourceString: Before, during, and after preparing food.
targetString: ምግብን ከማዘጋጀት በፊት፣ ሲያዘጋጁ እና ካዘጋጁ በኋላ።
en-mt: Before, during and after preparing food.

sourceString: Before and after caring for a sick person.
targetString: የታመመ ሰውን ከመንከባከብ በፊት እና በኋላ።
en-mt: Before and after caring for a sick person.

sourceString: After changing the diapers or cleaning up a child who has used the toilet.
targetString: ዳይፐር ከቀየሩ ወይም መጸዳጃ ቤት ተጠቅሞ የወጣን ልጅ ካፀዱ በኋላ።
en-mt: After changing a diaper or cleaning up a child who has gone out to use the toilet.

sourceString: After blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
targetString: አፍንጫዎን ከጠረጉ፣ ካሳሉ ወይም ካስነጠሱ በኋላ።
en-mt: After you blow your nose, cough or sneeze.

sourceString: After touching animal, animal feed, or animal waste.
targetString: እንስሳ ከተካ፣ እንስሳን ከመመገብ ወይም የእንስሳ ቆሻሻ ከተነካ በኋላ።
en-mt: After handling an animal, feeding an animal or touching animal waste.

sourceString: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices related to medical procedures.
targetString: የሕክምና የእጅ ንጽሕና ከህክምና ሂደቶች ጋር የተዛመዱ የንጽህና አጠባበቅ ልምዶችን ያመለክታል።
en-mt: Medical hand hygiene refers to hygiene practices associated with medical procedures.

sourceString: Hand washing before administering medicine or medical care can prevent or minimize the spread of disease.
targetString: መድሃኒት ከመከታተል ወይም የህክምና እንክብካቤ ከማድረግ በፊት እጅን መታጠብ የበሽታ ስርጭትን ሊከላከል ወይም ሊቀንስ ይችላል።
en-mt: Washing hands before administering medication or providing medical care can prevent or reduce the spread of disease.

sourceString: The main medical purpose of washing hands is to cleanse the hands of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or other microorganisms that can cause disease) and chemicals which can cause harm or diseases.
targetString: እጅን የመታጠብ ዋናው የሕክምና ዓላማ በሽታ አምጪ ተሕዋስያን (ባክቴሪያ፣ ቫይረሶች ወይም በሽታ ሊያስከትሉ የሚችሉ ረቂቅ ተሕዋስያን) እንዲሁም ጉዳት ወይም በሽታ ሊያስከትሉ የሚችሉ ኬሚካሎችን ለማጽዳት ነው።
en-mt: The primary medical purpose of hand washing is to remove pathogens (bacteria, viruses, or disease-causing microorganisms) and chemicals that may cause injury or illness.

sourceString: This is especially important for people who handle food or work in the medical field, but also an important practice for the general public.
targetString: ይህ በተለይ ምግብን ለሚያዘጋጁ ወይም በሕክምና መስክ ለሚሰሩ ሰዎች በጣም አስፈላጊ ቢሆንም ለአጠቃላይ ህዝብም ጠቃሚ የሆነ ልምድ ነው።
en-mt: This is especially important for those who prepare food or work in the medical field, but it is also a useful experience for the general public.

sourceString: Hand washing has many health benefits, including minimizing the spread of influenza, coronavirus, and other infectious diseases; preventing infectious causes of diarrhea; decreasing respiratory infections;
targetString: እጅ መታጠብ የኢንፍሉዌንዛ ስርጭትን፣ ኮሮና ቫይረስን እና ሌሎች ተላላፊ በሽታዎችን መቀነስ፤ የተቅማጥ ተላላፊ መንስኤዎችን መከላከል፤ የመተንፈሻ አካላት ኢንፌክሽኖች መቀነስ ጨምሮ በርካታ የጤና ጠቀሜታዎች አሉት፤
en-mt: Hand washing can reduce the spread of influenza, coronavirus and other infectious diseases; Prevention of infectious causes of diarrhea; It has many health benefits including reducing respiratory infections;

sourceString: and reducing infant mortality rate at home birth deliveries.
targetString: እና የቤት ውስጥ ማዋለድ ላይ የጨቅላ ህጻናትን ሞት ለመቀነስ እቅድ ይዛለች።
en-mt: And she plans to reduce infant mortality in home births.

sourceString: A 2013 study showed that improved hand washing practices may lead to small improvements in the length growth in children under five years of age.
targetString: በ 2013 የተደረገ አንድ ጥናት እንዳመለከተው የተሻሻሉ የእጅ መታጠብ ልማዶች ከአምስት ዓመት በታች ለሆኑ ሕፃናት ቁመት መጨመር ጥቃቅን መሻሻሎችን ሊያስገኙ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: A 2013 study found that improved handwashing habits may lead to small improvements in height in children under five.

sourceString: In developing countries, childhood mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes, such as hand washing with soap.
targetString: በማደግ ላይ ባሉ አገሮች ከመተንፈሻ አካላት እና ከተቅማጥ በሽታዎች ጋር የተዛመዱ የሕፃናት ሞት መጠንን እጅን በሳሙና እንደመታጠብ ያሉ ቀላል የባህሪ ለውጦችን በማስተዋወቅ መቀነስ ይቻላል።
en-mt: In developing countries, child mortality rates related to respiratory and diarrheal diseases can be reduced by introducing simple behavioral changes such as hand washing with soap.

sourceString: This simple action can reduce the rate of mortality from these diseases by almost 50%.
targetString: ይህ ቀላል የሆነ እርምጃ በእነዚህ በሽታዎች ምክንያት የሚከሰተውን የሞት መጠን በ 50% ያህል ሊቀንስ ይችላል።
en-mt: This simple step can reduce the death rate from these diseases by as much as 50%.

sourceString: Interventions that promote hand washing can reduce diarrhoea episodes by about a third, and this is comparable to providing clean water in low income areas.
targetString: እጅ መታጠብን የሚያስተዋውቁ ጣልቃ ገብነቶች የተቅማጥ ሁኔታዎችን አንድ ሦስተኛ ያህል መቀነስ የሚችሉ ሲሆን ይህ ደግሞ ዝቅተኛ ገቢ ላላቸው አካባቢዎች የንፁህ ውሃ አቅርቦት ከመስጠት ጋር ይነፃፀራል።
en-mt: Interventions that promote handwashing can reduce diarrhea cases by a third, compared to providing access to clean water in low-income areas.

sourceString: 48% of reductions in diarrhoea episodes can be associated with hand washing with soap.Hand washing with soap is the single most effective and inexpensive way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI), as automatic behavior performed in homes, schools, and communities worldwide.
targetString: የተቅማጥ ድግግሞሾችን 48% ቅነሳ እጅን በሳሙና ከመታጠብ ጋር ሊያያዝ ይችላል። በቤት ውስጥ፣ በት/ቤቶች እና በዓለም ዙሪያ ባሉ ማኅበረሰቦች ውስጥ የተከሰቱትን ተቅማጥ እና አጣዳፊ የመተንፈሻ አካላት ኢንፌክሽኖችን (ARI) ለመከላከል በሳሙና መታጠብ ብቸኛው በጣም ውጤታማ እና ቀላል የሆነ መንገድ ነው።
en-mt: A 48% reduction in diarrhea frequency can be attributed to handwashing with soap. Washing with soap is the single most effective and simple way to prevent diarrhea and acute respiratory infections (ARI) in homes, schools, and communities around the world.

sourceString: Pneumonia, a major ARI, is the number one cause of mortality among children under five years old, taking the lives of an estimated 1.8 million children per year.
targetString: የሳንባ ምች በሽታ ዋነኛ ARI ሲሆን በዓመት በግምት 1.8 ሚሊዮን የሚሆኑ እድሜያቸው ከአምስት ዓመት በታች የሆኑ ሕፃናትን ህይወት በመቅጠፍ አንደኛው ደረጃ የሞት መንስኤ ነው።
en-mt: Pneumonia is the leading ARI and the number one cause of death, killing approximately 1.8 million children under the age of five each year.

sourceString: Diarrhea and pneumonia together account for almost 3.5 million child deaths annually.
targetString: በተቅማጥ እና የሳምባ ምች ሳቢያ በየዓመቱ ወደ 3.5 ሚሊዮን የሚጠጉ ሕፃናት ይሞታሉ።
en-mt: About 3.5 million children die each year from diarrhea and pneumonia.

sourceString: According to UNICEF, turning hand washing with soap before eating and after using the toilet into an ingrained habit can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, cutting deaths from diarrhea by almost half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by one-quarter.
targetString: በዩኒሴፍ መሰረት፣ ከመመገብዎ በፊት እና መጸዳጃውን በተለመደ ልማድ ከተጠቀሙ በኋላ እጅን በሳሙና መታጠብ ከማንኛውም ብቸኛ ክትባት ወይም የህክምና ጣልቃ ገብነት የበለጠ ህይወትን ሊያድን፣ በተቅማጥ ምክንያት የሚሞቱትን ግማሽ ያህሉን ለቀንስ እና በከባድ የመተንፈሻ አካል ኢንፌክሽን ምክንያት የሚከሰተውን ሞት ደግሞ በአንድ አራተኛ ሊቀንስ ይችላል።
en-mt: According to UNICEF, washing hands with soap before eating and after using the toilet regularly can save more lives than any single vaccine or medical intervention, reduce deaths from diarrhea by half and deaths from acute respiratory infections by a quarter.

sourceString: Hand washing is usually integrated together with other sanitation interventions as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programmes.
targetString: እጅ መታጠብ አብዛኛውን ጊዜ እንደ የውሃ፣ የአካባቢ ጽዳትና የግል ንፅህና (WASH) ፕሮግራሞች አካል ሆኖ ከሌሎች የንፅህና አጠባበቅ እርምጃዎች ጋር ይቀናጃል።
en-mt: Handwashing is often integrated with other hygiene measures as part of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) programs.

sourceString: Hand washing also protects against impetigo which is transmitted through direct physical contact.
targetString: በተጨማሪም እጅን መታጠብ በአካላዊ ቀጥተኛ ግንኙነት በኩል ከሚተላለፈው ተላላፊ የቆዳ በሽታ ይከላከላል።
en-mt: In addition, hand washing protects against infectious skin diseases that are transmitted through direct physical contact.

sourceString: A small detrimental effect of hand washing is that frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.
targetString: በእጅ መታጠብ ላይ ያለው አነስተኛ ጉዳት በተደጋጋሚ እጅን መታጠብ በቆዳ መድረቅ ምክንያት ወደቆዳ መጎዳት ሊያመራ ይችላል።
en-mt: Less Damage to Hand Washing Frequent hand washing can lead to skin damage due to drying of the skin.

sourceString: A 2012 Danish study found that excessive hand washing can lead to an itchy, flaky skin condition known as hand eczema or hand dermatitis, which is especially common among health-care workers.
targetString: በ 2012 በዴንማርክ የተደረገ ጥናት እንዳመለከተው ከመጠን በላይ እጅ መታጠብ እጅን ማሳከክ ወይም እጅን ማሳከክ ተብሎ የሚጠራ የቆዳ በሽታ ሊያስከትል ይችላልል፣ ይህም ደግሞ በተለይም በጤና እንክብካቤ ሰጪ ሰራተኞች ዘንድ በጣም የተለመደ ነው።
en-mt: A 2012 study in Denmark found that excessive hand washing can lead to a skin condition called itchy hands, or itchy hands, which is especially common among healthcare workers.

sourceString: Too frequent hand washing is also seen as one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).
targetString: እጅን በጣም ደጋግሞ መታጠብ ከልክ በላይ-የመረበሽ በሽታ (OCD) ምልክቶችም ውስጥ አንዱ ነው።
en-mt: Excessive hand washing is also one of the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

sourceString: There are five critical times during the day where washing hands with soap is important to reduce fecal-oral transmission of disease: after using the bathroom (urination, defecation), after cleaning a child's bottom (changing nappies), before feeding a child, before eating and before/after preparing food or handling raw meat, fish, or poultry.
targetString: በበሽታ የመያዝን ስርጭትን ለመቀነስ በቀን ወቅት በሳሙና መታጠብ አስፈላጊ የሚሆንበት አምስት ወሳኝ ጊዜያት አሉ፥ የመታጠቢያ ክፍልን (ሽንት፣ ሰገራ) ከተጠቀሙ በኋላ፣ የሕፃኑን የታችኛው ክፍል ካጸዱ (ንጽህና መጠበቅያ መቀየር) በኋላ፣ ህፃኑን ከመመገብዎ በፊት፣ ምግብ ከመመገብዎ በፊት እና ምግብ ከመዘጋጀትዎ ወይም ጥሬ ሥጋ፣ ዓሳ ወይም የዶሮ ስጋ ከመያዝዎ በፊት/በኋላ።
en-mt: To reduce the spread of infection, there are five critical times during the day when washing with soap is important: after using the bathroom (urine, stool), after cleaning the baby's bottom (changing diapers), before feeding the baby, before eating and before preparing food or raw meat. Before/after eating fish or poultry.

sourceString: Other occasions when correct handwashing technique should be practiced in order to prevent the transmission of disease include before and after treating a cut or wound; after sneezing, coughing, or blowing your nose; after touching animal waste or handling animals; and after touching garbage.
targetString: በሌላ መልኩ የተቆረጠ አካልን ወይም ቁስልን ከማከም በፊት እና በኋላ፤ ካስነጠሱ፤ ካሳለፉ ወይም አፍንጫዎን ካናፈጡ በኋላ፤ የእንስሳትን ቆሻሻ ከተነኩ ወይም እንስሳትን ከያዙ በኋላ እና ቆሻሻን ከነኩ በኋላ ያለውን ጨምሮ የበሽታ ስርጭትን ለመከላከል ትክክለኛውን የእጅ መታጠብ ዘዴ መለማመድ ያስፈልጋል። ።
en-mt: Before and after treating a cut or wound in any other way; If you sneeze. After you sneeze or blow your nose; Proper hand washing practices should be practiced to prevent the spread of disease, including after touching animal waste or handling animals and after touching waste. .

sourceString: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.
targetString: በብዙ አገራት ውስጥ፥ ዝቅተኛ እጅን በሳሙና የመታጠብ መጠን ነው ያለው።
en-mt: In many countries, there is a low rate of hand washing with soap.

sourceString: A study of hand washing in 54 countries in 2015 found that on average, 38.7% of households practiced hand washing with soap.A 2014 study showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest rate of 97 percent; the United States near the middle with 77 percent; and China with the lowest rate of 23 percent.Several behaviour change methodologies now exist to increase uptake of the behaviour of hand washing with soap at the critical times.Group hand washing for school children at set times of the day is one option in developing countries to engrain hand washing in children's behaviors.
targetString: እ.ኤ.አ. በ 2015 በ 54 አገራት ውስጥ እጅን መታጠብ ላይ የተደረገው ጥናት እንዳመለከተው በአማካይ 38.7% አባወራዎች በቤት ውስጥ እጅ የመታጠብ ልማድ አላቸው። እ.ኤ.አ. በ 2014 የተደረገ ጥናት ሳዑዲ ዓረቢያ ከፍተኛው የ 97 በመቶ ድርሻ እንዳላት ያሳያል። ከመካከለኛው ቅርብ በሆነ መልኩ አሜሪካ በ 77 በመቶ ሲሆን እንዲሁም እና የቻይና ዝቅተኛው 23 በመቶ ነው። በአስቸጋሪ ጊዜያት እጅን በሳሙና መታጠብ ባህሪን ከፍ ለማድረግ በአሁኑ ወቅት በርካታ የባህሪ ለውጥ ዘዴዎች አሉ። በታዳጊ ሃገራት በትምህርት ቤት ውስጥ ለሚገኙ ልጆች የቡድን እጅ መታጠብ በልጆች ባህርያት ውስጥ እጅ መታጠብን ለማስረጽ የሚረዳ አንዱ አማራጭ ነው።
en-mt: In the year According to the 2015 study on hand washing in 54 countries, an average of 38.7% of households practice hand washing at home. In the year A 2014 survey showed that Saudi Arabia had the highest share of 97 percent. Closer to the median is the US at 77 percent, and China at a low of 23 percent. There are a number of behavior change strategies currently available to increase hand washing behavior during difficult times. Group hand washing for school children in developing countries is one option to help inculcate hand washing habits in children.

sourceString: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is an example of at scale action to promote children's health and education.
targetString: በፊሊፒንስ ውስጥ በትምህርት መምሪያ የተተገረበው “አስፈላጊ የጤና እንክብካቤ ፕሮግራም” የልጆችን ጤና እና ትምህርት ለማሳደግ በድርጊት ደረጃ እንደ አብነት ያህል የሚጠቀስ ነው።
en-mt: The "Essential Health Care Program" implemented by the Department of Education in the Philippines is cited as a model in action to promote children's health and education.

sourceString: Deworming twice a year, supplemented with washing hands daily with soap, brushing teeth daily with fluoride, is at the core of this national program.
targetString: ዘወትር በሳሙና በመታጠብ እጆችን መታጠብ፣ ጥርስዎትን ዘወትር በፍሎራይድ በመቦረሽ ጀርምን ማጥፋት በሚል መፈክር በአመት ሁለት ጊዜ ማሳወቅ የዚህ ብሄራዊ መርሃ-ግብር ዋና አላማ ነው።
en-mt: The main objective of this national program is to inform twice a year with the slogan of washing your hands with soap and brushing your teeth with fluoride regularly to kill germs.

sourceString: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.
targetString: በኢንዶኔዥያም በተሳካ ሁኔታ ተግባር ላይ ውሏል።
en-mt: It has also been successfully implemented in Indonesia.

sourceString: Removal of microorganisms from skin is enhanced by the addition of soaps or detergents to water.
targetString: ረቂቅ ተሕዋስያንን ከቆዳ ላይ ማስወገድ ሳሙናዎች ወይም ፈሳሽ ሳሙናዎች ላይ ውሃ በመጨመር ይሻሻላል።
en-mt: Removal of microorganisms from the skin is improved by adding water to soaps or liquid soaps.

sourceString: The main action of soaps and detergents is to reduce barriers to solution, and increase solubility.
targetString: የሳሙናዎች እና ፈሳሽ ማጠቢያዎች ዋና ተግባር የመፍትሄ መሰናክሎችን ለመቀነስ እና መሟሟትን መጨመር ነው።
en-mt: The main function of soaps and detergents is to reduce solution barriers and increase solubility.

sourceString: Water alone is an inefficient skin cleanser because fats and proteins, which are components of organic soil, are not readily dissolved in water.
targetString: የኦርጋኒክ አፈር አካላት የሆኑት ቅባቶች እና ፕሮቲኖች በቀላሉ በውሃ መወገድ ስለማይችሉ ውሃ ብቻውን በቂ ያልሆነ ቆዳ ማፅጃ ነው።
en-mt: The lipids and proteins that make up organic soil cannot be easily removed by water, so water alone is not an adequate skin cleanser.

sourceString: Cleansing is, however, aided by a reasonable flow of water..
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ ማፅዳት በተመጣጣኝ የውሃ ፍሰት የሚታገዝ ነው ..
en-mt: However, cleaning is aided by adequate water flow.

sourceString: Solid soap, because of its reusable nature, may hold bacteria acquired from previous uses.
targetString: ደረቅ ሳሙና፣ እንደገና ጥቅም ላይ ሊውል ስለሚችል ከቀድሞው አጠቃቀም የተገኙ ባክቴሪያዎችን ሊይዝ ይችላል።
en-mt: Dry soap, which can be reused, may contain bacteria from previous use.

sourceString: A small number of studies which have looked at the bacterial transfer from contaminated solid soap have concluded transfer is unlikely as the bacteria are rinsed off with the foam.
targetString: በተበከለ ጠንካራ ሳሙና የባክቴሪያ ዝውውርን የቃኙት ጥቂት ጥናቶች ተህዋሲያንን ከአረፋው ስለሚፀዱ ብዙም ችግር እንደማያመጡ ድምዳሜ ላይ ደርሰዋል።
en-mt: The few studies that have looked at the transfer of bacteria through contaminated solid soaps have concluded that they do not cause much of a problem as they clean the bacteria from the lather.

sourceString: The CDC still states "liquid soap with hands-free controls for dispensing is preferable".
targetString: CDC አሁንም ቢሆን “ከእጅ ንክኪ ነፃ የሆኑ መቆጣጠሪያዎችን ለማሰራጨት ፈሳሽ ሳሙና ተመራጭ ነው” ይላል።
en-mt: The CDC still says, "Liquid soap is preferred for hand-free dispensing."

sourceString: Antibacterial soaps have been heavily promoted to a health-conscious public.
targetString: የፀረ-ባክቴሪያ ሳሙናዎች የጤናማ ልማዶችን በሚረዳ ህብረተሰብ ውስጥ በሰፊው እንዲስፋፉ ተደርጓል።
en-mt: Antibacterial soaps have become widely available in a health conscious society.

sourceString: To date, there is no evidence that using recommended antiseptics or disinfectants selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms in nature.
targetString: እስከዛሬ ድረስ፣ የሚመከሩ ፀረ-ተሕዋስያን ወይም ፀረ-ተሕዋሲያን መጠቀም በተፈጥሮ ውስጥ አንቲባዮቲክን የመቋቋም ችሎታ ያላቸው ህዋሳትን ይመርጣል የሚል ማስረጃ የለም።
en-mt: To date, there is no evidence that the use of recommended antimicrobials or antimicrobials naturally selects for antibiotic-resistant organisms.

sourceString: However, antibacterial soaps contain common antibacterial agents such as triclosan, which has an extensive list of resistant strains of organisms.
targetString: ሆኖም የፀረ-ባክቴሪያ ሳሙናዎች እንደ ትሪኮን ያሉ የተለመዱ የፀረ-ባክቴሪያ ተሸካሚ ይዘዋል፣ ይህም የሕዋሳትን መጠነ ሰፊ ዝርዝር የያዘ ነው።
en-mt: However, antibacterial soaps contain a common antibacterial carrier such as Tricon, which contains a broad spectrum of bacteria.

sourceString: So, even if antibiotic resistant strains aren't selected for by antibacterial soaps, they might not be as effective as they are marketed to be.
targetString: ስለዚህ፣ ምንም እንኳን አንቲባዮቲክ ተከላካይ ዓይነቶች በፀረ-ባክቴሪያ ሳሙናዎች ካልተመረጡ እንደታሳቡት ውጤታማ ላይሆኑ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Therefore, even antibiotic-resistant strains may not be as effective as intended if they are not selected by antibacterial soaps.

sourceString: Besides the surfactant and skin-protecting agent, the sophisticated formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) as pH regulator, antimicrobially active benzoic acid and further skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, plant extracts).A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health indicated that plain soaps are as effective as consumer-grade anti-bacterial soaps containing triclosan in preventing illness and removing bacteria from the hands.
targetString: ከቆዳ መከላከል ኤጄንት በተጨማሪ የተራቀቁ ቅጾች እንደ ፒኤች ተቆጣጣሪ፣ ፀረ-ተሕዋስያን ንቁ የቤንዚክ አሲድ እና ተጨማሪ የቆዳ ማቀዝቀዣዎች (አሎእቨራ፣ ቫይታሚኖች፣ መንቶል፣ የእፅዋት ተዋፅ )ዎች) አሲዶች (አሲቲክ አሲድ፣ አስኮርብክ አሲድ፣ ላቲክ አሲድ) ሊኖራቸው ይችላል። ከኦሪገን የህዝብ ጤና ትምህርት ቤት ዩኒቨርስቲ የተገኘ አጠቃላይ ትንታኔ እንዳመለከተው ግልፅ ሳሙናዎች ህመምን ለመከላከል እና ባክቴሪያዎችን ከእሳት በማስወጣት ተሸካሚዎችን እንደያዙ ፀረ-ባክቴሪያ ሳሙናዎች ያህል ውጤታማ ናቸው።
en-mt: In addition to skin protection agents, advanced formulations may contain acids (acetic acid, ascorbic acid, lactic acid) such as pH regulator, antimicrobial active benzoic acid and additional skin conditioners (aloe vera, vitamins, menthol, herbal extracts). A comprehensive analysis from the University of Oregon School of Public Health found that clear soaps are just as effective as antibacterial soaps that contain carriers at preventing illness and removing bacteria from burns.

sourceString: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.
targetString: እጅን ለመታጠብ ምቹ የሆነ ሙቅ ውሃ ባክቴሪያን ለመግደል በበቂ መጠን ሙቅ አይደለም።
en-mt: Hot water that is comfortable for washing hands is not hot enough to kill bacteria.

sourceString: Bacteria grow much faster at body temperature (37 °C).
targetString: ባክቴሪያ በሰውነት ሙቀት (37 °C) በጣም በፍጥነት ያድጋል።
en-mt: Bacteria grow most rapidly at body temperature (37 °C).

sourceString: However, warm, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing natural oils which hold soils and bacteria.
targetString: ይሁን እንጂ፣ ሞቃታማ እና ሳሙና ውሃ አፈሩን እና ባክቴሪያዎችን የሚይዙትን የተፈጥሮ ዘይቶች በማስወገድ ረገድ ከቅዝቃዛ፣ የሳሙና ውሃ የበለጠ ውጤታማ ነው።
en-mt: However, hot, soapy water is more effective than cold, soapy water at removing the natural oils that hold dirt and bacteria.

sourceString: Contrary to popular belief however, scientific studies have shown that using warm water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on hands.
targetString: ሆኖም፣ ከታዋቂ እምነት በተቃራኒ የሳይንሳዊ ጥናቶች እንደሚያሳዩት ሙቅ ውሃን በእጃችን ላይ የማይክሮባያል ጫና ለመቀነስ ምንም ውጤት የለውም።
en-mt: However, contrary to popular belief, scientific studies show that hot water has no effect on reducing the microbial load on our hands.

sourceString: A hand sanitizer or hand antiseptic is a non-water-based hand hygiene agent.
targetString: የእጅ ማፅጃ ወይም የእጅ ፀረተባይ በውሃ ላይ ያልተመሠረተ የእጅ ንፅህና ሌላኛው አማራጭ ነው።
en-mt: Hand sanitizer or hand sanitizer is another option for non-water-based hand hygiene.

sourceString: In the late 1990s and early part of the 21st century, alcohol rub non-water-based hand hygiene agents (also known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.
targetString: በ 1990ዎቹ መገባደጃ እና በ21 ኛው ክፍለ ዘመን መጀመሪያ አካባቢ የአልኮል እና ውሃ-ነክ ያልሆኑ የእጅ ንጽህና አማራጮች (አልኮል ነክ የእጅ ማበሻዎች፣ አንቲሴፕቲክ የእጅ ማበሻዎች፣ ወይም የእጅ ማፅጃዎች በመባል የሚታወቁ) ታዋቂነት ማግኘት ጀመሩ።
en-mt: In the late 1990s and early 21st century, alcohol- and water-free hand hygiene alternatives (known as alcohol-based hand rubs, antiseptic hand rubs, or hand sanitizers) began to gain popularity.

sourceString: Most are based on isopropyl alcohol or ethanol formulated together with a thickening agent such as Carbomer (polymer of acrylic acid) into a gel, or a humectant such as glycerin into a liquid, or foam for ease of use and to decrease the drying effect of the alcohol.
targetString: አብዛኛዎቹ የተመሰረቱት እንደ ካርቦመር (የኦክለሪክ አሲድ ፖሊመር) ካለው ወፍራም ወኪል ጋር ወደ ጄል፣ ወይም እንደ ግሊሰሪን ፈሳሽ፣ ወይም በአቧራ ለመጠቀም እና የአልኮል ማድረቅ አጠቃቀም ለመቀነስ ተፅእኖን ለመቀነስ ነው።
en-mt: Most of them are formulated with a thickening agent such as carbomer (a polymer of oleic acid) to gel, or as a liquid glycerine, or to use as a dust and to reduce the use of alcohol drying.

sourceString: Adding diluted hydrogen-peroxide increases further  the antimicrobial activity.Hand sanitizers containing a minimum of 60 to 95% alcohol are efficient germ killers.
targetString: የተደባለቀ የሃይድሮጂን ፐርኦክሳይድን መጨመር የፀረ-ተህዋሲያን እንቅስቃሴን ይበልጠ ይጨምራል። ቢያንስ ከ 60 እስከ 95% የሚሆነውን አልኮል የያዙ የእጅ ሳኒታይዘሮች ውጤታማ የጀርም ገዳይ ናቸው።
en-mt: Addition of diluted hydrogen peroxide further increases the antimicrobial activity. Hand sanitizers that contain at least 60 to 95% alcohol are effective germ killers.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers kill bacteria, multi-drug resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis, and some viruses (including HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza, and hepatitis) and fungi.
targetString: የአልኮል ማበሻ ንፅህና መጠበቂያዎች ባክቴሪያዎችን፣ በርካታ መድኃኒቶችን የሚቋቋሙ ባክቴሪያዎችን (MRSA እና VRE)፣ ሳንባ ነቀርሳን እና አንዳንድ ቫይረሶችን (ኤች አይ ቪ፣ ሄርፒስ፣ RSV፣ rhinovirus፣ ክትባት፣ ኢንፍሉዌንዛ እና ሄፓታይተስ) እና ፈንገሶችን ይገድላሉ።
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers kill bacteria, multidrug-resistant bacteria (MRSA and VRE), tuberculosis and some viruses (HIV, herpes, RSV, rhinovirus, vaccinia, influenza and hepatitis) and fungi.

sourceString: Alcohol rub sanitizers containing 70% alcohol kill 99.97% (3.5 log reduction, similar to 35 decibel reduction) of the bacteria on hands 30 seconds after application and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of the bacteria on hands 1 minute after application.Hand sanitizers are most effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.
targetString: 70% አልኮል ያላቸው የአልኮል ማበሻዎች በእጆች ላይ ከተደረጉ ከ 30 ሰከንዶች በኋላ በባክቴሪያን ከእጆች ላይ (3.5 ምዝግብ ቅነሳ፣ ከ 35 ዴሲቤል ጋር በሚመሳሰል መልኩ) 99.97% ስወግዳል እንዲሁም ከ 99.99% እስከ 99.999% (ከ 4 እስከ 5 ምዝግብ መቀነስ) 7ባክቴርያን ከእጆች ላይ በ 1 ደቂቃ ያስወግዳል። የእጅ ማፅጃዎች ባክቴሪያ ለመከላከል በጣም ውጤታማ ሲሆኑ በአንዳንድ ቫይረሶች ላይ ደግሞ አነስተኛ ውጤታማ ናቸው።
en-mt: 70% alcohol-based hand rubs removed 99.97% of bacteria from hands (3.5 log reduction, equivalent to 35 decibels) after 30 seconds, and 99.99% to 99.999% (4 to 5 log reduction) of bacteria from hands. Removes 1 minute. Hand sanitizers are very effective against bacteria and less effective against some viruses.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are almost entirely ineffective against norovirus (or Norwalk) type viruses, the most common cause of contagious gastroenteritis.Enough hand antiseptic or alcohol rub must be used to thoroughly wet or cover both hands.
targetString: የአልኮል ይዘት ያላቸው የእጅ ማፅጃዎች በተለምዶ በጣም ተላላፊ የሆድ እቃ ህመም መንስኤ የሆነውን የቫይረስ በሽታን (ወይም ኖርዌክክ) ቫይረሶችን ለማስወገድ ሙሉ በሙሉ ውጤታማ አይደሉም። የእጅ አንቲሴፕቲክ ወይም በአልኮል መታጠብ ሁለቱንም እጆች በደንብ ለማድረቅ ወይም ለመሸፈን ጥቅም ላይ መዋል አለበት።
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers are not completely effective at removing the common viral distemper (or Norvek) virus, which is the most common cause of gastroenteritis. Hand antiseptic or rubbing alcohol should be used to thoroughly dry or cover both hands.

sourceString: The front and back of both hands and between and the ends of all fingers are rubbed for approximately 30 seconds until the liquid, foam or gel is dry.
targetString: የሁሉም ጣቶች የፊት እና የኋላ እና የሁሉም ጣቶች መጨረሻ ፈሳሽ፣ አረፋ ወይም ጄል እስኪደርቅ ድረስ ለ 30 ሰከንድ ያህል ይቀባሉ።
en-mt: Apply the liquid, foam or gel to the front and back of all toes and the ends of all toes for about 30 seconds until it dries.

sourceString: Finger tips must be washed well too, rubbing them in both palms.The US Center for Disease Control and Prevention recommends hand washing over hand sanitizer rubs, particularly when hands are visibly dirty.
targetString: የጣት ጫፎችም ሁለቱምም መዳፎች በመፋተግ በጥሩ ሁኔታ መታጠብ አለባቸው። የአሜሪካ የበሽታ መቆጣጠሪያ እና መከላከል ማዕከል በተለይ እጅ መቆሸሹ ግልጽ በሚሆንበት ጊዜ የእጅ ሳኒታይዘር መፈተጊያ መጠቀምን ይመክራል።
en-mt: Fingertips and both palms should be scrubbed well. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends using hand sanitizer, especially when hands are visibly soiled.

sourceString: The increasing use of these agents is based on their ease of use and rapid killing activity against micro-organisms; however, they should not serve as a replacement for proper hand washing unless soap and water are unavailable.
targetString: የእነዚህ ወኪሎች አጠቃቀም መጨመረ የመጣው በአጠቃቀም ቀላልነታቸው እና በጥቃቅን ፍጥረታት ላይ ፈጣን የመግደል እንቅስቃሴ ላይ የተመሠረተ ስለሆነ ነው፤ ሆኖም ሳሙና እና ውሃ የማይገኙ እስካልሆኑ ድረስ ለተገቢ እጅ መታጠብ ምትክ ሆነው ማገልገል የለባቸውም።
en-mt: The increased use of these agents is due to their ease of use and rapid killing activity against microorganisms; However, unless soap and water are available, they should not serve as a substitute for proper hand washing.

sourceString: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers can cause dry skin unless emollients and/or skin moisturizers are added to the formula.
targetString: በአልኮል ላይ የተመሰረቱ የእጅ ማፅጃዎች አዘውትረው መጠቀም ማለሽለሻ ቅባቶች እና/ወይም የቆዳ ማርጠቢያዎች ወደ ቀመሩ ካልተካተቱ ደረቅ ቆዳን ሊያስከትሉ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Frequent use of alcohol-based hand sanitizers that do not include emollients and/or moisturizers can cause dry skin.

sourceString: The drying effect of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.
targetString: የአልኮል ማድረቅ የሚያስከትለውን ውጤት ግሊሰሪን እና/ወይም ሌሎች ማለስለሻ ቅባቶች ወደ ቀመሩ በማከል መቀነስ ወይም ማስወገድ ይችላል።
en-mt: The drying effects of alcohol can be reduced or eliminated by adding glycerin and/or other emollients to the formula.

sourceString: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers containing emollients caused substantially less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial detergents.
targetString: በክሊኒካዊ ሙከራዎች ውስጥ አልኮል-ተኮር የእጅ ማፅጃዎች ሳሙናዎችን ወይም ፀረ-ተሕዋስያን ሳሙናዎችን በእጅጉ ያነሰ የቆዳ መቆጣትን እና መድረቅን አስከትለዋል።
en-mt: In clinical trials, alcohol-based hand sanitizers caused significantly less skin irritation and dryness than soaps or antimicrobial soaps.

sourceString: Allergic contact dermatitis, contact urticaria syndrome or hypersensitivity to alcohol or additives present in alcohol hand rubs rarely occur.
targetString: የአለርጂ ንክኪ የቆዳ በሽታ፣ የአጥንት በሽታ ወይም የአልኮል እጅ አለመጣጣም ወይም በአልኮል እጅ ማበሻያ ውስጥ ያሉ ይዘቶች ሳቢያ ወደ አለርጂነ ብዙም አይከሰትም።
en-mt: Allergic contact dermatitis, bone disease, or allergic reactions to alcohol hand sanitizers or the contents of alcohol hand sanitizers rarely lead to allergies.

sourceString: The lower tendency to induce irritant contact dermatitis became an attraction as compared to soap and water hand washing.
targetString: የሚያሳክኩ የቆዳ በሽታዎችን የመነካካት አዝማሚያ ከሳሙና እና ከውሃ እጅ መታጠብ ጋር ሲወዳደር አብላጫ አለው።
en-mt: The tendency to touch itchy skin conditions is greater when compared to hand washing with soap and water.

sourceString: Despite their effectiveness, non-water agents do not cleanse the hands of organic material, but simply disinfect them.
targetString: ምንም እንኳን ውጤታማነት ቢኖራቸውም፣ ውሃ የሌለባቸው ኤጄንቶች የኦርጋኒክ ቁሳቁሶችን እጆች አያጸዱም፣ ሆኖም በቀላሉ ያጠፋቸዋል።
en-mt: Despite their effectiveness, waterless agents do not clean hands of organic materials, but simply destroy them.

sourceString: It is for this reason that hand sanitizers are not as effective as soap and water at preventing the spread of many pathogens, since the pathogens still remain on the hands.
targetString: የእጅ ሳኒታይዘሮች የበርካታ በሽታ አምጪ ተህዋሲያንን ስርጭት በመከላከሉ ረገድ፣ ሳሙና እና ውሃ ብቁ አይደሉም የሚባለው በዚህ ምክንያት ነው፤ ይህምበሽታ አምጪ ተሃዋስያን አሁንም በእጅ ላይ ሊቆዩ ስለሚችሉ ነው።
en-mt: This is why hand sanitizers are said to be inferior to soap and water in preventing the spread of many pathogens. This is because pathogens can still remain on the hands.

sourceString: Alcohol-free hand sanitizer efficacy is heavily dependent on the ingredients and formulation, and historically has significantly under-performed alcohol and alcohol rubs.
targetString: ከአልኮል-ነፃ የሆነ የእጅ ሳኒታይዘር ውጤታማነት በግብዓቶችና በቅመማ ላይ በዋነኛነት የሚመሰረት ሲሆን፣ የብቃት ደረጃው-የወረደ አልኮልና የአልኮል መንከሪያዎች ያሉትም ነው።
en-mt: The effectiveness of alcohol-free hand sanitizers depends primarily on the ingredients and flavorings, and the effectiveness of alcohol-based hand sanitizers and alcohol-based hand sanitizers.

sourceString: More recently, formulations that use benzalkonium chloride have been shown to have persistent and cumulative antimicrobial activity after application, unlike alcohol, which has been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use, probably due to progressive adverse skin reactions.
targetString: በቅርቡ ደግሞ፣ ቤንዛክኒየም ክሎራይድን የሚጠቀሙ ቀመሮች ከተደጋገሙ በኋላ ውጤታማነት እየቀነሰ እየመጣ ከሚታየው አልኮል በተቃራኒ ቤንዛክኒየም ክሎራይድ የሚጠቀሙባቸው ቀመሮች ከቀጠለ በኋላ ውጤታማነት እየቀነሰ እንደመጣ ታይቷል።
en-mt: More recently, in contrast to alcohol, formulations using benzachnium chloride have been shown to decrease in efficacy after repeated use.

sourceString: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.
targetString: ዝቅተኛ-ገቢ ባላቸው ማኅበረሰቦች ውስጥ ያሉ በርካታ ሰዎች ሳሙና መግዛት እና በምትኩ አመድን ወይም አፈርን መጠቀም አይችሉም።
en-mt: Many people in low-income communities cannot afford soap and use ash or soil instead.

sourceString: Ash or soil may be more effective than water alone, but may be less effective than soap.
targetString: አመድ ወይም አፈሩ ከውኃ ብቻ የበለጠ ውጤታማ ሊሆን ይችላል፣ ሆኖም ከሳሙና ያነሰ ውጤታማ ሊሆን ይችላል።
en-mt: Ash or clay may be more effective than water alone, but less effective than soap.

sourceString: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with microorganisms it may increase the spread of disease rather than decrease it.
targetString: አንድ አሳሳቢ ነገር፥ አፈሩ ወይም አመዱ በደቂቅ ተህዋሲያን ከተበከለ በሽታን ከመቀነስ ይልቅ የበሽታ ስርጭትን ሊጨምር መቻሉ ነው።
en-mt: One concern is that if the soil or ash is contaminated with micro-organisms, it may increase the spread of disease rather than reduce it.

sourceString: Like soap, ash is also a disinfecting agent because in contact with water, it forms an alkaline solution.
targetString: እንደ ሳሙና ሁሉ፣ አመድ ደግሞ ከውሃ ጋር በተያያዘ የአልካላይን መፍትሄ ስለሚፈጥር ተባይ ማጥፊያ ወኪል ነው።
en-mt: Like soap, ash is a pesticidal agent because it forms an alkaline solution in contact with water.

sourceString: WHO recommended ash or sand as alternative to soap when soap is not available.
targetString: ሳሙና በማይኖርበት ጊዜ የአለም ጤና ድርጅት አመድ ወይም አሸዋ እንደ አማራጭ አሳሙና ይመክራል።
en-mt: When soap is not available, the World Health Organization recommends ash or sand as an alternative.

sourceString: Correct handwashing technique recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control  for prevention of transmission of disease includes the following steps:
targetString: የበሽታ ስርጭትን ለመከላከል በአሜሪካ የበሽታ መቆጣጠሪያ ማዕከላት የሚመከረው ትክክለኛው እጅ የመታጠቢያ ዘዴ የሚከተሉትን እርምጃዎች ያካትታል፡
en-mt: To prevent the spread of disease, proper hand washing techniques recommended by the US Centers for Disease Control include the following steps:

sourceString: Wet hands with warm or cold running water.
targetString: እጆችን በሞቀ ወይም በቀዝቃዛ ውሃ ያርሱ።
en-mt: Rinse hands with warm or cold water.

sourceString: Running water is recommended because standing basins may be contaminated, while the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.
targetString: የውሃ ገንዳዎች ሊበከሉ ስለሚችሉ ወራጅ ውሃ የሚመከር ሲሆን የይህ በእንዲህ እንዳለ የውሀው የሙቀት መጠን ልዩነት የሚያመጣ አይመስልም።
en-mt: Running water is recommended as swimming pools can become contaminated, meanwhile the temperature of the water does not seem to make a difference.

sourceString: Lather hands by rubbing them with a generous amount of soap, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.
targetString: የእጆችን ጀርባ፣ በጣቶች መካከል እና በጥፍሮች ስር ጨምሮ እጆችን በብዛት በሳሙና ይምቱ።
en-mt: Wash hands frequently, including the backs of hands, between fingers, and under nails.

sourceString: Soap lifts germs from the skin, and studies show that people tend to wash their hands more thoroughly when soap is used rather than water alone.
targetString: ሳሙና ጀርሞችን ከቆዳ ላይ የሚያነሳ ሲሆን ጥናቶች እንደሚያሳዩት ሰዎች በውሃ ብቻውን ይልቅ ሳሙና በሚኖርበት ጊዜ እጆቻቸውን በደንብ ያጥባሉ።
en-mt: Soap removes germs from the skin, and studies show that people wash their hands better with soap than with water alone.

sourceString: Scrub for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: ቢያንስ ለ 20 ሰከንዶች ይሹ።
en-mt: Wait for at least 20 seconds.

sourceString: Scrubbing creates friction, which helps remove germs from skin, and scrubbing for longer periods removes more germs.
targetString: ማሸት ጀርሞችን ከቆዳ ላይ ለማስወገድ የሚረዳ ፍትጊያን ይፈጥራል እንዲሁም ረዘም ላለ ጊዜ ማሸት ብዙ ጀርሞችን ያስወግዳል።
en-mt: Massage creates a solution that helps remove germs from the skin, and prolonged massage removes more germs.

sourceString: Rinse well under running water.
targetString: በወራጅ ውሃ በደንብ ይታጠቡ።
en-mt: Wash thoroughly with running water.

sourceString: Rinsing in a basin can recontaminate hands.
targetString: በገንዳ ውስጥ ማጠብ እጅን እንደገና ሊበክል ይችላል።
en-mt: Washing in the sink can re-contaminate hands.

sourceString: Dry with a clean towel or allow to air dry.
targetString: በንጹህ ፎጣ ያዳርቁ ወይም በነፋስ እንዲደርቅ ያድርጉ።
en-mt: Pat dry with a clean towel or let it air dry.

sourceString: Wet and moist hands are more easily recontaminated.The most commonly missed areas are the thumb, the wrist, the areas between the fingers, and under fingernails.
targetString: እርጥብ እና የወረዙ እጆች በበለጠ በቀላሉ በድጋሚ በተወዋህሲ የሚበከሉ ናቸው። በብዛት የሚረሱት አካባቢዎች አውራ ጣት፣ የእጅ አንጓ፣ በጣቶች መካከል ያሉ አከባቢዎች እና ከጣቶች ስር ናቸው።
en-mt: Wet and dirty hands are more prone to re-infection. The most commonly forgotten areas are the thumbs, wrists, areas between the fingers, and under the fingers.

sourceString: Artificial nails and chipped nail polish may harbor microorganisms.
targetString: ሰው ሰራሽ ጥፍሮች ና የተሰነጠቁ የጥፍር ቀለሞች ጥቃቅን ነፍሳትን ሊያስከትሉ ይችላሉ።
en-mt: Artificial nails and chipped nail polishes can cause tiny insects.

sourceString: Moisturizing lotion is often recommended to keep the hands from drying out; dry skin can lead to skin damage which can increase the risk for the transmission of infection.
targetString: እጆች እንዳይደርቁ ለመከላከል የማርጠቢያ ሎሽን መጠቀምን ይመከራል፤ ደረቅ ቆዳ ለበሽታ የመተላለፍ እድልን ሊጨምር ወደሚችል የቆዳ ጉዳት ሊያመራ ይችላል።
en-mt: It is recommended to use a moisturizing lotion to prevent hands from drying out. Dry skin can lead to skin damage that can increase the risk of infection.

sourceString: Various low-cost options can be made to facilitate hand washing where tap-water and/or soap is not available e.g. pouring water from a hanging jerrycan or gourd with suitable holes and/or using ash if needed in developing countries.In situations with limited water supply (such as schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-conserving solutions, such as "tippy-taps" and other low-cost options.
targetString: የቧንቧ ውሃ እና/ወይም ሳሙና በማይገኝበት ቦታ እጅ መታጠብን ለማመቻቸት የተለያዩ ዝቅተኛ-ወጭ ያላቸው አማራጮች ሊደረጉ ይችላሉ፣ ለምሳሌ፡- ከሚንጠለጠለው ከጄሪካን ወይም ከጉድጓዱ ተስማሚ ቀዳዳዎች ውሃ መቅዳት እና/ወይም በማደግ ላይ ባሉ አገራት አስፈላጊ ከሆነ አመድን መጠቀም። የውሃ አቅርቦት እጥረት ባለበት ሁኔታ (በማደግ ላይ ያሉ ሃገራት ውስጥ ልክ እንደ ትምህርተ ቤቶች ወይም ገጠራማ ቦታዎች)፣ "ቲፒይ-ታፕስ" እና ሌሎች አነስተኛ-ወጭ አማራጮች አይነት ውሃ-መቆጠቢያ አማራጮች አሉ።"
en-mt: Various low-cost options can be used to facilitate handwashing where running water and/or soap are not available, such as collecting water from hanging jerrycans or wells with suitable holes and/or using ash if necessary in developing countries. "In situations where water supply is scarce (such as in schools or rural areas in developing countries), there are water-saving options such as 'tipi-taps' and other low-cost options."

sourceString: A tippy-tap is a simple technology using a jug suspended by a rope, and a foot-operated lever to pour a small amount of water over the hands and a bar of soap.
targetString: ቲፒይ-ታፕ በገመድ የተወጠረ መንጠቆን በመጠቀምና ትንሽ ውሃ እና የሳሙና በርሜል በመጠቀም በእጆች የሚሰራ ቀለል ያለ ቴክኖሎጂ ነው።
en-mt: Tipi-Tap is a simple technique that is done by hand using a hook strung with a rope and a little water and a barrel of soap.

sourceString: Effective drying of the hands is an essential part of the hand hygiene process, but there is some debate over the most effective form of drying in public washrooms.
targetString: የእጆችን ውጤታማ ማድረቅ የእጅ ንፅህና ሂደት አስፈላጊ አካል ቢሆንም በሕዝብ መታጠቢያ ቤቶች ውስጥ በጣም ውጤታማ በሆነ መንገድ ማድረቅን በተመለከተ አንዳንድ ክርክር አለ።
en-mt: While effective hand drying is an important part of the hand hygiene process, there is some debate about the most effective way to dry hands in public bathrooms.

sourceString: A growing volume of research suggests paper towels are much more hygienic than the electric hand dryers found in many washrooms.
targetString: ቁጥሩ እየጨመረ የሚሄደው የምርምር መጠን የሚያመላክተው የወረቀት ፎጣዎች በብዙ የመታጠቢያ ቤቶች ውስጥ ከሚገኙት የኤሌክትሪክ እጅ ማድረቂያዎች የበለጠ ንፁህ መሆናቸውን ናቸው።
en-mt: A growing body of research indicates that paper towels are cleaner than the electric hand dryers found in many bathrooms.

sourceString: In 2008, a study was conducted by the University of Westminster, London, and sponsored by the paper-towel industry the European Tissue Symposium, to compare the levels of hygiene offered by paper towels, warm-air hand dryers and the more modern jet-air hand dryers.
targetString: በ 2008፣ በለንደን በዌስትሚኒስተር ዩኒቨርስቲ ውስጥ ጥናት የተካሄደ ሲሆን በወረቀት ፎጣዎች፣ በሙቅ አየር በእጅ ማድረቂያ እና በጣም ዘመናዊ የጄት-አየር የሚሰጡትን የንፅህና ደረጃዎች ደረጃ ለማነፃፀር በወረቀት ፎጣ ኢንዱስትሪ የተደገፈ በአውሮፓ ታሲስ ሲምፖዚየም የአየር እጅ ማድረቂያ ነው።
en-mt: In 2008, a study was conducted at the University of Westminster in London to compare the levels of hygiene provided by paper towels, hot air hand dryers and the most modern jet-air hand dryers, sponsored by the paper towel industry at the European Tacis Symposium Air Hand Dryer.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with the warm-air dryer, the total number of bacteria was found to increase on average on the finger pads by 194% and on the palms by 254%.
targetString: እጆችን ከታጠቡ እና በሞቃት-አየር ማድረቂያው ካደረቁ በኋላ የተገኘው ጠቅላላ የባክቴሪያ ብዛት በጣቶች ላይ በአማካይ በ 194% እና በእጆች ላይ ደግሞ 254% ጨምሯል።
en-mt: After washing hands and drying them in the hot-air dryer, the total bacterial count increased by an average of 194% on the fingers and 254% on the hands.

sourceString: Drying with the jet-air dryer resulted in an increase on average of the total number of bacteria on the finger pads by 42% and on the palms by 15%.
targetString: በጄት-አየር ማድረቂያው ማድረቅ ከጠቅላላው የባክቴሪያ ብዛት በአማካይ በጥፍር ፓዶች ላይ በ 42% እና በመዳፍ ደግሞ 15% ጭማሪ አሳይቷል።
en-mt: Drying with the jet-air dryer showed an average increase of 42% in the total bacterial count on the nail pads and 15% on the palms.

sourceString: After washing and drying hands with a paper towel, the total number of bacteria was reduced on average on the finger pads by up to 76% and on the palms by up to 77%.The scientists also carried out tests to establish whether there was the potential for cross contamination of other washroom users and the washroom environment as a result of each type of drying method.
targetString: እጆችን ከታጠቡ እና በወረቀት ፎጣ ካደረቁ በኋላ፣ አጠቃላይ የባክቴሪያ ቁጥር እስከ 76% በአማካይ በጣት ጣቶች ወደሚቆጠር ቀንሷል እና በእጆች መዳፍ ላይ እስከ 77% ቀንሷል። በእያንዳንዱ ዓይነት የማድረቂያ ዘዴ ምክንያት የሌሎች የመታጠቢያ ቤት ተጠቃሚዎች እና የመታጠቢያ ክፍል አከባቢን የመበከል ዕድል መኖር አለመኖሩን ለማጣራት በሚል ሳይንቲስቶች ምርመራዎችን አድርገው ነበር።
en-mt: After washing hands and drying them with paper towels, the total bacterial count was reduced by up to 76% on average on the fingers and by 77% on the palms of the hands. The scientists conducted tests to determine whether each type of drying method could contaminate other bathroom users and the bathroom environment.

sourceString: The jet-air dryer, which blows air out of the unit at claimed speeds of 180 m/s (650 km/h; 400 mph), was capable of blowing micro-organisms from the hands and the unit and potentially contaminating other washroom users and the washroom environment up to 2 metres away.
targetString: በአየር የሚሰራው ማድረቂያ፣ አየርን የሚተፋበት ፍጥነት 180 ሜ/ሰ (650 ኪ.ሜ/400 ማይል በሰዓት) ከእጆች እና ከመሣሪያው ውስጥ ረቂቅ ተሕዋስያንን የመፍታት እና ሌሎች የመታጠቢያ ክፍል ተጠቃሚዎችን እና የመታጠቢያ ክፍል አከባቢን እስከ 2 ሜትር ርቆ የመበከል አቅም ነበረው።
en-mt: The air-powered dryer, with an air velocity of 180 m/s (650 km/400 mph), was capable of dislodging microorganisms from hands and equipment and contaminating other bathroom users and the bathroom environment up to 2 meters away.

sourceString: Use of a warm-air hand dryer spread micro-organisms up to 0.25 metres from the dryer.
targetString: የሞቃት አየር ማድረቂያን መጠቀም ከማድረቂያው እስከ 0.25 ሜትር ድረስ ጥቃቅንተህዋሲያን ያሰራጫል።
en-mt: Using a hot air dryer spreads the germs up to 0.25 meters from the dryer.

sourceString: Paper towels showed no significant spread of micro-organisms.In 2005, in a study conducted by TÜV Produkt und Umwelt, different hand drying methods were evaluated.
targetString: የወረቀት ማድረቂያዎች ምንም አይተት የጥቃቅን-ተሕዋስያን መስፋፋት አላሳዩም። እ.ኤ.አ. በ 2005 በ TÃœV Produkt und Umwelt በተካሄደው ጥናት የተለያዩ የእጅ ማድረቂያ ዘዴዎች ተገምግመዋል።
en-mt: Paper dryers showed no sign of microbial growth. In the year In a 2005 study by TÃœV Produkt und Umwelt, various hand drying methods were evaluated.

sourceString: The following changes in the bacterial count after drying the hands were observed:
targetString: እጆች ከደረቁ በኋላ በባክቴሪያ ቆጠራ ውስጥ የሚከተሉት ለውጦች ተስተውለዋል።
en-mt: The following changes in bacterial counts were observed after hands were dried.

sourceString: Many different hand dryer manufacturers exist, and hand driers have been compared against drying with paper towels.
targetString: ብዙ የተለያዩ የእጅ ማድረቂያ አምራቾች ያሉ ሲሆን የእጅ ማድረቂያዎች በወረቀት ፎጣዎች ከማድረቅ ጋር ሲነፃፀሩ ነበር።
en-mt: There are many different manufacturers of hand dryers and hand dryers compared to drying with paper towels.

sourceString: Hand washing using hand sanitizing wipes is an alternative during traveling in the absence of soap and water.
targetString: ሳሙና እና ውሃ በማይኖርበት ወቅት በሚጓዙበት ጊዜ የእጅ ማጽጃዎችን በእጅ ማጠብ ሌላኛው አማራጭ ይሆናል።
en-mt: Another option is to hand wash hand sanitizers when traveling when soap and water are not available.

sourceString: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.
targetString: አልኮል ነክ የእጅ ማፅጃ ቢያንስ 60% አልኮል መያዝ አለበት።
en-mt: Alcohol-based hand sanitizer should contain at least 60% alcohol.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness (in 1846) in preventing disease in a hospital environment.
targetString: ሐንጋሪያዊው ሃኪም ኢግናዝ ሴሜልዌስ በሆስፒታል አካባቢ በሽታን የመከላከል ውጤታማነቱን (በ1846) ካገኘ ከረዥም ጊዜ በኋላ የህክምና እጅ ትጥበት ግዴታ ሆኗል።
en-mt: Medical handwashing became mandatory long after Hungarian physician Ignaz Semmelweis discovered its effectiveness in preventing disease in the hospital environment (in 1846).

sourceString: There are electronic devices that provide feedback to remind hospital staff to wash their hands when they forget.
targetString: የሆስፒታል ሠራተኞች እጃቸውን መታጠብ ሲረሱ እንዲታጠቡ ግብረ መልስ በመስጠት የሚያስታውሷቸው የኤሌክትሮክ መሣሪያዎች አሉ።
en-mt: There are electronic devices that remind hospital workers when they forget to wash their hands by giving them feedback.

sourceString: One study has found decreased infection rates with their use.
targetString: እነሱን ከመጠቀም ጋር በተያያዘ፥ ዝቅተኛ በበሽታ የመያዝ መጠንን አንድ ጥናት አግኝቷል።
en-mt: One study found lower infection rates associated with using them.

sourceString: Medical hand-washing is for a minimum of 15 seconds, using generous amounts of soap and water or gel to lather and rub each part of the hands.
targetString: የሕክምና እጅ-መታጠብ የሚከናወነው በትንሹ ለ 15 ሰከንዶች ያህል ሲሆን የእጆችን እያንዳንዱን ክፍል ለማዳረስና ለማሸት ሳሙና እና ውሃ ወይም ጄል በመጠቀም ይከናወናል።
en-mt: Therapeutic hand-washing is done for a minimum of 15 seconds, using soap and water or gel to reach and massage each part of the hands.

sourceString: Hands should be rubbed together with digits interlocking.
targetString: ጣቶችን በማጣመር እጆች መታሸት አለባቸው።
en-mt: Hands should be massaged by joining fingers.

sourceString: If there is debris under fingernails, a bristle brush may be used to remove it.
targetString: በጣት ጥፍሮች ውስጥ ቆሻሻ ካለ፥ ለማስወገድ በብሩሽ መጠቀም ይቻላል።
en-mt: If there is dirt in the fingernails, it can be removed with a brush.

sourceString: Since germs may remain in the water on the hands, it is important to rinse well and wipe dry with a clean towel.
targetString: ጀርሞች በውሃ ውስጥ በእጆች ላይ ሊቆዩ ስለሚችሉ በጥሩ ሁኔታ መጥረግ እና በንጹህ ፎጣ ማድረቅ አስፈላጊ ነው።
en-mt: Germs can remain on hands in water, so it's important to wipe them well and dry them with a clean towel.

sourceString: After drying, the paper towel should be used to turn off the water (and open any exit door if necessary).
targetString: ከደረቀ በኋላ የወረቀት ፎጣ በመጠቀም ውሃውን ይዝጉት (እና እንዳስፈላጊነቱ ማንኛውንም መውጫ በር ክፍት ያድርጉ)።
en-mt: After drying, shut off the water using a paper towel (and keep any exit doors open as needed).

sourceString: This avoids re-contaminating the hands from those surfaces.
targetString: ይህ እጆችን ከነዚያ ገጽታዎች እንደገና ከመበከል ይከላከላል።
en-mt: This prevents hands from re-contaminating those surfaces.

sourceString: The purpose of hand-washing in the health-care setting is to remove pathogenic microorganisms ("germs") and avoid transmitting them.
targetString: በጤና እንክብካቤ አከባቢው ውስጥ የእጅ መታጠብ ዓላማ በተዛማጅ ተህዋሲያን ረቂቅ ተሕዋስያንን ("ጀርሞች") ለማስወገድ እና እንዳይተላልፉ ማድረግ ነው።
en-mt: The purpose of hand washing in the health care environment is to remove and prevent transmission of associated microorganisms ("germs").

sourceString: The New England Journal of Medicine reports that a lack of hand-washing remains at unacceptable levels in most medical environments, with large numbers of doctors and nurses routinely forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thus transmitting microorganisms.
targetString: የ New England Journal of Medicine መጽሔት እንደዘገበው በአብዛኛዎቹ የህክምና አካባቢዎች እጅን መታጠብ ተቀባይነት በሌለው ደረጃ ላይ ሆኖ አእእደመሚቀቆየይ ሲሆን በዚህም ምክንያት ከፍተኛ ቁጥር ያላቸው ሐኪሞች እና ነርሶች ታካሚዎቻቸውን ከመንካታቸው በፊት እጆቻቸውን መታጠብ ይረሳሉ፣ ስለሆነም ጥቃቅን ህዋሳትን ያሰራጫሉ።
en-mt: According to the New England Journal of Medicine, handwashing remains an unacceptable practice in most medical settings, resulting in a large number of doctors and nurses forgetting to wash their hands before touching patients, thereby spreading germs.
